item.title: California blue whales are back from the brink of extinction.
item.dc:creator: bghoshqz
item.content:encoded: Researchers say there are 2,200 of these creatures, the largest mammals on the planet. That's 97% of historical levels; they were on the verge of being wiped out before a 1966 ban on whaling. There are so many blue whales now, they face a new challenge: collisions with ships.

item.title: Somalia on alert as al-Shabab names a new leader.
item.dc:creator: bghoshqz
item.content:encoded: The national security minister said there was evidence the terrorist group was planning attacks, in revenge for the killing of Ahmed Abdi Godane in a US airstrike. Al-Shabab named Abu Ubeid Ahmed Omar his successor.

item.title: Ukraine ceasefire seems to be holding.
item.dc:creator: bghoshqz
item.content:encoded: Leaders of both countries promised spoke on the phone about ways to keep the truce going. But Moscow said it "will react" if the US and European countries impose new sanctions.

item.title: Wanted: 20,000 grocery workers.
item.dc:creator: bghoshqz
item.content:encoded: Kroger, the largest supermarket chain in the US, said it needs to speed up hiring to manage growth, raising its sales force to 375,000. The company has more than 2,600 stores nationwide.

item.title: For the first time, poll shows Scots favor independence from UK.
item.dc:creator: bghoshqz
item.content:encoded: With less than two weeks to go before the Scottish referendum, a newpoll haspro-independencevoters ahead for the first timeby51% to 49%. This represents a dramatic turnaround: a month ago, the vote was 39% to 61%.

item.title: A new King of Kong.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: Robbie Lakeman has achievedthe world record for the highest-ever score on Donkey Kong, taking it from Hank Chien, a plastic surgeon who held the title for almostfour years. Lakeman called Chien personally to break the news. You can watch the record being broken on Twitch.

item.title: US launches airstrikes to safeguard an Iraqi dam.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: The strikes areto prevent militants from the Islamic State seizing the Haditha Dam. The dam sits onthe Euphrates River and officials fearthe possibility of Baghdad being deliberately flooded. President Obama is also preparing to present a case for broader military action.

item.title: A by-the-numbers breakdown of dirty money around the world.
item.dc:creator: tmcbeeqz
item.content:encoded: The global economy loses at least $1.18 trillion every year to corruption, representing roughly 0.6% of global GDP.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/261098/chart-the-trillion-dollars-the-global-economy-loses-every-year-to-corruption/

item.title: Japan's shrinking economy.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The country's second-quarter GDP plunge was revised down even further, to a 7.1% decline from 6.8%, as prime minister Shinzo Abe's tax hikehurt even more than expected. The shrinkage was due to a drop in both capital expenditure and consumer spending,putting pressure on the central bank to expand its stimulus program.

item.title: Encouraging signs for an Ebola vaccine.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: GlaxoSmithKlines experimental vaccine was fully successful in trials on monkeys, according to findings published by Nature Medicine, clearing the way for human tests. The World Health Organization says preventive treatments for health workers in affected areas of West Africacould be ready in a month.

item.title: China's trade surplus sets a new record.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: The worlds second-largest economy reported a record trade surplus of nearly $50 billion, as foreign salesroseby a better-than-expected 9.4% whileimports decreased by 2.4%. The new datasuggest that Chinese manufacturersare benefitting from Beijing's stimulus, butconsumers are not spending as freely as before.

item.title: The end of an era at GE.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: GE has sold the century-old business unit that developedsome of the world's first washing machines and toaster ovens. Sweden's Electrolux paid $3.3 billion for the business, disposed as part of GE's plan to"reshape and focus its portfolio" to emphasize industrial products over consumer goods.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: This is GE's first electric toaster, the model D-12, from 1905: [caption id="attachment_261328" align="alignleft" width="320"] Just add bread.[/caption]

item.title: Will and Kate are pregnant again.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: "Their Royal Highnesses The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are very pleased to announce that The Duchess of Cambridge is expecting their second child," the monarchy said in a statement. As with her first pregnancy, the former Kate Middleton is suffering from hyperemesis gravidarum, an extreme form of morning sickness.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The announcement of the pregnancy during the run-up to Scotland's independence vote inspired a number of witty rejoinderson Twitter. [caption id="attachment_261378" align="alignnone" width="320"] [/caption] [caption id="attachment_261377" align="alignnone" width="320"] [/caption] [caption id="attachment_261376" align="alignnone" width="320"] [/caption]

item.title: Signs of life in Spain's housing market.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: Prices in Spain's hard-hit housing market posted an annual gainfor the first time since 2008. This comes among other encouraging signs of a long-delayed economic recovery, but don't popopenthe cava just yetthe average house price remains nearly 40% below its peak, and by some measures is still overvalued.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: [caption id="attachment_261336" align="alignnone" width="640"] [/caption]

item.title: The ceasefire in Ukraine is looking shaky.
item.dc:creator: tmcbeeqz
item.content:encoded: Ukrainian president Petro Poroshenko said he would secure the defense offrontline city Mariupolon his visit there today. The truceagreed on Sept. 5 between Kiev and pro-Russian rebelsappears shaky, after a second night of fightingnear Donetsk airport and the city ofMariupol. The UN now puts the death toll at over 3,000, including the victims of the MH-17 crash.

item.title: Tesla extends an olive branch to Toyota.
item.dc:creator: isenqz
item.content:encoded: Elon Musk, the electric car maker'schief executive, remarked in Tokyothat he would not be surprised if there was a significant deal with Toyota and Tesla." Tesla has madebatteries for some of Toyota'sRAV4 electric vehicles, but that program is winding down and the two companies have been at odds about their approach to electric vehicles.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: With its plans to build its first hydrogen fuel-cell car next year, Toyota took a different road fromMusk,who hascalled the fuel cell approach "bullshit." At Aspen in June, Toyota Manufacturings North American CEOOsamu Nagatasaid: "Gas-powered hybrid is still the most reliable and realistic solution. Hydrogen vehicles require another decade or two decades to become more popular. And battery technology requires another round of innovation to improve their range."

item.title: The prospect of Scottish independence spooks the markets
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/261355/scottish-independence-is-a-real-possibility-and-the-markets-are-spooked/

item.title: Switzerland might give Edward Snowden safe haven.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: The country's attorney-general has ruled that, were the NSA whistleblower invitedto Switzerland to testify about US government surveillance, he probably wouldn't be extradited to the US and might be able to seek asylum too. The official opinion says Switzerland doesn't extradite people for "political" offenses, Swiss media reported.

item.title: Al-Shabaab retaliates for the killing of its leader.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: The militant groupsent car bombs to blow up an African Union peacekeeping convoy and Somali government vehicles on a road near Mogadishu, after a US airstrike killed its leader, Ahmed Abdi Godane, last week.The attacks killed 12; al-Shabaab claims four Americans are among them, though there's been no other confirmation so far.

item.title: Billions of dollars are flying out of Brazil.
item.dc:creator: bghoshqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/261365/how-billions-are-sneaking-out-of-brazil-and-harming-development/

item.title: NASA will send your tweets into space.
item.dc:creator: bghoshqz
item.content:encoded: The 50 best tweets and InstaGram images with the hashtag #AsteroidMission will be included in the time capsule on the spacecraft known as OSIRIS-REx, which will launch in 2016. Participants must muse on the future of communications and space travel. Tweeting in Klingon is unlikely to give you an edge.

item.title: Obama's campaign against the Islamic State will take three years.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: It will last beyond the president's term in office, reports the New York Times(paywall). The current air offensive in Iraq represents the first phase. The second includes training and equipping Iraqi and Kurdish forces; the third, taking on IS forces in Syria. Obama will announce his new "game plan" against IS in a speech on Wednesday.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The new United Nations human rightschief, who is also the first Muslim to hold the position, said that IS fighters in were trying to create a "house of blood" by targeting minorities,and urged world powers to focus on ending the conflict.

item.title: Ebola is escalating in Liberia.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The World Health Organization says the epidemic is spreading fast in Liberia, with thousands of new cases expected over the next three weeks. The country has more Ebola patients than there are beds at treatment centers, leading to people being turned away. As a result, the UN agency says efforts to control the outbreak are "not having an adequate impact."

item.title: Iraqi parliament votes in a new cabinet.
item.dc:creator: bghoshqz
item.content:encoded: After weeks of political horse-trading, prime minister Haider al-Abadi's team is still lacking ministers for defense and interior. His divisive predecessor, Nouri al-Maliki, is one of three vice-presidents.

item.title: The EU approves new Russia sanctions but holds them in reserve.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: The new measures will limit(paywall) three big Russian oil firms'ability to raise money on European markets, but won't take effect for a few days(pdf)which means, effectively, no new sanctions as long as the ceasefire in eastern Ukraine doesn't collapse completely.

item.title: The iPhone 6 release is going to give a massive boost to air cargo.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/262064/asian-freight-carriers-are-licking-their-lips-at-the-expected-release-of-the-new-iphone-6/

item.title: Yep, Home Depot was hacked.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: It doesn't appear that customers' personal identification numbers were compromised, but the UShome-improvements retailer said its payment security system was in fact breachedat more than 2,000 stores in the US and Canada, confirming reports that surfaced last week. The store saw its shares drop 3 percent on the news.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: So what happens to stolen credit card data? Sometimes, it ends up in plain view, on data resale websites like these.

item.title: Big Cereal goes natural.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: General Mills, maker of Cheerios and Yoplait will pay $820 million in cashfor theorganic food company Annie's, offeringa 37% premium over Monday's closing price. Organic brands are seen as an opportunity for large food companiesfaced withsluggish growth prospects.

item.title: A nine-year prison term for insider trading that netted $275 million.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Matthew Martoma, a portfolio manager for SAC Capital Advisors (now Point72 Asset Management), was sentenced for his part in the most lucrative insider trading scheme in US history, which reaped huge profits from illegal trades on pharmaceutical stocks.

item.title: British retail is perking up.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: A surge in clothing and shoe purchases in August lifted retail spending by 2.7% froma year ago. But there was little good news for Tesco, Britain's biggest retailer, which continued to lose market share to both down-and up-market rivals.

item.title: Ikea puts together a solid quarter.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The privately-held furniture giant's sales for the year toAugust were up 5.9% at 28.7 billion ($37 billion), withlike-for-like salesup3.6%. China is the company's fastest-growing market but Ikeasaid the US and Europe were also performing well.

item.title: Google's EU antitrust deal is looking shaky.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Regulators wantGoogle to amend a preliminary deal that was reached in February, after Microsoft and other European competitors complained that itwas overly generous to the US search giant. The EU is now pushing Google to make deeper changes to its search algorithm to give competing services a higher billing, and has begun a preliminary investigation of its Android smartphone operating system.

item.title: A Japanese e-commerce firm makes further inroads into the US.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Rakuten, which has already bought online retailers Buy.com and Play.com, has agreed to acquiree-commerce rebatecompany Ebates for$1 billion. The deal is part of a wave of global investments made by Japanese companies lookingfor growth beyond their stagnant home market.

item.title: First results of the investigation into the MH17 crash.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: The Malaysia Airlines flight that was shot down overeastern Ukraine in July broke into pieces in the air after it was damagedby "a large number of high-energy objects," according to a preliminary report bythe Dutch Safety Board. Investigatorsdid not attempt to assign blame, but the report'sfindings are consistent with the leading theory that MH17 was brought down by a ground-to-air missile.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
A key passage from the full report (pdf):
As yet it has not been possible to conduct a detailed study of the wreckage. However, the available images show that the pieces of wreckage were pierced in numerous places. The pattern of damage to the aircraft fuselage and the cockpit is consistent with that which may be expected from a large number of high-energy objects that penetrated the aircraft from outside. Its likely that this damage resulted in a loss of structural integrity of the aircraft, leading to an in-flight break up. This also explains the abrupt end to the data registration on the recorders, the simultaneous loss of contact with air traffic control and the aircraft's disappearance from radar.

item.title: Greenhouse gases hit an all-time high.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: In particular, levelsof carbon dioxide grew at the fastest rate ever in 2013, according to the World Meteorological Organization, reaching 396 parts per million, up 2.9 ppm from 2012. Pleading ignorance can no longer be an excuse for not acting, said WMO secretary-general Michel Jarraud.

item.title: UK leaders scramble to keep the Kingdom united.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: Another poll of likely voters calledthe Scottish independence referendum a statistical dead heat. In response, pro-unionparties all backed a plan unveiled by former prime minister Gordon Brown for the devolution of more powers to Scotland if it remains part of the UK. The pro-independence campaign says the plan smacks of "utter panic."

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Prime minister David Cameron, deputy prime minister Nick Clegg (leader of the Liberal Democrats), and Labour leader Ed Miliband will all skip the weekly Prime Minister's Questionsat parliament on Wednesday. Instead, they will travel toScotland to tryto win back voters, according to a joint statement:
There is a lot that divides us - but there's one thing on which we agree passionately: the United Kingdom is better together. That's why all of us are agreed the right place for us to be tomorrow is in Scotland, not at Prime Minister's Questions in Westminster. We want to be listening and talking to voters about the huge choices they face. Our message to the Scottish people will be simple: 'We want you to stay.' David Cameron, Ed Miliband and Nick Clegg.

item.title: Apple's big reveal.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: Todays event has begun.Here's how to watch it, but if you're having trouble with the live stream, try The Verge's live blog, instead.Apple is expected to unveil newiPhones with larger screens, some sort of wearable device, and a new mobile-payments systemthat some say will kill credit cards.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: So what exactly goes into these staged events by Apple?A lot, writes Quartz's Dan Frommer, who hasdone a breakdown of Apple keynotes in recent years: [caption id="attachment_261266" align="alignnone" width="640"] [/caption]

item.title: Kashmir faces the worst rainfall in 50 years.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: 420 people have been killed and thousands are trapped on rooftops after flash floodingcaught the authorities unprepared. The disaster isa test for bothIndian prime minister Narendra Modi, for whom it'shis first humanitarian emergency, andPakistani prime minister Nawaz Sharif, who is under pressure to resign over claims of election fraud.

item.title: Atlantic City is losing more casinos.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: Trump Entertainment Resorts is filing for bankruptcy (again) this week, adding tothe swelling ranks of Atlantic Citycasinos in danger of closing. Three have already shutthis year as gambling has expanded in neighboring states;the Trump closurescould bring the total jobs lost this year to 10,000, one-fifth of the city's workforce.

item.title: People almost everywhere think the economy is terrible.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: A Pew Research Center survey of people in 44 countries confirms that most nations are gloomyabout their economic conditions andprospects. But it wasn't all bad. Countries with a preponderanceof optimists over pessimists included Germany, Israel, China, andmore intriguinglyUganda, Nicaragua, and Bangladesh.

item.title: Apple unveils a smartwatch.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The Apple Watch was billed as a timepiece, small computer, and"health and fitness device." It sports an unusual interface and, in a nod to fashion, six interchangeablebands. But the watch doesn't go on sale until next year. The company also revealed the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus, which are thinnerbut not that much thinnerand have larger screensthan their predecessors.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: [caption id="attachment_262381" align="alignnone" width="640"] [/caption] The phones havea new sensor, new processor, and improved camera. The iPhone 6 starts at $199 with a two-year cellular contract, and the base level iPhone 6 Plus is $299. Both go on sale on Sept. 19. (Our complete guide to the iPhone 6 has more details.) Apple Watch starts at $349. The company also unveiled Apple Pay for conducting credit card transactions with the new phones and watchbut only in the US. Apple shares are now in the redafter initially rising on the news, but that is on track with most launch days. The company's usual marketing prowess failed when itslive stream of the eventcrashed for many people. Here's a90-second video withhighlights from the presentation: https://www.youtube.com/embed/jKkxKAdebho

item.title: The slow improvement in the US job market continues.
item.dc:creator: mattphillipsqz
item.content:encoded: US hiring in July rose to 4.87 million, the best level since late 2007.While the data is somewhat stalethe August US jobs report last week showed a somewhat disappointing 142,000 jobs were createdthe numbers from the so-called Job Openings and Labor Turnover (JOLTs) report(PDF)confirm the underlying trend of slow improvement in the US labor market.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: [caption id="attachment_262330" align="aligncenter" width="640"] [/caption]

item.title: Let's not forget about the iPod and its role in Apple's resurgence.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/263306/a-memorial-for-the-classic-ipod-which-changed-apples-fortunes-forever/

item.title: Hacking: Bitcoin edition.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The email of Satoshi Nakamoto, the founder of bitcoin, has been hacked. The hacker, known as "Jeffery," is threatening to release secrets and even information on Nakamoto's shielded identity if someone transfers 25 bitcoin (the equivalent of around $12,000) to him.

item.title: Microsoft, meet Minecraft.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: This is going to be an interesting culture clash: Microsoft is nearing a deal to buy Mojang AB, the Swedish company that created the Minecraft video game, for more than $2 billion,the Wall Street Journalreported(paywall). The deal, which could reignite Microsoft's Xbox game business, may be signed as early as this week, according to the WSJ'sanonymous source.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Minecraft went live in May 2009; by June 2014 it had sold 54 million copies on all platforms. It has spawned books, conferences(and even scam conferences), a Hollywood movie-in-the-making, and a near-perfectdigital facsimile of Denmark.

item.title: Will Obama call for bombing Syria?
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The US president will deliver a speech on Wednesday outlining his strategy against the Islamic State. He has already signaled he might authorize airstrikes without congressional approval, and a new poll shows most Americans would support them, while another poll shows growing (albeit still minority) support for a more active US foreign policy in general.

item.title: Jamie Dimon is doing well.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The JPMorgan Chase CEO is "feeling fine" duringhis treatment for throat cancer, said Marianne Lake, the bank's chief financial officer. Dimon disclosed his diagnosis on July 1 and said he would undergo eight weeks of treatment. With his travel curtailed, he appears to have more time to work closely with his executive team.

item.title: Greenhouse gases hit an all-time high.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: Levelsof carbon dioxide grew at the fastest rate ever in 2013, according to the World Meteorological Organization,reaching 396 parts per million, up 2.9 ppm from 2012. Pleading ignorance can no longer be an excuse for not acting, said the WMOshead.

item.title: The internet is slowing down.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Or will seem to today, if youre usingone of the sites (including Netflix, Etsy, Reddit, and WordPress) taking part in a protest against proposed US rules allowing telecoms to create slow and fast lanes. The sites wont actually load more slowly; theyll just pretend to with spinning wheel of death icons.

item.title: Venezuelas state oil company is selling Citgo.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: PDVSA is seekingoffers for its US refinery and storage business, according to Reuters, in a deal that could be worth $10 billion. Venezuela is suffering severe cash flow problems, althoughthe governmentdenies this.

item.title: Chinadownplays foreign firms' crackdown concerns.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Premier Li Keqiang tried to assure multinationals that recent antitrust investigations arenotsingling out non-Chinesecompanies. He told a group of CEOs at the "Summer Davos" conference in Tianjin, Chinathatonly 10% of investigated companies are foreign.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: "I feel concerned that you are actually concerned," Li toldforeign executives. "China's door has opened, and it will never be closed again."

item.title: Superstar DJs are making mistakes on purpose
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Thepractice known as "miss-mixing" is a way for DJs toto prove they are actually mixing songs livein an era when software can substitute for artistry. Those whose performances are suspiciously perfect may be labeled "sync button DJs.

item.title: The Libyan parliaments new home is a ferry.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Legislators aretaking refugein a Greek ship anchored in a remote port city, after Islamists and their allies captured Tripoli and Benghazi.

item.title: Alibaba's IPO order book is full.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The Chinese internet giant has already received enough ordersto cover its entire offering, according to Reuters. TheIPOis likely to best Facebook as the biggest tech offering ever, at$21.1 billion, and if underwriters exercise an option to sell additional shares it could raise up to $24.3 billion, making it the most lucrative IPO of any kind.

item.title: Santander's chairman dies.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The board of the the euro zone's largest bank by market capitalization will meet to appoint a new chairman after Emilio Botnpassed away overnight. Botndied of a heart attack, aged79. He joined Santander in the late 1950s, and became the third family member to runthe bank; under his watch Santander transformed itself from a small, regional lender into a global player.

item.title: John Kerry lands in Baghdad.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The US secretary of state is in the Middle East tobuild political, financial, and military support to combatthe Islamic State. He will meet with the countrysnew Shiite prime minister, Haider al-Abadi, to encourage him tobe inclusive towards Sunnis.

item.title: Obama calls for bombing Islamic State forces in Syria.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The US president will make a prime-time address about his plans to expand the fight against the extremistgroup, but he is still searching for waysto enlist regional allies and avoid helping Syrianpresident Bashar al-Assad.

item.title: The EU puts the foxes in charge of the henhouse.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: The European Commission's new executive line-up makes France responsible for economic affairs and gives the UK oversight of financial regulation.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Former French finance minster Pierre Moscovici will be the economic affairs commissioner, where he is expected to push for less austerity and more growth-friendly policies. Somewhat awkwardly, earlier today France said it will miss its deficit target for next year. The UK's commissioner, Jonathan Hill, was given the financial services portfolio, an important concession toLondon's powerful financial lobby, as the countrywavers over whether it wants to be in the EU at all.

item.title: Filipino Muslims could soon have their own autonomous zone.
item.dc:creator: isenqz
item.content:encoded: President Benigno Aquino III proposed a self-governingregion in the southern island of Mindanao, to be called Bangsamoro. The move, supported by the US and Western governments, ispart of a peacedeal withthe country's largest Muslim insurgent group,after 13 years of negotiations to end a four-decade-long rebellion.

item.title: Carl's Jr. is joining India's "burger revolution."
item.dc:creator: isenqz
item.content:encoded: The US fast food chain's parent company signed a development agreement with the capital-based Cybiz BrightStar Restaurants to open100 Carls Jr. burger restaurants in India, with talk of another 1,000 to come.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Sam Chopra, group chairman and founder of CybizCorp, calls India's current hunger for burgers "a parallel phenomena that was witnessed in the pizzas and pasta category a decade back." The chain will also offer Indians vegetarian options.

item.title: Will Obama authorize airstrikes in Syria?
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The US president will speakat 9pm US eastern timeabout his plans to expand the fight against the Islamic State, as hepresses to enlistregional allies and avoid inadvertently strengtheningSyrianpresident Bashar al-Assad's regime. Obama previously told Congress members he did not need them to authorize his strategy, which could include expanded operationsin Iraq and potentially Syria.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Anew poll shows as many as71% of Americans would support airstrikes in Iraq and Syria, while anotherpollshows growing (albeit still minority) support fora more active US foreign policy overall.

item.title: David Cameron is down on his knees.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: Ahead of the independence referendum in eight days, the Britishprime ministerappeared close to tears as he toldScots he would be "heartbroken ifthis family of nations ... was torn apart." Cameron, along with the leaders of the twoother major parties, isinScotland to tryto cajolevoters out of seceding, after polls showed a possible win for theyes vote, and the pound slumped.

item.title: The Ebola death toll jumped by 200 in one day.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The World Health Organization announced that the death toll from the Ebola outbreak hit 2,296, risingby nearly 200 in just a day. There were 4,293 recorded cases as of Sept. 6, but that number doesn't reflectfigures for Liberia, which is believed to have thousands more.

item.title: Dollar General takes its Family Dollar bid to the next level.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: Dollar Generalis taking its$9.1 billion Family Dollar takeover bid directly to Family Dollar'sshareholders. Dollar General warned it would do so if the revised bid, whichoffered to pay a $500 million penaltyto allayFamily Dollar's antitrust concerns, was rejected by the takeover target'smanagement.

item.title: Combatants are stepping back in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: Russia has withdrawn more than two-thirds of its troops from Ukraine, according to Ukrainian president Petro Poroshenko, even as Russian president Vladimir Putin continues to deny any involvement in theconflict. An additional wave of European Union sanctions against Russiahave been put on hold.

item.title: Toyota is finally embracing Mexico.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The automaker is scoutingthe countryfor possible sites to opennewfactory plants, sources told Bloomberg. Toyota is the onlyremainingmajor auto producer globally to not have afull assembly plantin Mexico, whichotherautomakers have flocked have embraced becauseof attractive trade agreements, cheap labor, and proximity to the giant US market.

item.title: The ozone layer is slowly recovering.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: Earth's threatened ozone layer, which is responsible for blocking harmful solar radiation, has been subject to decades of destruction, until now.For the first time in 35 years, theozone layer is showing its first sign of thickening, according to a new United Nations study. The discovery is a victory for international advocates working together to combat climate change.

item.title: Google's antitrust headache starts all over again.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: A settlement with EU antitrust authorities that took five years to reachand which rivals thought too soft onGooglewon't be finalized(paywall) before the EU shuffles commissioners at the end of October. A new probeinto whether Google is abusing its effective monopoly in web searchis likely to be more aggressive.

item.title: Could brunch be a golden ticket for McDonald's?
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The maker of the Egg McMuffin has applied to trademark the term "McBrunch," provoking speculation that there's a new front in the fast food breakfast wars. McDonald's applied for the same trademark in 2001 but never used it, and says it isn'ttesting any kind of brunch concept now, either.

item.title: Obama orders air strikes in Syria.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The US president will expand the US military campaign against the Islamic State, including attacks withinSyria. Saudi Arabia has also agreed to provide a base to train moderate Sunni opposition fighters.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
In a primetime address on the eve of the September 11 anniversary, Obama vowed to hunt down IS fighters "wherever they are. ... That means I will not hesitate to take action against ISIL in Syria, as well as Iraq. This is a core principle of my presidency: if you threaten America, you will find no safe haven."
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KvRd17vXaXM

item.title: China's domestic demand falls short again.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Beijing'splan to save the economy by stoking consumer spendingis onshaky ground. Consumer prices rose only 2% in August from a year earlier, down from 2.3% in July and well below the governments target rate of 3.5%; producer pricesalso fell for the 30th consecutive month.

item.title: Google bought an intelligent spoon company.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Lift Labs makes an eating device for people with Parkinsonsand other tremor-causing ailments; financial terms of the deal were not disclosed. Google co-founder Sergey Brin has a genetic mutation that puts him at risk for the disease.

item.title: The Atlantic hurricane season is eerily quiet.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: For the first time since 2000, there areno named storms in the Atlantic at what is statistically the most dangerous time of the year.

item.title: China is urging the Dalai Lama to respect reincarnation.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Its part of a power struggle between Beijing and the Tibetan Buddhist leader. The Dalai Lama said in an interview earlier this week that he does not see the need for a successor; in Tibetan Buddhism's ancient history, the institution of the Dalai Lama only dates back to 1391.

item.title: Indias best tech schools produce more entrepreneurs than the Ivy League
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

item.title: Allegations of torture in Thailand.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Human rights groups Amnesty International and Thai Lawyers for Human Rights claim tohave evidence that the military tortured detainees afterenacting martial law in May. The groups accuse the army of staging mock executions, among other abuses; the junta saidit found no evidence of torture.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Much more widespread, says the report,is the "climate of fear and a culture of enforced silence" created by the arbitrary detention of more than600 people. Human Rights Watch reported on the "enforced disappearance" of an opposition leader last week.

item.title: Scottish banks look south.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: RBS and LloydsScotland's biggest bankswould both move south of the border if Scotland votes to secede next week; some analysts expect them to moveto England even if Scots vote to keep the union together. The banks say they are reacting to investor concerns about an independent Scotland: shares in both companiesrose in early trading.

item.title: China wants help controlling the internet.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Lu Wei, Chinas top internet regulator, called for governments around the world to join together and impose more rules on the internet in order to ensure its continued growth. "Every car has brakes," he told a World Economic Forum meeting in Tianjin. Freedom and order, they are twins.

item.title: People are always down about the economy.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/263401/humans-are-always-down-about-the-economy-in-three-charts/

item.title: Good luck with this one, Ghana.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: The countrywill seek to sell at least $1 billion of government debt today at 8.375%, or 539 basis points over US Treasurys. That sky-high yielddouble the premium for African bonds in general, and with an unusual 11-and-a-half year maturitycouldtempt investors, but they should probably becagey giventhe country just asked the IMF for a bailout.

item.title: Oscar Pistorius is not guilty of murder.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: Butthe 27-year-old South African athlete might still face a manslaughter convictionfor killing his girlfriend, Reeva Steenkamp, in 2013. The judge adjournedthe court until Fridayto finish reading her lengthy verdict.

item.title: The EU and US impose sanctions on Russia.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: The US will join the EU in imposinga new set of sanctions on Russiaaimed at punishing Moscow for its perceived role in destabilizing eastern Ukraine. The EU's measures, trailed earlier this weekandtaking effect tomorrow (pdf), will limit the ability of state-controlled oil firms to raise funds in Europe and bar European companies fromselling the technology necessary to tap Russia's arctic, deep-water, and shale reserves, while the US will outline details of its next steps tomorrow.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Respondingto reticence from Finland, Slovakia, and others, the EU stressed that it stood ready to "amend, suspend, or repeal" the sanctions if the ceasefire in Ukraine proved lasting. These are the details of the new measures (pdf).

item.title: In Japan, Burger King dresses its beef in black.
item.dc:creator: snarulaqz
item.content:encoded: The fast food chain has just introduced a "black burger," to be released nationwide in Japan(for a limited time)on Sept. 19. It's aversion of an item Burger King sold there in 2012.The buns and cheese are blackened with bamboo charcoal, while the patties are darkened with black pepper and dressed with a squid ink sauce.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: [caption id="attachment_263848" align="alignleft" width="320"] The Kuro Diamond comes with lettuce and tomato[/caption]

item.title: Big banks tell Scotland, "no."
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: RBS and LloydsScotland's biggest banksare threatening to relocate to London if Scotland votes to secede next week, in fear of financial uncertainty.The announcement comes hours after a poll showed a tiny lead for those in favor of staying in the union. Clydesdale Bank and insurer and asset manager Standard Life arealso eyeing a move south.

item.title: The Arab world is joining the fight against IS.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: Ten Arab states told US secretary of state John Kerry that they would join the US in its war againstthe Islamic State, wherever it is, including in both Iraq and Syria. Kerry is in Saudi Arabia seeking military, logistical, and intelligence support from Arab states, as well as help winning the goodwillof Arab people toward the cause.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: While the coalitionwiththe US grows, Syrian and Iranian officials haveslammed the Obama administration for excluding them.Meanwhile, Russia saidmilitary action without a UN Security Council resolution would be a "violation of international law."

item.title: Radioshack airs its woes.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The electronics retailer made its deteriorating financesvery public in a filing today, which essentially said the companyis running out of cash(paywall). Radioshack mayend up in bankruptcy courtif things don't improve, but in the meantime itis looking for ways to perk up its balance sheet, perhaps witha sale or a recapitalization.

item.title: The UN peacekeepers captured in Golan Heights are safe.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The 45 Fijian United Nationspeacekeepers that were capturedtwo weeks agoby the al-Qaeda-affiliated al-Nusra Front in the Syrian Golan Heights have been released, the UN says. The peacekeepers,grabbedduringclashes between rebel and Syrian government forces,appearedunharmedwhen they arrivedin Israeli-held territory. It is unclear whether a deal was struck for their release.

item.title: Scotland is giving Catalonia ideas.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: Separatist groups around the world aredrawing inspiration from Scotland's independence vote(paywall)even though pro-unionist Scots have retaken a narrow lead ahead of next week's election. Up to 2 million peopledemonstrated inthe Catalonian capital,Barcelona, yesterdayto demand their own secession vote, though Spain is likely to block a proposedNov. 9 referendum.

item.title: Argentina has a plan to dodge a US court ruling on its debt.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The country's Congress hasapproved a proposal to pay back foreign creditors outside the reaches of a US court. The plan has beencalled illegal by the US judgewhobanned Argentinafrom paying back its more recent loans before it settles withthe holdoutcreditors fromthe country's 2002 default. That ruling forced Argentina into another default in July.

item.title: The Apple Watch keynote really was the Tim Cook show.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/263965/was-apple-watch-keynote-good-enough/

item.title: Arabic gamers can now delve the linguistic complexities of "Guitar Hero."
item.dc:creator: isenqz
item.content:encoded: With billions to be made in the Middle Eastern gaming industry, game console makers have finally given Arabic speakers what they've been asking for: Arabic language add-onsfor popular games. Sony and Microsoft announced the packs at Games 14 in Dubai, the regions largest video games convention.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Not everyvideo game is worth translating into Arabic, said Paul Johnson, senior manager at the regional distributor Pluto Games. You have to be careful over which games you decide to localise, he said. Anything that has nudity, sexual themes, drug use and alcohol, obviously is a no-no. Theyre not going to localise Grand Theft Auto any time soon.

item.title: Tech has become a lot cooler at Harvard since Mark Zuckerberg's undergrad days.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/264044/intro-to-computer-science-is-now-the-most-popular-course-at-harvard/

item.title: Yahoo shows some scars from its US privacy battle.
item.dc:creator: isenqz
item.content:encoded: According to unsealed court documents, the US government threatened to fine the tech firm$250,000 a day in 2008 if it refusedan order to hand over large swaths of user data, which the company arguedwas unconstitutional. Yahoo lost its challenge to the order, and a subsequent appeal.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
The defeats in the secretive foreign intelligence surveillance courtmeant Yahoowasforced to participate in the NSAs controversial PRISM program, which gave the government extensive access to online communicationsthe program exposed by whistleblower Edward Snowden and shut down in 2011. In a blog post, Yahoo's general counsel, Ron Bell, says the company fought for today's document release:
We consider this an important win for transparency, and hope that these records help promote informed discussion about the relationship between privacy, due process, and intelligence gathering.
Bell said Yahoo will makethe complete 1,500 pages of information available online.

item.title: Big donations for Ebola research.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen gave$9 million to support the fight against the disease thats ravaging west Africa. Earlier this week the Bill and Melinda Gates foundation pledged $50 million to help stem the outbreak.

item.title: Carl Icahn made inroads into Hertz.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Three of the activist investorsnominees gained seatson the rental car companys board, boosting its share prices in after-hours trading. Less than a month ago Icahnbecamethe companys largest shareholder, and at the beginning of the week heforced out itschairman and CEO.

item.title: Facebook gets a thumbs-down in China.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The social network cannot haveaccess to the worlds biggestinternet market any time soon, the countrys top internet regulator said on the sidelines of a World Economic Forum event in Tianjin.

item.title: Scotland swung back toward a No vote.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: A new YouGov poll showed supporters of maintaining the unionhave regaineda 52-48% lead. The pollster's previous survey was the first to show the pro-independence camp in the lead, so the reversal is significant.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
YouGov president Peter Kellner explained the reversal on the company blog:
Responses to two questions tell us why Yes has now slipped back, albeit only slightly: it remains at a much higher level than at any point up to late August. We regularly ask people how they think independence would affect Scotlands economy and their families own finances. During the Yes surge, optimism rose sharply and pessimism declined. Just one week ago, Scots divided evenly on whether their country would be better or worse off. Now, the pessimists, 48% (up six since last week), clearly outnumber the optimists, 37% (down three). And the proportion who think that they personally would be worse off under independence is up as much as eight points in a week, to 45% - the highest in a series that goes back to last December.

item.title: For thecamel who has everything.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Aform-fitting leotard is being developed to helpprize animalsrace faster and stand taller.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Al Shibla, a company previously known for its upmarket camel beauty supplies,is branching out and selling apparel. [caption id="attachment_264183" align="alignleft" width="640"] Does this come in slim-fit?[/caption]

item.title: Uber and Lyft's carpooling scheme is illegal in California.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The state's public utilities commission has ruled that the start-ups are violating the complicated laws regulating car services, dealing a blow to their newly launched ride sharing programs. As Recode notes, bothUber and its bitter competitor Lyftare known for acting first and dealing with regulations later.

item.title: Oscar Pistorius is guilty of "culpable homicide."
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: A judge has ruled that the South African sprinter known as "Bladerunner" killed his girlfriend accidentally, but acted negligently:"A reasonable person, with a similar disability, would have foreseen that the person behind the door would be killed, and the accused failed to take action to avoid this."

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Pistorius now faces a maximum of 15 years in prison, although sentencing isn't expected for another six weeks. The athlete was also found guilty of firing a gun in a restaurant on a separate occasion, but was acquitted of pre-meditated murder and a second weapons charge.

item.title: Russia opts for growth over the ruble.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The country's central bank left its benchmark interest rate untouched, as the need to support the stagnant economy trumpedpressureto stem rising inflationcaused in part by Russia's ban on Western food imports. The economic doldrums were brought on by Western sanctions, which were ratcheted up today by the US.

item.title: A bigsolar flarehits Earth.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Power grids and satellitetransmissions may experience irregularities, but there will be an upside: the aurora borealis will expand. Residents of northern New England, Canada, and the Pacific Northwest should have a good view.

item.title: Scotland swings back toward a No vote.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

item.title: A prisoner exchange inUkraine.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Government and rebel forces gave upmore than a dozenprisonerseach as part of a tenuousceasefire agreement. Rocket fire was heard from Donetsk soon after the swap had ended, putting the trucein doubt.

item.title: Pakistan says it has nabbed the men who shot Malala Yousafzai.
item.dc:creator: isenqz
item.content:encoded: The Pakistani schoolgirl and education activist who stood up to the Taliban in her region has become an international celebrity since she was shot in 2012 on her way home from school, at the age of 14. Pakistani army representatives toldpress that they had arrested members of a smallterrorist group called Shura, affiliated with the Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan.

item.title: Rejecting Apple Pay, Wal-Mart will develop its own payment system.
item.dc:creator: bghoshqz
item.content:encoded: As the world's largest retailer, Wal-Mart has access to far more people than own iPhones, and its payment system will be a formidable challenger. Apple says other big chains, like McDonalds and Bloomingdales, have signed up for Apple Pay.

item.title: the-decline-of-chinese-department-stores-department-store-sales-growth-vs-previous-year_chartbuilder
