item.title: Ireland's "Dr. No" has died at age 88.
item.dc:creator: msilverbergqz
item.content:encoded: Ian Paisley, the Protestant firebrand andformer leader of Northern Irelands Democratic Unionist Party,was among the fiercest opponents of self-rule for the province. That made his central role in the 2007 power-sharing agreementwith the republican Sinn Fein party all the more surprising, and it helped solidify a durable peace.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: In one of his more famous moments, Paisley heckled Pope John Paul II at the European Parliament (video).

item.title: An activist fund has advice for Olive Garden.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: Go easy on the breadsticks, salt the pasta water, sell more booze. That was the gist of a nearly 300-page presentationdisclosed by Starboard Value, which is seeking control of Olive Garden ownerDarden Restaurants' board.Starboard said the improvements could boost the stock to $86, compared with yesterday's $48.29 close.

item.title: HP is hit with yet another fine.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: A federal judge in California ordered Hewlett-Packard to pay a $58.8 millionfine for bribing government officials in Russia in return for a contact with the prosecutor general.HP agreed to pay a total of $108 million in April to settle investigations into other bribes in Russia, Poland, and Mexico.

item.title: Russia wants to retaliate.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: EU sanctions targeting Russian oil production and exploration sank the ruble to a new low as Russia threatened retaliationin response to the newEU and US sanctions, accusing both powersof undermining the truce in Ukraine. Russia will react "calmly, appropriately" to the EU sanctions, according to foreign minister Sergei Lavrov.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Earlier today, Russia'scentral bank left its benchmark interest rate untouched, as the need to support the stagnant economy trumpedpressureto stem rising inflationcaused in part by Russia's ban on Western food imports. Russia's economy and currency are in the doldrums due to Western sanctions.

item.title: Markets now see Venezuela as likelier to default than Ukraine
item.dc:creator: hlandyqz

item.title: A sale in the forecast.
item.dc:creator: hlandyqz
item.content:encoded: The Weather Channel's private equity owners are considering cashing outand have talked to investment bankers about strategic options for the company, Bloomberg reports. It's possible that Weather Channel will seek separate buyers for its television network and weather data arm. The businesses have an estimated combined value of $3.5 billion.

item.title: The emerging-markets miracle isn't what it used to be.
item.dc:creator: hlandyqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/264702/will-it-take-30-years-or-300-years-for-poor-countries-to-catch-up-to-rich-ones/

item.title: Electric car technology is off to the races.
item.dc:creator: hlandyqz
item.content:encoded: Amotor racing championshipthatbegins in Beijing tomorrow could do for electric cars and batteries what Formula 1 did for fuel injection. Formula E, as the new championship is called, was established after the governing body for auto racing made the case for giving electric-car manufacturers a platform in motorsport.

item.title: Obama ramps up the fight against Ebola.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The US president willannounce plans tomorrow(paywall)to send portable hospitals, doctorsandmedical supplies to West Africa, and to conduct healthcare training. Liberia has askedforextra helpas the virus threatens to overwhelm the country. Meanwhile, an illicit trade for a serum derived from the blood of Ebola survivors is making the rounds in West Africa, according to the World Health Organization.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: An EU study published last week suggested that the worst-case scenario could result in an additional 77,181 to 277,124 cases by the end of 2014. Here's a chart showing the disease's trajectory in the three most-affected countries through the end of August, with Liberia's looking particularly scary: [caption id="attachment_265613" align="alignleft" width="320"] [/caption]

item.title: ISIL's ranks are growingbut so are its opponents'.
item.dc:creator: hlandyqz
item.content:encoded: The CIA now says the Islamic State "can muster between 20,000 and 31,500 fighters across Iraq and Syria," eclipsing previous estimates that put the number at 10,000. But "several" Arab countries have also signedup to the US-led military campaign against IS, as the Obama administration attempts a coalition.

item.title: We're from the hedge fund industry, and we're here to help.
item.dc:creator: hlandyqz
item.content:encoded: As the government in Puerto Rico tries to stabilize the island's economy, more than two dozen hedge funds with a financial stake in the outcome are offering their advice, the New York Times reports. The coaching has includedtips on the best economic indicators and suggestions for tightening investor presentations.

item.title: NASA unveils a new spacecraft.
item.dc:creator: hlandyqz
item.content:encoded: The Orion capsule, which emerged Thursdayfrom its assembly hangar at Kennedy Space Center, will get its first test flight on Dec. 4. That flight and a second, scheduled for 2018, will be unmanned, but NASA expects to have astronauts steering Orion into deep space by 2021. The capsule can seat four.

item.title: US gas prices are making their way down.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/264713/just-as-americans-start-to-see-lower-gas-prices-big-oil-wants-to-sell-us-crude-overseas/

item.title: Radioshack's last stand.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The electronics retaileris considering a $585 million financing package(paywall) led by UBS and Standard General to save itself from afinancial death spiral. The commitments$325 million coordinated by UBS and $260 million from Standard Generalare intended to help the Texas-based company stave off bankruptcy court and would replace financing from GE Capital.

item.title: Al-Qaeda's Indian branch raided the wrong ship.
item.dc:creator: amerelliqz
item.content:encoded: The first attack by Al-Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent was meant to be a 9/11 anniversary attack on an American aircraft carrier in a Karachi port. Insteadthe jihadist group, established last week, raided whatturned out to be a Pakistani Navy ship. No damage was done, and arrests were made.

item.title: Ukraine's shaky ceasefire looks even shakier.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: Sunday saw some of the worst fighting(paywall) since the truce went into effect 10 days ago. Over the weekend Russia sent 220 trucksacross the border, saying they contained 1,800 tons of aid. Only 40 were checked by Russian's border guard before being waved through, and none were inspected by the Red Cross or Ukrainian officials.

item.title: Very well, the US is now "at war" with the Islamic State.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: A day aftersecretary of state John Kerry insisted it was merelya"major counterterrorism operation," White House and Pentagon spokespeople havefirmly describedthis conflict as a "war." This is just arguingover terminology, though: While the US seems to have as much troubledescribing what it's doing as the world hasdeciding what to call its jihadist adversary, the actual power to declare warstill rests with Congress, not the president.

item.title: A takeover battle is brewing for Heineken.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: Dutch brewerHeineken has dismissed a buyout offer from SAB Miller, the world's second-largest beer-maker, amid speculation that Anheuser-Busch InBev, the worlds biggestbrewer, is also preparing a bid. Heineken said that its eponymous controlling family intends to keep the company independent.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The beer industry has undergone a period of intense consolidation over the past decade. As Bloomberg reports, "SABMiller itself has long been seen as the final target for AB InBev"; combining the two companies would create a beer giant with a nearly 50% global market share.

item.title: Pennies cost more than a penny to makebecause of zinc
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/265406/it-costs-1-6-cents-to-make-one-penny-because-of-the-rising-price-of-zinc/

item.dc:creator: hlandyqz
item.content:encoded:
Pope Francis married 20 couples on Sunday, some of whom had already lived together and had children, in the latest sign that the Argentine pontiff wants the Catholic church to be more open and inclusive.

In the first wedding he has performed in his 18-month-old papacy, Francis took each couple through their vows in turn -- including Gabriella and Guido, who already had children and thought such a marriage would be impossible, official broadcasting service Radio Vaticana said.

"The people getting married on Sunday are couples like many others," the diocese of Rome said in a statement. "Some already live together, some already have children."

The ceremony was the first of its kind in the Vatican since Pope John Paul II presided over a wedding in 2000, when he was the leader of the world's 1.3 billion Catholics.

Continue reading the main story

RELATED COVERAGE

  • video

    Pope marries couples who have cohabited, had childrenSEPT. 14, 2014

Francis, who is the first non-European pope in 1,300 years, has expressed tolerance regarding other topics that are traditionally taboo in the Church, asking "who am I to judge?" a gay person "who seeks God and has good will".

item.title: Throwing tomatoes to annoy Putin.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: Hundreds of people gathered in Amsterdam to pelt each other with overripe tomatoes (and paid for the privilege). The proceeds from Tomatofestwentto Dutch farmers hurt by Russias ban on Western food imports. It follows similar moves in other countries hit by the Russian embargo.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C0NpNIowjjo

item.title: China's GDP target is in danger.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Factory output in August rose by a lower-than-expected 6.9% from a year ago, spurringBarclays tocut its 2014 GDP growth forecast to 7.2%, from 7.4%. Premier Li Keqiang now has two choices: ramp up the stimulus or miss the government's GDP target of7.5%.

item.title: Indiana Jones was not an archeologist.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: In the first scene of "Raiders of the Lost Ark,"where hes in the temple and hes replacing that statue with a bag of sandthats what looters do, Tulane's Marcello Canuto told the blog The Last Word On Nothing. "[The temple builders] are using these amazing mechanisms of engineering and all he wants to do is steal the stupid gold statue. (via kottke)

item.title: David Cameron is having a tough week.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: British prime minister David Cameron vowedconfront the Islamic State extremist group with iron determination after itmurdered British aid worker David Haines, though it is unlikely the UKwill officially join any fightinguntil after this weeks Scottish independence vote. Queen Elizabeth made a rare foray into politics by urging Scots to "think very carefully about the future."

item.title: David Cameron is having a tough week.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The UKprime minister vowed to confront the Islamic State extremist group with iron determination after itmurdered British aid worker David Haines, whilealso trying to avoid presiding over the breakupof the United Kingdom. Queen Elizabeth made a rare foray into politics by urging Scots to "think very carefully about the future."

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
The FT's Chris Giles has a good round-up of the five key economic challenges(paywall) foran independent Scotland. Meanwhile, London's already over-inflated real-estate market could swell even further if Scottish independence goes ahead, reports Bloomberg:
Whilst its all speculation at present, the drop-off in foreign-based buyers could be replaced in part by individuals and companies moving out of an independent Scotland, said Miles Shipside, a director at Rightmove. Their funds and target price brackets may not be as high as those of overseas investors, but could they nevertheless put a further strain on the capitals limited housing supply?

item.title: An anti-immigrant party makes big gains in Sweden.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The Nordic regions largest economy backed aSocial Democrat-led coalition that won43.7% of the votes, compared to 39.9% for the outgoing right-wing coalition, but the far-rightSweden Democratswon 12.9% of votes, more than double the backing they received in the previous election. "Its hard to see who is a winner other than that we now have a very large xenophobic party, said outgoing prime minster Fredrik Reinfeldt.

item.title: Alibaba's triumphal progress continues.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: The Chinese e-commerce giant has kicked off the Asia leg of its IPO roadshow. It reportedly raised more than enough interest in the US to complete its currently planned offering, and might price the shares higher as a result.Its debut this Friday on the NYSE could be the biggest US IPO in history.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Alibaba is listing in the US becauseHong Kong's stock exchange wouldn't accept its corporate governance structure, which allows the founders to nominate more than half the board. Dealbook has an interesting look at the ties between Alibaba and China's eliteas a result of some of the companies it has been buying:
Citic 21CN is part of a shopping spree by Alibaba. Over the past year, the e-commerce giant has spent more than $4 billion on acquisitions, including stakes in a Chinese soccer team, a ride-sharing company and a digital-mapping business. The aggressive deal-making has raised questions about Alibabas strategy and whether it is properly vetting the companies.

item.title: Quite a lot of voters in Scotland's referendum won't be Scottish
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/262329/scots-arent-the-only-ones-voting-on-whether-scotland-should-become-independent/

item.title: Netflix enters France.
item.dc:creator: zachseward
item.content:encoded: CEO Reed Hastings called its European expansion(paywall) the "biggest international launch weve ever done." Entering Francerequired major concessions to protectionist regulation.Netflix's first original programthere will be a political drama,Marseille, that sounds like a FrenchHouse of Cards.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
The company is also launching this week inGermany, Austria, Switzerland, Belgium, and Luxembourg. All told, the new countries are home to 80 million households with broadband internet.
Hastings said he is eyeing expansion to Asian countries, but China is "a way off."
Netflix last reported 13.8 million streaming subscribers in its international markets, compared to 36.2 million in the United States. It isn't yet profitable outside the US.

item.title: The US rallies countries against ISIL in Iraq.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: Syria will be trickier. A summit in Parishasgathered around30countriesto discuss how to tackle the terrorist movement.Iran was not invited, but US secretary of state John Kerry told reporters after the meeting that he was open to communicating with Iran.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Several Arab countries have offeredto carry out airstrikes, while Australia said it would send in troops, but the coalition has not amassed enough bulk for a sustained campaign. This isnt going to be shock and awe with hundreds of airstrikes, an American official told the New York Times(paywall), referring to the beginning ofthe Iraq war in March 2003. We dont want this to look like an American war. UKprime minister David Cameron held backand did not announce any air strikes, even after he vowed to confront theterrorist groupwith iron determination after it murdered the British aid worker David Haines.

item.title: Microsoft buys Minecraft for $2.5 billion.
item.dc:creator: lmiraniqz
item.content:encoded: It's true. Mojang, makers of the beloved computer game that allows players to use their imaginations and build whole worldslike virtual Legois to be acquired by Microsoft.Mojang confirmed the news in a blog post designed to reassure fans, but it stopped short of promisingthat things wouldn't change, saying only that "stopping players making cool stuff is not in anyones interests."

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Minecraft's creator, Markus Persson, who has been critical of Microsoft's Windows 8 operating system, will not stay with the company.

item.title: Apple hits a new high with iPhone preorders.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The companysaid it received recordpreorder salesof the iPhone 6 and the iPhone 6 Plus: over 4 million in just 24 hours. That's twice the numberof iPhone 5 preorders in the first day after its September 2012 release. The increased demand could lead to supply headaches, andsome people mayhave to wait until October for their phones.

item.title: Urban Outfitters takes it too faryet again.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The remarkablytone-deaf clothing chain hita new low when shoppers noticed that its "vintage" Kent State University sweatshirt, for sale for $129, was embellished with what looked likea splatter of blood. The university was the site of the Kent State shootings in 1970, in whichthe Ohio National Guard killed four students during a Vietnam War protest.

item.title: A down-to-the-wire scramble for Scotland.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: UK prime minister David Cameron has traveledto Scotland in a last-minute effort to rallythe "no" vote. Opinion polls onthe upcoming vote onwhether to splitthe United Kingdomare too close to call, but younger voters appear to favor independence. Queen Elizabeth made a rare foray into politics, urging Scots to "think very carefully about the future."

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
The FT's Chris Giles has a good round-up of the five key economic challenges(paywall) foran independent Scotland. InLondon, an already over-inflated real-estate market could swell even further if Scottish independence goes ahead, reports Bloomberg:
Whilst its all speculation at present, the drop-off in foreign-based buyers could be replaced in part by individuals and companies moving out of an independent Scotland, said Miles Shipside, a director at Rightmove. Their funds and target price brackets may not be as high as those of overseas investors, but could they nevertheless put a further strain on the capitals limited housing supply?
Meanwhile, celebrities such asfootballer David Beckham and designer Viviane Westwood are alsotaking astand.

item.title: Traffickers capsize a boat carrying hundreds of migrants.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: As many as 500 migrants are feared drowned after human traffickers rammedtheir boat off the coast of Malta last week, according toInternational Organization for Migration. The Syrian, Palestinian, Egyptian and Sudanese migrants were headedto Europe when they got intoa confrontation with the traffickers, survivors told the organization.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: On Sunday, in a separate incident, around 250 African migrants were feared dead after their boatsank off of the Libya coast. The numbers fleeingconflicts across the Middle East and Africa have swelled of late, with many boarding unsafe smugglers' boats in Libya. So far this year, 2,200 people have died trying to cross the Mediterranean, the IOMestimates, compared to 700 in all of 2013. Including the tragedies of the last two days, thetoll would be close to 3,000.

item.title: The clearest indication that domestic investment is sucking wind in China.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/265756/the-single-buried-statistic-that-explains-chinas-slowdown/

item.title: A welding of German and US companies creates an auto-parts giant.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The German car parts maker ZF Friedrichshafen has agreed to buyUS-based TRW Automotive Holdings Corp. for $11.7 billion, creating a company with more than $40 billion in combined annual sales. The move, which gives the German manufacturer access to TRW's renowned airbags and collision sensors,makes ZF the world's second-largest auto-parts supplier, giving it new leverage in price negotiations with carmakers.

item.title: How to gamble without risking ruin.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/265746/this-is-what-responsible-gambling-looks-like/

item.title: America Movil wants to slim down in Mexico but grow in Brazil.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The Mexican carrieris courting AT&T and SoftBank for a sale of its Mexico assets that could be worth $17.5 billion. Multi-billionaire Carlos Slim is reducingthe carrier's market share in hishome countryto avoid antitrust regulations. Last week, the company moved toboost its presencein Brazil by signing on with Oi SA to buy the wireless operator Tim Participacoes SA.

item.title: Michael Kors won Fashion Week, at least by this metric.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/265739/who-won-new-york-fashion-week-according-to-twitter/

item.title: Alibaba has raised its IPO price range.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: As a result of strong demand, the Chinese e-commerce giant raisedthe deal's price range to $66 to $68 a share from $60 to $66, according totold the Wall Street Journal(paywall). The company is in the midst ofthe Asia leg of its IPO roadshow ahead of what could be the biggest US IPO in history on Fridayand it's already causing trouble for Amazon.

item.title: Ukraine's shaky ceasefire looks even shakier.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: More fighting broke out in Donetsk after six civilians were killed and 25 were injured on Sunday insome of the worst fighting(paywall) since the truce went into effect 10 days ago. Ukrainian president Petro Poroshenko proposed a law that would give Donetsk and Luhansk "special status," granting the regionstemporary self-rulefor three years.

item.title: A massive pension systemsays noto hedge funds.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The $298 billion California Public Employees Retirement System (Calpers)the world's fifth-largest pension fundis quitting hedge funds,saying theyre too expensive and complex for itsinvestment portfolio. Calpers' investment is only $4 billion, but it mightinspire others to pull outor might not(paywall).

item.title: Netflix enters Germany.
item.dc:creator: zachseward
item.content:encoded: The company's European expansioncontinued after a successful rollout in France.NetflixGermany will be boosted by partnerships withDeutsche Telekom and Vodafone (link in German), which will offer the streaming video service to their cellularcustomers. But Germans, like the French, won't be able to watchHouse of Cardsbecause other companies already own the rights.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Netflix is also planning to launch this week inAustria, Switzerland, Belgium, and Luxembourg. All told, the countries have about 80 million homes(paywall) with broadband internet access. Here's a look at the offerings in France (registration required): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e3HnmjWgrhQ

item.title: The worlds two largest beer companiesinch towards a tie-up.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Anheuser-Busch InBev is reportedly talking to banks about fundinga bid forSABMiller that could be worth up to $122 billion. Together, the companies control a third of the worlds beer supply.

item.title: The US is divided between those who say "uh" and those who say "um."
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The regional breakdown can be detected from Twitter usage. Here's a map ofwho says what where.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: [caption id="attachment_266225" align="alignleft" width="640"] [/caption]

item.title: 7-Up used to contain lithium.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The soda was also marketed as a drink to "dispel hangovers."

item.title: UK leaders woo Scotland.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Conservative prime minister David Cameron, Liberal Democrat deputy prime minister Nick Clegg, and Labour leader Ed Miliband madea new promise for powersfor Scotland if it rejects independence. The secession referendum takes place on Thursday.

item.title: The US begins its broadened campaign against the Islamic State.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The United States said its jets bombed an IS military positionsouthwestBangkokthe first time theUShas attacked the Islamist extremist group to directly supportIraqi forces.

item.title: Boeing and SpaceX will each build spacecraft for NASA.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The US space agencywill spend $6.4 billion on two contracts toreplace the space shuttle and ferry astronauts to theInternational Space Station. US aerospace giant Boeing will earn $4.2 billion and entrepreneur Elon Musk's SpaceX will be paid $2.6 billion to develop their respective spacecraft.The former company is considered the least risky option (paywall), but upstart SpaceX's system is cheaper and doesn't rely on imported Russian parts.

item.title: Hollandesmoment of truth.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The French presidents new cabinet faces a confidence vote. Any majorrebellion by Hollandes Socialist Partycouldforce new elections and open the door to the right-wing National Front.

item.title: Russia's biggest email provider buys its biggest social network.
item.dc:creator: lmiraniqz
item.content:encoded: Mail.ru, Russia's most popular provider of web-based email, saidthis morning that it had bought the 48% of VKontakte that it did not already own. The Mail.ru groupalreadyowns Russia's second-most popular social network, Odnoklassniki. It is also looking to expandoutside Russia,particularly in the US.

item.title: What currency trading scandal?
item.dc:creator: hlandyqz
item.content:encoded: In an attempt to pre-emptUS and UK regulators' probesinto the alleged rigging of currency benchmarks,several big banks havecut off their foreign-exchange dealers' access to customer orders and online chat rooms, Bloomberg reports.The aim is to make ittougherfor dealers tocollude, manipulatemarkets, and improperly use client information.

item.title: People aren't downloading apps anymore.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/266280/why-most-people-arent-downloading-apps-anymore/

item.title: Ebola merits more US troops than ISIL.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: US president Barack Obamaordered 3,000troops to West Africa in an effort to contain the outbreak. The US plan also includes building 17 new healthcare facilities with 100 beds in each, training up to 500 workers a week, and opening a joint command operation in Liberia's capital to coordinate international efforts. China is also sendingmore medics to Sierra Leone to help with lab testing.

item.title: Ukraine gives its rebels a longer leash.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz

item.title: A volcano threatens the Philippines.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: Authorities are evacuating thousands of people in the danger zone (within a five-mile radius) of Mount Mayon as lava began to trickleout of the crater on Tuesday. The alert level has been raised to critical;scientists predict the volcano couldviolently erupt within weeks. Some 12,000 families are estimated to live in the danger zone.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Mount Mayon has erupted 50 times in the last 600 years. In 1841, one of its blasts killed 1,200 people.

item.title: UK leaders woo Scotland.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: With polls showing the Scotland independence vote is too close to call, Conservative prime minister David Cameron, Liberal Democrat deputy prime minister Nick Clegg, and Labour leader Ed Milibandpromised more autonomyin a last-ditch effort to get Scotland to say"no." The secession referendum takes place Sept. 18.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Banks in Britain have been quietly moving millions of banknotes to Scotland in the event of a "yes" vote. The Independent reports:
Sources told The Independent the moves have been taking place over the past week or so in order to make sure ATMs do not run out on Friday in the event of a panic reaction to a yes vote. There have been some suggestions that people will want to move their money to English banks in the event of an independence vote. Bankers stressed there has been no sign yet of any increase in the amount of withdrawals from deposit accounts or ATMs, stressing that there was no need because the Bank of England has pledged to stand behind all accounts for at least 18 months in the event of a yes vote.

item.title: Samsung's new "musicom."
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The company is filming sixhour-long sitcom episodes in a web-based series starring a fictional Samsung employee. Thegoal is to portray a "young Samsung" that helpsattract youngerjob candidates. The series, called"Best Future," will be part musical, part sitcom, and features lead characters whose names mean "best" and "future" in Korean.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The seriesisn't a first for Samsung; itfilmed anotheron its hiring policy and employee philosophy last year called "Endless Energy."

item.title: American families are making less than they did in 1989.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/265980/american-families-are-stuck-in-a-lost-quarter-century/

item.title: Franois Hollande's government just about survives.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The French presidents new cabinet narrowly won a confidence vote in parliament, 269 to 244. But with abstentions and no-shows putting the result 20 votes short of an absolute majority (paywall), Hollande now lacks support forhis planned pro-business policies.

item.title: London's real estate prices just keep going up.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/266539/london-real-estate-prices-remain-deeply-silly/

item.title: China tries to stimulate its economy.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The People's Bank of China will inject 500 billion yuan($81.4 billion) of liquidity into five state-run banks toencourage lending, following further signs of slowing economic growth. The new measure, similar to the US Federal Reserve's quantitive easing, isexpected to target the housing market and small and private businesses.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The catalyst for the liquidity injection is most likely newdata out this week thatshowed industrial production in August grew atits lowest pacesince 2008(paywall). However, the move is less drastic than cutting interest rates, whichcould worsen China's increasing levels of toxic debt. It appears that the PBOC finally started to become more aggressive to salvage a sluggish economy, Liu Li-Gang, chief Greater China economist at Australia & New Zealand Banking Group, told Bloomberg. However, the use of [strategic lending facilities]also means the cut is not permanent as banks will have to pay it back later.

item.title: Softbanks founder becomes the richest man in Japan thanks to Alibaba.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Masayoshi Sons net worth rose 3.4%to $16.6 billion, according to Bloomberg, surpassing Uniqlo/Fast Retailing chief Tadashi Yanai. Softbanks34% stake in Alibaba is a significant driver of his wealth, as the Chinese companys IPO on Fridayis shaping up tobe the largest ever.

item.title: A Chinese Uighur scholar goes on trial.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Ilham Tohti, a prominent Beijing-based economist,could face the death penalty if convicted of separatism. Chinas increasingly hostilerelationship with its Muslim minority is under increased scrutiny afterseveral Uighurs werelinked to the extremist group Islamic State.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: "Mr. Tohti is an advocate for Uighur rights and religious freedom...but he was never an advocate for Xinjiang independence," said Tohti'slawyer this morning before his trial. Continued terror attacks inside Xinjiang and elsewhere in China, however, have led China to maintain a very hard line on the Uighur population.

item.title: The humble club sandwich is a barometer for tourist affordability.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/266936/the-many-layers-of-global-insights-contained-in-one-delhi-club-sandwich/

item.title: The MacArthur "genius grants" are out.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Cartoonist Alison Bechdel, saxophonist Steve Colman, a researcher on police relations with the blackcommunity, and an advocate for domestic abuse victims, joined 17 others in receiving $625,000 each to spend however they please. The grants are awarded annually to US citizens or residentsto support "the creative potential of individuals," although the selection process is a secret.

item.title: Xi Jinping want Chinese tourists to ditch the instant noodles.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: On a trip to the Maldives, the president of China remarked that Chinese tourists could do more to respect local etiquette(paywall), including reducing their reliance on instant ramennoodleswhile traveling. On a more serious note, Xi also added tourists shouldn't litter or destroy the local environmentsomething they have been notorious for in the past.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Let me just say here that we ought to teach our citizens to be a bit more civilized when they travel abroad, Xi said. Dont throw water bottles everywhere, dont destroy peoples coral reefs, and eat fewer instant noodles and more local seafood.

item.title: It's decision day at the Fed.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: The UScentral bankisexpected to announce at 2pm US eastern time that it's cuttingbond purchasesby an additional $10 billion a month. That would putthe two-year-old program of quantitative easingon track to end in October. Could the next step be an interest-rate hike?It all hinges on two words.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
The goal of QEadopted first by the Fed and then some other central bankswas togive the economy an extra boost after interest rates had gone as lowas they could go. Did it work? Opinion is divided. Here's some useful reading:
  • The BBC's Kim Gittleson rounds up the evidence on QE.
  • The Economist explains QE. So does the Bank of England, if you like your explainers in video form.
  • Two economists at the conservative(i.e., Fed-skeptic) Heritage Foundation make the case that QE introduced big risks by filling the Fed's balance sheet with toxic assets.
  • A former Fed official's mea culpa: QE was a backdoor bailout for Wall Street(paywall). Reuters' Edward Hadas makes the same point but says "at least QE was a new idea."
  • On the cheerleading side, Ambrose Evans-Pritchard in the Daily Telegraph argues that for all its flaws, QE prevented the pain of budget austerity from being a lot worse.

item.title: Congress gives Obama the go-ahead to arm and train Syrian rebels.
item.dc:creator: isenqz
item.content:encoded: The US House approvedthe president's plan to send military trainers and armsto Saudi Arabia to helpSyrian rebels fight the Islamic State. Republican Congressional leaders backed the legislation,despite their concerns thatthe administration's response is inadequate.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Meanwhile, thechairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, US Army generalMartin Dempsey, told a Senate committeethat if this approach doesn't do the trick, he may recommend that the US send ground forces. A White House spokesman threw water on the idea, saying the US"will not deploy ground troops in a combat role into Iraq or Syria." ISIL has released a movie-trailer-like video(paywall) challenging Obama's vow to "degrade and ultimately destroy" thegroup, and appearing to threaten to killUS soldiers.

item.title: Chinese millionaires aren't the only ones that want to move abroad.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/266943/do-half-of-chinas-millionaires-really-want-to-emigrate-not-exactly/

item.title: Russia detains a billionaire, sparking fears of a Yukos repeat.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The Russian oil and telecoms tycoon Vladimir Yevtushenkov has been accused of money laundering in an oil deal and placed under house arrest, president Vladimir Putins Investigative Committee announced. The move has stoked worries that oligarchs and their property are not safe from the Kremlin.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The arrest reminded many of the Kremlin's prosecutionof Mikhail Khodorkovsky, who ran theYukos oil firm and was oncethe country's richest man. Khodorkovsky spent a decade in jail and had his companies appropriated by the Kremlin inwhat he and his supporters say was revenge for challenging Putin. Market watchersand Khodorkovsky himselfhave said the arrest is part of an asset grabbythestate-owned oil giant Rosneft, which has been hit by Western sanctionsdesigned to punish Russia for its role in the Ukraine crisis. They say the company is tryingtotake control of Yevtushenkov'soil company, Bashneft. Rosneft has denied any role. Shares of Bashneft andYevtushenkov's other company,Sistema (which ownsRussia's largest mobile operator MTS among other things)plungedon news of his arrest.

item.title: FedEx predicts a bounteous holiday season.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The US packagedelivery company surpassed analysts' expectations, earning $606 million in the first quarter, up 24% from the previous year. Arise in online shopping drove the results,which bode well for the peakseason ahead.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: FedEx says it will add 50,000 seasonal workers over the holidays, while its rival, UPS,promised to hire up to95,000, nearly double the 55,000 it hired last year. The two companies are often seenas bellwethers of the country's economy.

item.title: Ebola's devastation may also be financial.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: The outbreak of the deadly virus could drain hundreds of billions from economies in West Africa, particularly through tourism and trade, according to a World Bank reportreleased today. Liberia, Guinea, and Sierra Leone could lose $359 billion in economic output this year, and unless the disease can be contained, its economic results may also spread.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Ebola has infected yet another healthcare provider: This time it's a French staffer from Doctors Without Borders, who is being evacuated to France.

item.title: Apple has launched iOS 8.
item.dc:creator: dfrommerqz
item.content:encoded: The new version of Apple'smobile operating system is a free update for recent iPhone and iPad models. It adds several new features, including changesto messaging, notifications, and sharing, plus third-party keyboards. But read this before you upgrade.

item.title: Weaves were a thing 3,300 years ago.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz
item.content:encoded: Archaeologists discovered an ancient Egyptian woman with over 70 hair extensions on her head, still intact. She is one of hundreds ofelaborately coiffed peopleburied in a cemetery near an ancient city now called Amarna.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: [caption id="attachment_267264" align="alignnone" width="640"] That's a hairdo built to last.[/caption]

item.title: Sony has lost its way, and its all because of smartphones.
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/267062/why-sony-must-wish-the-smartphone-was-never-invented/

item.title: The doves win, for now.
item.dc:creator: isenqz
item.content:encoded: The Federal Reserve said that it plans to keep its benchmarkinterest rateat a record low for the foreseeable future,despite improving indicators in the US economy that had led some to predict an imminent rate increase. Fed chair Janet Yellen has said thata steady reduction of the unemployment rate mayoverstate the improvement in the job market.

item.title: The Federal Reserve's October farewell.
item.dc:creator: mattphillipsqz
item.content:encoded: The Fedtook two incrementalbut importantsteps toward its goal of eventually exiting from the unconventional monetary policies it put in place during the Great Recession. It said conclusively that it will end its quantitative easingbond-buying programs next month. It alsolaid out its plans for how, exactly, it would eventually raise short-term interest rates.

item.title: The male dominance of video gaming is over.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/267147/women-gamers-are-beginning-to-outnumber-their-male-counterparts/

item.title: A measles vaccine has killed 50 children in northern Syria.
item.dc:creator: zwenerflignerqz
item.content:encoded: The childrenincluding infantswent into "severe allergic shock" after getting the vaccines, administered by the US-backedforces opposing President Bashar al-Assad. The vaccination campaign, a part of a UN effortto eradicate diseases such as measles, mumps, rubella, and polio that have surged since the country's conflict began, has been suspended while the deaths are investigated.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: A doctor who administered the medicine told reporters via a Skype call that improper storage was to blame for the medicine's spoilage, but others suspect tampering.ABeirut-based public health specialist, Fouad Fouad, told the AP thatspoiled vaccinations were unlikely to have been the cause, since they aregenerally harmless.

item.title: Buzz begins for another Apple release.
item.dc:creator: isenqz
item.content:encoded: The Daily Dot reports that the company will unveil new versions of the iPad and iPad mini at an Oct. 21 event. But a veteran Apple watcher who has called these kinds of things in the past says, "nope," it's not happening. Or at least not thenApple has stagediPad events the past two Octobers.

item.title: Australia says it foiled a beheading plot.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: More than800 policeofficersconducted raids across the country and detained 15 suspects who were allegedlyplanning toabduct and behead arandom Sydney resident on camerain the name of the extremist group. A senior member of IS made "quite direct exhortations" to "conduct demonstration killings" in Australia, said prime minister Tony Abbott.

item.title: US logistics contractors were hacked by China.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: In 2012 and 2013 there were around 50 infiltrations against private companiesthatmove US military personnel and weapons, according to a US senate investigation. Twenty of the attacks were blamed onChinese government hackers.

item.title: Hyundai made a "Gangnam Style" splurge.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The Korean conglomeratesuccessfullybid more than $10 billion on aplot of land in Seoul's exclusive Gangnam district, trumping an offer fromSamsung. Hyundai shares fell 4%; the property was appraised at only $3 billion.

item.title: New York City is looking to hire a new blacksmith.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

item.title: A Chinese general is accompanying Xi Jinping to quietly conquer India.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Peng Liyuanthe wife of Chinese president Xi Jinping, and a honorary major general in the Peoples Liberation Armyhas emerged as perhaps the most visible first lady in Asia, and is on center stage during her husband's high-profile trip to India. Despite the charisma of Peng, Xi's visit has taken on an uncomfortable edge due to a Chinese incursion into the disputed Himalayanborder between the two countries.

item.title: Scotland votes "No" to independence from the UK.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The "No" votes against breaking up the 307-year-old union between Scotland and Britain won the day by a wider-than-expected54.2%-45.7% margin. "Scotland has decided noat this stage to becoming an independent country and I accept that verdict," said Alex Salmond, Scotland's first minister, in his concession speech. "Let us not dwell on the distance we have fallen short. Let us dwell on the distance we have travelled.... Let us go forward as one nation."

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
The "Yes" forces may have come up short in getting out the vote on a day with the biggest turnout in Scottish history. The Guardian reports:
Across the board turnouts were high, often well over 80%...it was lower than expected in the pro-independence areas of Dundee at 78.8% and Glasgow at 75% but higher in areas more likely to vote no, including 89.6% in Edinburgh and a predicted very high number in the Borders.
Despite the defeat of the independence referendum,the no vote will createbig changes in the UK. The main political parties have allpromised Scotland more autonomy over taxation, spending, and social welfare programs. Berenberg UK economist Rob Wood:
The UK will be different, but it will remain one country for the time being. By promising extra powers to Scotland within the UK, London has helped to keep Scotland in. But Prime Minister David Cameron may have to pay a price for the late promise of more home rule for Scotland. But the UK has been changed forever by this referendum. The majority of Scots have voted to remain in the UK, but not under the old status quo. Indeed, it seems that around 45% of Scots backed a split with the UK. The nationalist leaders in Scotland will claim a strong mandate in future negotiations with the UK over future powers to be devolved to Scotland.
The pound surged on news of the "No" vote, hitting a 2-week high of $1.652 against the US dollar and reaching multi-year highs against the euro and yen. https://twitter.com/RichardBarley1/status/512838375603048448

YouGov #IndyRef prediction: YES 46%, NO 54% - http://t.co/huG6uJFiJG

— YouGov (@YouGov) September 18, 2014

The front page of the (4.30am edition) of the Guardian: 'Scotland says no' via @SimonNRicketts pic.twitter.com/OfwISTinD7

— Ben Quinn (@BenQuinn75) September 19, 2014

GBP is still well off its highs for the yr vs USD, but is clearly recovering from its #indyref wobble: pic.twitter.com/8hlxLNmPcW

item.title: median-income2013
item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz

item.title: Diet sodas may cause blood sugar spikes.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: A small-scale study found that artificial sweeteners interfere with crucial bacteria in the stomach. Lab mice and humans alike who drank diet soda were atincreased risk of glucose intolerance, whichcan lead to diabetes.

item.title: Early Eurasians were a randy bunch.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: A "sexually prolific" group from what is now northern Russia mated with hunter-gatherers and indigenous farmers togive rise to modern-day Europeans, according to new DNA analysis.

item.title: Americas homebuilders see good things on the horizon.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/267227/you-are-probably-underestimating-the-economic-momentum-in-us-housing/

item.title: A slew of new Kindles.
item.dc:creator: zwenerflignerqz
item.content:encoded: Amazon announced the release of six new or upgraded devices, including a $199 high-end e-reader and a $79 touch-screen tablet. The luxe version, the thinnest-ever e-reader that mimics paper books, is aimed at heavy readers; the low-end versiontargetsnascente-reader markets like China, Japan, and Germany. The devices begin shipping in October, in time for the holiday rush.

item.title: The Dow and S&P hit all-time highs.
item.dc:creator: zwenerflignerqz
item.content:encoded: The Dowjumped 0.56% to 17,252.8and the S&P rose 0.44% to 2,010.34, both new records. The marketsvaultedoff a substantial drop in US jobless claims and the Fed's announcement that interest rates will stay low in the near future.

item.title: Alibaba begins trading.
item.dc:creator: zwenerflignerqz
item.content:encoded: The stock opened at $92.70 a share, 36% above its offering price. A surge in early trading gives the company a market value of roughly $240 billion, larger than the market valuation of energy giant Chevron.The shares are now trading under the ticker "BABA" on the New York Stock Exchange.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: With a multitude of banksunderwriting the public offeringand fewer "lockup" restrictionsthat force initial investors to hold their shares for a time before selling, Alibaba's IPO is oneof the world's least conventional. The partnership made up of Alibaba's founders willretain power to elect the company board. The governance of the company isn't as top-heavy as other public tech companies like Facebook and Googlewhose partners get 10 times votesper sharebut it still gives public shareholders the short end of the stick.

item.title: The Islamic State releases a video of a captive British journalist.
item.dc:creator: zwenerflignerqz
item.content:encoded: In a roughlythree-minute video posted on social media sites,amanidentified himself on-camera as John Cantlie, a reporter who had worked for the Sunday Times, the Sun, and the Sunday Telegraph. In the video, hepromises to "convey some facts" about theSunni Muslim extremist group in future videos to counter Western portrayals.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Meanwhile, the senate voted 78-22 to arm and train moderate Syrian rebels in their fight against IS. Republican senator Rand Paul, one of the most vocal critics of the move, said it "enabled the enemy."

item.title: Microsoft fires 2,100 employees.
item.dc:creator: zwenerflignerqz
item.content:encoded: This is the second round of layoffs in along-term plan announced in July to cut 18,000 jobs, or 14% of the company's total workforce. The housecleaning is an attempt to streamline after the April acquisition of Nokia's Devices and Services division,which added 25,000 employees to the Microsoft payroll.

item.title: Microsoft's prediction engine thinks Scotland will stick with the UK.
item.dc:creator: zwenerflignerqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/267900/scotland-independence-referendum-prediction/

item.title: Larry Ellison steps down as Oracle's CEO.
item.dc:creator: zachseward
item.content:encoded: The surprise shift iseffectively immediately. Ellison, who founded the company, becomes executive chairman of the board and chief technology officer. Two Oracle executivesSafra Catz and Mark Hurdwill jointly fill his slot as CEO in an unorthodox arrangement.

item.title: Health workers treating Ebola were murdered in Guinea.
item.dc:creator: zwenerflignerqz
item.content:encoded: Eight people, including three doctors and three journalists from a missing team of health workers, were found dead near a village in southeast Guinea near where the Ebola outbreak began. The reasonfor the killingsis not known, but villagers have reportedly beendistrustful ofhealth workers during the crisis, which has claimed more than 2,600 victims in West Africa.

item.title: The UN Security Council sounds the alarm on Ebola.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Ebola is a "threat to international peace and security," the council said, after its first-ever emergency meeting to deal with a public health issue. An "emergency UN mission" will work with the World Health Organization to combat the disease in West Africa, where theinfection rate isdoubling every three weeks.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: In Oxford, England, the first human subject to trial a vaccination against Ebola has reported no problems after receiving the jab. The drug is being developed by GlaxoSmithKline and the US National Institutes of Health; human trials are set tobegin in Africa next month. Meanwhile,eightpeople, including three doctors and three journalists from a missing team of health workers, were found dead in southeast Guinea near where the Ebola outbreak began. The reason for the killings is not known, but some villagers have reportedly been hostile towardhealth workers during the crisis.

item.dc:creator: zmudallalqz

item.title: SAP buys into the cloud.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The German business softwaregiant acquired theonline travel expenses company Concur(paywall) for $8.3 billion in an effort to expand itsweb services offerings to corporations. Seattle-based Concur is a rare survivor of the first dotcom boom.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The business-management industry has seen plenty of consolidation of lateearlier this yearSAP purchased Fieldglass, which helps companies manage contract employees, and in 2012 it bought business-to-business marketplace Ariba. Concur itselfintegrated with Airbnb this year to offer its business travelers more hospitality options.

item.title: Rich travelers prefer the aisle seat.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/267961/the-more-people-fly-the-more-they-prefer-the-aisle-seat/

item.title: Germans can get airplane food delivered to their homes for some reason.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Air Food One offers subscribers a weekly meal delivery from Lufthansa's food supplierthis week it's "Arabic seafood" or panserotti with porcini mushrooms. The meals, which are from the business class menu, are priced at under 10 euros ($12.90).

item.title: Russia sanctions force Exxon Mobil to hit pause on Arctic oil drilling.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Just days after new US and EU sanctions were declared, Exxon halted work ona project that aimed to extractan estimated 9 billion barrels of oil from beneath theKara Sea, sources told Bloomberg. Exxon has eight more days to cease all arctic exploration work with Russia's OAO Rosnefta partnership that aimed to solve Exxon's falling production rates and modernize Russia's aging extraction operations.

item.title: An early iPhone 6 buyer sees his life flash before his eyes.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Jack Cooksey, the first person in Perth, Australia to buy Apple's latest smartphone, was showing it off to a TV reporter when it went crashing to the ground.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YbehPQfu3K0
Luckily for Jack, the iPhone 6 survived.

item.title: Telefnica bets big on Brazil as Vivendi retreats.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The Spanish telecoms group bought the Brazilian broadband company GVT from France's Vivendi, in a cash- and stock-based deal worth $9.3 billion. The move will make Telefnica the dominant telecom operator in Brazil, where it reaps one-fifth of its total revenue, and which is growing much faster than the company's stagnant home market.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The deal represents perhaps thefinal big sale for Vivendi in itsrocky two-year restructuring, which has seen it sell all three of its telecom businesses as well asits videogame division. French mogul Vincent Bollore, who became Vivendi's chairman in June, now presides over a restructured one-time conglomerate that now consists mainly of the Universal Music Group and pay-TV company Canal Plus.

item.title: China fines GlaxoSmithKline nearly half a billion dollars.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: A court found the British drug company guilty of bribery, fined it a record $491.5 million, and jailed executives including country director Mark Reillythough Reuters reports he may be deported instead.

item.title: France carries out its first air strikes against the Islamic State.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: President Francois Hollande said fighter jets "completely destroyed"a logistics depot used by the extremist group, also known as ISIL,in north-eastern Iraq. He added that France would not attack Syria, and confirmed that it has no intention of putting troops on the ground in the region.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Choosing not to strike Syria may not be an option for very much longer.On Thursday,Iraqi prime minister Haider al-Abadi urged Western forces to focus their attacks on hisneighboras ISILfighters retreat there.Twenty-oneKurdish villages havereportedly been capturedby the group.

item.title: Many of the iPhone shoppers in line outside Apple stores in New York and Tokyo are Chinese.
item.dc:creator: isenqz
item.content:encoded: With the release of the iPhone 6 and 6 Plus delayed in China because of regulatory hurdles,as many as 5 million iPhones could be smuggled back into China (where they were made) before it's released there. China is Apples second largest market by revenue.

item.title: France begins air strikes on the Islamic State.
item.dc:creator: zwenerflignerqz
item.content:encoded: French jets destroyed an ISIL depot in northeast Iraq inthe strikes, which mark the entrance of France into the aircampaign begun bythe US in August.Earlier this week, 25 countries signed a statement ofsupport for Iraq at a meeting in Paris, though none of them committed to specific military action.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Yesterday, ISIL released its latest video of a captive British journalist. In the roughlythree-minute video posted on social media sites,amanidentified himself on-camera as John Cantlie, a reporter who had worked for the Sunday Times, the Sun, and the Sunday Telegraph. In the video, hepromises to convey some facts about theSunni Muslim extremist group in future videos to counter Western portrayals.

Meanwhile, the US Senate voted 78-22 to arm and trainSyrian rebels in their fight against ISIL. Republican senator Rand Paul, one of the most vocal critics of the move, said it enabled the enemy.

item.title: An Ebola lockdown in Sierra Leone.
item.dc:creator: zwenerflignerqz
item.content:encoded: Health workers will go door-to-door during athree-day lockdown, tryingto find and educateEbola patients who have avoidedcare due to fear or suspicion of doctors. Some experts warn that the plan mightbackfire if so manyhidden cases emerge that they overwhelmtreatment centers.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
In its first-ever emergency meeting to deal with a public health issue, the UN Security Council calledEbola a threat to international peace and security. An emergency UN mission will work with the World Health Organization to combat the disease in West Africa, where theinfection rate isdoubling every three weeks.

In Oxford, England, the first human subject to trial a vaccination against Ebola has reported no problems after receiving the jab. The drug is being developed by GlaxoSmithKline and the US National Institutes of Health. Human trials are set tobegin in Africa next month. Meanwhile, six have been arrested in the killing of eightpeople, including three doctors and three journalists from a team of health workers, whowere found dead in southeast Guinea near where the Ebola outbreak began. The reason for the killings is unclear, but some villagers have reportedly been hostile towardhealth workers during the crisis.

item.title: This is no way for a respectable currency to behave.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/268410/bitcoin-is-plunging-again/

item.title: The Earth turned up the heat this summer.
item.dc:creator: zwenerflignerqz
item.content:encoded: Globally, itwas the hottest summer on record, warmer by 0.71 degrees Celsius than in 1998, previously the hottest summer, according to the US National Climatic Data Center. If the mercury stays high over the next few months, 2014could replace 2010 as the hottest year on record.

item.title: Scotland's first minister resigns.
item.dc:creator: zwenerflignerqz
item.content:encoded: Alex Salmond stepped down after the votes against breaking up the 307-year-old union between Scotland and Britain won the day by a wider-than-expected55%-45% margin. "For me as leader my time is nearly over," he said, "but for Scotland the campaign continues."

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
The "Yes" forces may have come up short in getting out the vote on a day with the biggest turnout in Scottish history. The Guardian reports:
Across the board turnouts were high, often well over 80%...it was lower than expected in the pro-independence areas of Dundee at 78.8% and Glasgow at 75% but higher in areas more likely to vote no, including 89.6% in Edinburgh and a predicted very high number in the Borders.
Despite the defeat of the independence referendum,the no vote will createbig changes in the UK. The main political parties have allpromised Scotland more autonomy over taxation, spending, and social welfare programs. Berenberg UK economist Rob Wood:
The UK will be different, but it will remain one country for the time being. By promising extra powers to Scotland within the UK, London has helped to keep Scotland in. But Prime Minister David Cameron may have to pay a price for the late promise of more home rule for Scotland. But the UK has been changed forever by this referendum. The majority of Scots have voted to remain in the UK, but not under the old status quo. Indeed, it seems that around 45% of Scots backed a split with the UK. The nationalist leaders in Scotland will claim a strong mandate in future negotiations with the UK over future powers to be devolved to Scotland.
The pound surged on news of the "No" vote, hitting a 2-week high of $1.652 against the US dollar and reaching multi-year highs against the euro and yen. https://twitter.com/RichardBarley1/status/512838375603048448

GBP is still well off its highs for the yr vs USD, but is clearly recovering from its #indyref wobble: pic.twitter.com/8hlxLNmPcW

— Richard Barley (@RichardBarley1) September 19, 2014

item.title: Alibaba's IPO is the biggest in US history by almost $4 billion
item.dc:creator: zwenerflignerqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/268394/heres-how-ridiculously-big-the-alibaba-ipo-is/

item.title: Growing wasabi outside of Japan is extremely difficult but ridiculously lucrative.
item.dc:creator: snarulaqz
item.content:encoded: The sinus-clearing root sells for up to $160 per kilogram, according to the BBC.Figuring out how to cultivateit on a commercial scale in North Americahas been a rewarding challenge for farmers in Canadaand Oregonthough they must guard their trade secrets vigilantly.

item.title: Nicolas Sarkozy is back in action.
item.dc:creator: zwenerflignerqz
item.content:encoded: The former French president announced on his Facebook page that he would return to politics, joining the race to lead the right-leaning UMP party. Sarkozy'sreturn may actually helpthe man who defeated him, Francois Hollande, whose popularity is at 13%.

item.title: Worst-case Ebola projections get even worse.
item.dc:creator: zwenerflignerqz
item.content:encoded: A model created by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention predicted there could be 550,000 or more cases of the virus if aid and intervention are not ramped up. Anticipating the infection's spread has proven challenging; a World Health Organization spokesman said WHO's prediction last month of 20,000 cases is already outdated.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Sierra Leone is under athree-day lockdown, during which health workers will go door-to-doortryingto find and educateEbola patients who have avoidedcare due to fear or suspicion of doctors. Some experts warn that the plan mightbackfire if so manyhidden cases emerge that they overwhelmtreatment centers.

In its first-ever emergency meeting to deal with a public health issue, the UN Security Council calledEbola a threat to international peace and security. An emergency UN mission will work with the World Health Organization to combat the disease in West Africa, where theinfection rate isdoubling every three weeks.

In Oxford, England, the first human subject to trial a vaccination against Ebola has reported no problems after receiving the jab. The drug is being developed by GlaxoSmithKline and the US National Institutes of Health. Human trials are set tobegin in Africa next month. Meanwhile, six have been arrested in the killing of eightpeople, including three doctors and three journalists from a team of health workers, whowere found dead in southeast Guinea near where the Ebola outbreak began. The reason for the killings is unclear, but some villagers have reportedly been hostile towardhealth workers during the crisis.

item.title: The Islamic State returns hostages to Turkey.
item.dc:creator: laurenalixb
item.content:encoded: The terrorist groupreleased 49 hostagesthat were seized from the Turkish consulate in Mosul in June, in what president Erdogan referred to as a "pre-planned operation." Turkey has yet to join the military coalition against ISfor fear that it would jeopardize the lives of its captives.

item.title: This week the markets took their cues from optimism over the US economy
item.dc:creator: laurenalixb

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/268698/markets-clearly-focused-on-a-british-breakaway-this-week-just-not-scotland/

item.title: New Zealand elects its prime minister for a third term.
item.dc:creator: laurenalixb
item.content:encoded: John Key's National Party won 48% of the vote on Saturday after Key led the country to record levels of prosperity. Growth is projectedto fall in coming years though as export prices drop and monetary conditions tighten.

item.title: Afghanistan finalizes a power-sharing deal.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: Followinga stalematesince disputedelections earlier this year, the two presidential candidates have resolved their differences. Ashraf Ghani, the certified winner, becomes president and his defeated rival, Abdullah Abdullah, gets to nominate a chief executivewith powers similar to those of a prime minister.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
According to Transparency International's Corruption Perceptions Index, Afghanistan ranks 175th out of 177 nations in experts' perceived levels of public corruption, below Iraq and Sudan and edging out just North Korea and Somalia. The index is a reminder that countries are beset with "abuse of power, secret dealings and bribery."
https://twitter.com/JohnSaeki/status/513960102684925952/photo/1

item.title: Siemens buys into the US fracking boom.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Europe's largest engineering company is paying $7.6 billion forDresser-Rand Group, a US manufacturer of oil and gas compressors and turbines. Siemens CEOJoe Kaeser said the company waslate to take advantage of the US shale gas boom, butis planning more acquisitions in the sector.

item.title: Alibaba's IPO is now the largest in history.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Bankers working onthe Chinese internet giant's public offering haveexercised the "green shoe" option (paywall) to purchase additional shares, raising the total proceeds of theoffering from $21.8 billion to $25 billion, according tothe Wall Street Journal. Alibabashares rose 38% on their first day of trading on Friday, giving the company a market capitalization of more than$230 billionbigger than Facebook and Amazon.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: a:3:{s:20:"restored_revision_id";i:269076;s:16:"restored_by_user";i:45805036;s:13:"restored_time";i:1411354569;}

item.title: Iran wants a quid pro quo.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Iranianofficials told Reuters that itwould work with the United Statesto defeat ISbut only if theyreceivedmore flexibility on the country'suranium enrichment program. Western negotiators said Iran oftenattempts to tie its uranium talks to other issues, but that they would resist linking them.

item.title: Yemeni rebels seized the capital.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The Houthi rebelstook control ofgovernment buildings and military bases in Sana after the Yemeni military reportedly capitulated, leading to a UN-brokered peace deal to createof a new government. The Houthis are Shiite tribal group that some governments in the region claim are backed by Iran.

item.title: Starbucks is testing beer-flavored lattes.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The "Dark Barrel Latte," currently available on a trial basis in some US outlets of the coffee chain, reportedly tastes like Guinness. It is served with whipped cream and caramel saucebut contains no actual beer.

item.title: Investors shun oil money, seek to go clean.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: A group of 650-odd investors, including the Rockefellers, have pledged to take their combined $50 billion of fossil fuel investments and convert them into clean fuel funding. Their gesture, along with yesterday'snearly 400,000 thick wall of protestors in Manhattan, aims to send a message to the more than 120 world leaders attending withTuesday's United Nations summit on climate change.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Here's how the march looked from above: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KuSWN_EG6CE China now emits more greenhouse gases than the United States and the European Union combinedand, for the first time, emits more than the EU on a per capita basis. But it may be the next few years, as China's anti-pollution measures take effect, that could matter the most. Globally, 2014 was the hottest summer on record, warmer by 0.71C than the previous record in 1998, according to the US National Climatic Data Center. If the mercury stays high over the next few months, 2014could replace 2010 as the hottest yearsince record-keeping began.

item.title: Hyundai directors were kept in the dark.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The Korean conglomerate did not seek board approval for a massive $10 billion real estate dealin Seoul's posh Gangnam district, according to Reuters. The purchase atthree times the appraised value for the landandbillions more than arival bid from Samsung has raisedconcerns about the company's corporate governance.

item.title: China now emits more greenhouse gases than the United States and the European Union combined.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/269078/chinas-carbon-emissions-have-hit-a-new-record-but-its-the-next-few-years-that-matter-most/

item.title: Tesco's 250 million accounting mistake.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The UK's largest groceroverstated expected profits by250 million ($408 million)the latest in a series of missteps that has resulted in fivestraight years of sales decline. Four executives including the company's UK managing director have been suspended; Tesco shares dropped by as much as12%.

item.title: It's getting tricky to run EMC
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The data storage giant is under pressure to consider merging with a rivalsuch asDell, Oracle, HP or Cisco, according to The Wall Street Journal. Activist shareholders want EMCto restructure ahead of itsCEO's retirement early next year.

item.title: Apple fanboys admit that Steve Jobs was wrong about huge phones
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

item.title: Big iPhones break records at Apple.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: It took just three days for Apple to move 10 million units of the new larger iPhones, and that's despite them not being available in China.Now not everyone is a fan of the 5.5 inch 6 Plus, but it seems to be the model that's most difficult to find.

item.title: When China slows down, the world slows down.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Investors across the world are showing a lack of confidence inChina's manufacturing sector. The Shanghai Index is down. The Nasdaq, S&P500, and Dow Jones are down. And Australia's currency is at a seven-month low. The othershoe is expected todrop on Tuesdaywhen HSBCreleases its "flash" data for Chinese manufacturing in September (paywall).

item.title: US home sales hit slump.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: After five months of rising existing-home sales, the National Association of Realtors says the boom is over. Sales in August were down 1.8% compared to July, and down 5.3% year over year. At leastthe average second-hand home now goes for $219,800, up 4.8% from a year ago, and the 30th consecutivemonth of growth.

item.title: Microsoft hits reset on China Xbox launch.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Two days before the XboxOne was scheduledto launch in China, Microsoft has mysteriously decided to pull the plug. The console was supposed to be the first foreign gaming machine to launch in the People's Republic since the turn of the century. Meanwhile, theXbox Oneis slated to launch in India in just a few hours, where it'll be exclusively availablevia Amazon.

item.title: Amazon Germany is hit with a two-day strike.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Workers at five of Amazon's processing centers in Germany (there are nine in total) are striking on Monday and Tuesdaybecause they want to be classified as retail employees and not logistics workers. That small but important distinction costs workers several hundreds of euros a month in wages.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: This isn't the first time Amazon Germany has faced striking employees. Last Christmas, over 1,100 employees tried to speak up about what they called "low wages, permanent performance pressure and short-term contracts".

item.title: Ukraine holds hands with Poland and Lithuania.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Ukraine's defense minister signed an agreement in Warsaw to form a brigade known as "LitPolUkrBrig," to strengthen regional security. Based in the Polish city of Lublin, roughly 3,800 soldiers will come from Poland itself, another 545 from Ukraine, and between 150 and 350 from Lithuania. Given the ongoingceasefire violations by separatists, Ukraine may need all thehelp it can get.

item.title: The Lion King becomes the most successful production ever.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: With $6.2 billion in ticket sales, it just surpassed Andrew Lloyd Webber's Phantom of the Opera to become the most successful piece of entertainment. The Phantom may have brought twice as many people into theaters, but 75 million people paid more to see Simba.

item.title: Putin's love of big cats influences a children's TV show.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: To mark the 50th anniversary of the popular Russian children's program "Goodnight Little Ones," the show's producer, Alexander Mitroshenkov, decided to add a character. Would it be a wolf? A monkey? A giraffe? A horse? All solid choices, but nope, he went with a tiger. Asked why, Alexander pointed to Putin, and then it all made sense.

item.title: No more Burger-King-style tax moves?
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: The US is cracking down on tax inversions(paywall), whereby a US company reduces its effective tax rate by merging with a foreign one and moving its headquarters abroad. New rules from the US Treasury would complicate or disqualifydeals likeBurger King's acquisition of Canada's Tim Hortons last month.

item.title: The SEC makes someonevery rich.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: The US financialregulator announced a$30 million rewarddouble the 2013 record of $14 millionto a tipster who helped it uncover a difficult-to-detect fraud. Itsthe 14th such award sincethe SEC launched its program two years ago, and the fourth to someone outside the US.

item.title: Ukraine withdraws its big guns.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: President Petro Poroshenko said the ceasefire with pro-Russian rebels is holding, and that the fighting that continues is being waged only by small-time and independent groups. Kyiv will maintain its buffer zone in the east with checkpoints while fighting the remaining rebels.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Just a week ago Ukraine's defense minister signed an agreement to form a brigade with Polish and Lithuanian troops, to strengthen regional security. The force will comprise of around 4,000 soldiers that could respond to threats such as an increasingly belligerent Russia.

item.title: The US and its Arab allies begin airstrikes in Syria.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The Pentagon and five Sunni Arab alliesdeployed bombers, fighters, armed drones, andcruise missileson Monday against the Islamic State'sde facto capital of Raqqa, Syria and its forces along the Iraqi border. The strikes also killed30 al-Qaeda-linked militantsknown as "the Khorasan group," according to Syrian human-rights observers; the US said the Khorasan fighters were planning an attack against the US and Western interests.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Here's video from the USS Arleigh Burke firing Tomahawk cruise missiles into Syria: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H9034BawdX4&sns=tw Iranian presidentHassan Rouhani said on Tuesday that the strikes on Syria wereillegal(paywall) because the Syrian government wasn't consulted. Rouhani is just as opposed to ISILas the US, but there is currently no cooperation between the two countries. Separately, Israel said it downed a Syrian military jet that crossed into Israeli air space in the Golan Heights. Syrianmortars and shells have fallen in the Israel-controlled area throughout the three-year Syrian civil war, but this is the first time Israel has downed a Syrian jet since 1985.

item.title: Here are all of the countries the US has bombed since 9/11
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

item.title: Islamic terrorists kidnap a French hostage.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: A group linked to the Islamic State tooka 55-year-old man in Algeria, and threatened to kill him unlessFrench president Franois Hollandeceased air strikes in Iraq. The French and Algerian governments have been working together to try to free the hostage.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: On Friday last week French jets "completely destroyed" an Iraqi logistics base used by IS, and the French government has strongly backed the fight against the group. The French governmentrefers to IS using itsArabic acronym "Daish" (paywall), which the group finds highly offensive.

item.title: Chinas manufacturing picks up a bit of steam.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The HSBC/Markit flash purchasing managers index for September ticked higher, suggesting that manufacturing activity is expanding.The new data should easefears that the economy issputtering despite the governmentsmini-stimulus.

item.title: Syria is the seventh country bombed by the US since 9/11.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/269630/here-are-the-seven-countries-the-united-states-has-bombed-since-911/

item.title: Ukraine withdraws its heavy artillery.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: President Petro Poroshenko said he would move the country's large weapons from itsconflict-ridden eastern regions because the ceasefire with pro-Russian rebels is mostly holding, and that any continuedfighting is being waged by small independent groups. The move is a part of a nine-point deal(paywall) agreed on by both sides to de-escalate the conflict.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Russian president Vladimir Putin is not attending the UN's current assembly in New York despite the Ukraine situation being high on the agenda. Foreign minister Sergei Lavrov is representing Russia instead.
