item.title: Alibaba could buy Yahoo for free.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The newly flush Chinese tech giant would need to pay$7 billion in cashand a block of sharesbut once it owns Yahoo, it would get them all back anyway, plus some other stuff, notes Bloomberg's Matt Levine. Why won't this happen in real life? Because Yahoo executives are unlikely to admit that their company is essentially worthnothing.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Levine explains:
If you are a management team and board of directors and someone comes to you and says, "I want to buy your company for nothing," then your inclination will be to say no. Your company has to be worth something! Like, you're coming to work every day, doing stuff. Concluding that the stuff you're doing is worth nothing, or negative $8 billion depending how you count, is a little too much like staring into the abyss for most corporate executives.

item.title: Ferrari is recalling 3,000 cars to stop drivers getting trapped in the trunk.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The luxury sports car maker realized that if you somehow get stuck in the trunk of its 458 sports car, you can't get out. The $230,000 cardoes have a release within the trunk, but it "onlyallows the lid to be opened just slightly, far enough to prevent suffocation and allow someone to call for help," according to CNN.

item.title: Xiaomis new revenue stream is selling stuffed animals.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi expects to sell some 2 million of its bunny mascots this year. The revenue may be tiny for the fast-growing company, but the branding and customer loyalty opportunities are nothing to shake a carrot at.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
And yes, there is a CGI movie too:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=COF0-TlJBy4

item.title: Israel downs a Syrian fighter jet.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The planehad entered Israeli air spaceaccording to its military, potentially marking an escalation in tensions between the two countries. Throughout the three-year Syrian conflict so far mortars andshells havefallen in Israel-controlled Golan, but this is the first time Israel has downed a Syrian jet.

item.title: Jimmy Choo takes a step toward an IPO.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: JAB Luxury, theholding company that owns the upmarket British shoe maker, plans to float at least 25% of the businessonthe London Stock Exchange. Jimmy Choo could be valued at $1.14 billion, and islikely totout its strong potential for growth in Asiaas it tries to tempt investors.

item.title: A moderate Chinese Uighur scholar gets life in prison.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Ilham Tohti, an economics professor who set up a website to promote peaceful dialogue between China'sminority Uighur and majority Han ethnic groups,was convicted of "separatism" by a Chinese court.Human rights groups deplored the verdict, and the US embassy said his arrest "silenced an important Uighur voice that peacefully promoted harmony and understanding among Chinas ethnic groups."

item.title: Jack Ma's buying the drinks tonight.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Alibaba's co-founder has become China's richest person, with $25 billion to his name, according to Hurun Reports. Ma surpassed Wang Jianlin, head of the real estate giant Wanda, who has a respectable $24.2 billion. Also impressive is Xiaomi co-founder Lei Jun in 10th place, despite his selling smartphones at essentially zero margin.

item.title: Philips to split in two.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The Dutch firm's lighting and healthcare units soon will become separate companies, a procedure that's estimated to take 18 months to complete at a cost of roughly 50 million euros a year until 2016, after which Philips will recoup 300 million euros in savings. Competitor Siemens spun off its lighting unit, Osram, last year.

item.title: Chinese torture trade quadruples.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: According to Amnesty International, more than 130 Chinese companies are currently exporting devices classified as "tools of torture," up from 28 companies a decade ago. Said instruments, such as spiked batons, are "intrinsically cruel" and should be banned(pdf), the group said. Africa and the Middle East look to be the biggest buyers.

item.title: Liberia is getting paid to prevent deforestationbut probably not enough.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Norwegian officials told the BBC that the country will give Liberia$150 millionin an attempt to eliminatedeforestation by 2020. But the illegal timber industry is a $100 billion market,according to Interpol, so Norway may have to up the ante.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: In a similargesture, France has pledged$982 million to help countries that are experiencing the most devastating effects of climate change.

item.title: Ebola is on the verge of exploding.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The US Centers for Disease Control estimates that by the end of this month, there could be 21,000 people infected(paywall) with theEbola virus inLiberia and Sierra Leone. Assuming nothing is done, that will swell to between 550,000 and 1.4 million by the end of January. There are currently some 5,800 cases registered, but officials think the real figure is more than double that.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: In related news, 164 nurses from Britain's National Health Servicehave volunteered to travel toWest Africa to tackle the Ebola virus.

item.title: Cadillac ditches Detroit to woo more global elites.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: General Motors wants to up the 112-year-old luxury brand's cachet and attract more foreign consumers, so it'srelocating 120 Cadillac employeesto ashiny new headquartersin lower Manhattan's SoHo neighborhoodin Q2 2015.Johan de Nysschen, Cadillac's new president as of August, said hewants to put "distance" between Cadillac and the rest of General Motors.

item.title: Albania has a pot problem.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The country'sinterior ministry says ithas destroyed$8.2 billion worth ofmarijuana this year, the equivalent of60% of the country's GDP. Half of that was captured in June during a five-day raid in thesouthern village of Lazarat, which is known as Albania's drug capital. Italian authoritiessay Lazart is capable of producing$6 billion of pot everyyear.

item.title: Samsung ends notebook sales in Europe.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The Korean tech giant will reportedly stop selling laptops and Chromebooks in the region, despite reports that the PC market is bouncing back. Separately, a Samsung executive promised that the company's mobile business would bounce back "due to its strong fundamentals and technological prowess."

item.title: Xbox does a double take on China.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: After Microsoft mysteriously pulled the plug on the launch of the Xbox One in Chinawithoutexplanation, the companytodayconfirmed that the Xbox will come this month after all, albeitone week laterandwith a limited selection of 10 titles.

item.title: Hollywood isn't giving enough screen time to working women
item.dc:creator: qzroya
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_269942" align="alignnone" width="640"] [/caption]

item.title: Line is putting the breaks on going public.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The company behind the popularsocial-messaging app has decided to press pause(paywall) on its much-anticipated IPO plans, favoring a focusonglobal expansion instead. No one knows the real value of booming social apps like WhatsApp and Line. For investors inone ofthe fastest growing segments of the consumer internet, the answer will have to wait.

item.title: People around the world think CEOs should make much, much less
item.dc:creator: qzroya

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/269972/people-worldwide-think-ceos-should-make-a-tiny-fraction-of-what-they-do/

item.title: Pfizer is trying again for a tax inversion.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The US drug company has expressed interest in acquiring Actavis, a smaller rival with a market value of $63.6 billion that recently moved its headquarters to Ireland for tax purposes, according to Bloomberg. The Obama administration is trying to restrict tax inversion deals, but is not blocking them completely.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Earlier this year Pfizer offered up to $114 billion for UK-based AstraZeneca in an attempt to move its headquarters to the UK to reduce its effective tax rates. The deal was met with political oppositionstemming fromskepticism over whether Pfizer would maintain jobs at British plants.

item.title: All the charts tell the same story: Chinas economy looks weak.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/269859/all-the-charts-tell-the-same-story-chinas-economy-looks-weak/

item.title: A Scotland spin-off that worked, sort of.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The Royal Bank of Scotland, which is 80%-owned by the British government, floated25% of itsstakein Citizens Financial for $3 billion. But the partial IPO of the US retail and commercial bank didn't go perfectly: shares sold for $21.50 per share, below the anticipated $23-$25 range.

item.title: Starbucks puts its money on green tea frappuccinos.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The coffee-shop chain will spend $913.5 million buying the 61% of its Japanese business it doesnt already own from public shareholders and Sazaby League, which formed a joint venture with Starbucks in 1996. The chainthinksit can drive growth in Japan by focussing onready-made beverages, which is already a popular market sector.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Starbucks gets more than 6% of its revenue from Asia, and has plans to expand its store footprint throughout the region. It also recently purchased non-coffee brands such as Teavana in part to diversify its offerings to a market that traditionally drinks tea.

item.title: US regulators investigate Pimco.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The Securities and Exchange Commission islooking into whether thebond giant inflated the rate of returns fora fund aimed at small investors, according to the Wall Street Journal(paywall). The probe is reportedly assessingwhether the company provided misleading information about fund values or performancewhich isillegal even if it's unintentional.

item.title: BlackBerry hopes it'll be hip to be square.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The troubled Canadian smartphone brand is launching a 4.5- by 4.5-inch-screen handset that it hopes will revamp its popularity as the phone of choice for business users. BlackBerry is holding three events around the world to publicize the launchin Toronto, London, and Dubai.

item.title: Mohammed is the most popular baby name in Israel.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The Israeli government was forced to backtrack after initially releasing a list with only Hebrew names,thereby ignoring the 21% of the population that is Arab.

item.title: A new species of mushroom has been discovered in a London supermarket.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The mushrooms weren't growing wildthey were found in a packet of dried porcinis using DNA testing.

item.title: Some iPhone 6 Plus owners are bent out of shape.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Their deviceshave developed a pronounced bend in the middle, suggesting a possible structural flaw. Unlike phones that are supposed to flex as a design feature, the iPhone is notmeantto be bendy.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=znK652H6yQM

item.title: India's probe makes it to Mars on the cheap.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The spacecraft, carrying cameras and a methane gas sensor that could detect conditions favorable for life, cost a mere$74 milliona tiny fraction of the cost of other Mars missionsby theUS, EU, and Japan.The Mangalyaan ("Mars craft" in Hindi) will send data back to Earth for six months, when it will run out of fuel.

item.title: TNT Express blew up its guidance.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The Dutch shipping and logistics company said it no longer expects to meet its 2015 forecast of an 8% profit margin, and is setting aside 50 million ($64 million) to settle an antitrust case with French authorities. The firmoffered no new profit guidance: shares fell 9% in early trading.

item.title: Assessing the impact of the US airstrikes in Syria.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The bombing campaign by the United Statesand its Arab alliesbut mostly just the USis suspected to have killed leaders of the Islamic State(paywall) as well as a senior memberof the Khorasan Group, an Al Qaeda-linkedterrorist group deemed to bepotentially more dangerousto the West. Al-Nusra, a Syrian group closely allied with Khorasan,said in a statement that its leader was also killed in the bombings. President Obamareiteratedthis morning that ISIL must be "degraded and ultimately destroyed."

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The targeting of multiple militant groupshas sent the media into an explainer frenzy:Here's a good round-upof the aims and differences between the groupsthat have been acknowledged so far. For some interesting perspective on the Syrian strikes, consider this: Roughly 250 bombs were dropped in one night, the same number of bombs the US dropped on Sunni terrorists in Iraq between Aug. 8 and Sep. 10.

item.title: Paypal adds bitcoin support.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: PayPal has teamed up withBitPay, Coinbase, and GoCoin to allowNorth American merchants to collect their paymentsusing the virtual currency.The news sent the price of bitcoin up by more than 10%, to$443.69. Some say Apple forced PayPal's handonthis, but the bitcoin processors say PayPal had been working with themfor months.

item.title: Rocket prices its shares for an October IPO.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: When Rocket Internet goes public on Oct. 9 inFrankfurt, the German technology incubatorexpects its shares to trade at between35.50 to 42.50 euros. That would give it a market cap of $7.8 billion, and makeit Germany's largest IPO in a decade. Who knewthat cloningAmerican internet companies could beso lucrative?

item.title: China's steel industry is refusing to slow down.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: China makes half the world's steel, a feat that's only possible withgovernment subsidies, but is the countrymaking too much (paywall)? The priceof steel bars isdown 18% year-over-year, due to a 40% collapse (paywall) in priceof iron ore, and output has increased by 4%. Mill operators are struggling to payoff their debt and find places to store excess inventory.

item.title: China's central bank may soon have a new boss.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Zhou Xiaochuan has been in charge of the People's Bank of Chinasince 2002, making the 66-year-old the longest-serving chief of the world's soon-to-be largest economy. Rumors say he'll be replaced (paywall) as early as next month by Guo Shuqing, an ex-banker turned governor of Shandong provence. Chinese officials are required to retire at 65.

item.title: London's iconic cabs slow to a crawl to protest Uber.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Over a thousandtaxi drivers in London caused a traffic jamaround Trafalgar Square and Westminster by intentionallydrivingslow to protestunlicensed cabs. The cabbies say that the cars on the app-enabled service Uber should require licenses because their system is virtually identical to a taxi meter, calculatinga rate based ondistance driven.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: A similar protest took place in June of this year, when an estimated 4,000 cabbies participated, according toTransport for London.

item.title: Walmart turns into a bank next month.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Green Dot Bank,launched just a year ago, is partnering with the American retail giant to offer checking accounts and a MasterCard debit card beginning in October. Walmart stores will act as bank branchesfor the bank's mobile banking platform GoBank, allowing customers a walk-in service to deposit cash and open accounts.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The physical presence that Walmart offers may give Green Dot, known for its prepaid payment cards,an advantage over its online-only competitors, such asSimple and Moven.

item.title: Japan bulks up its Russian sanctions.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Western sanctions against Russia have sent the ruble to lows never seen before, but Japan has been relatively mildwith itspunishmentsuntil today, that is. In a bid to show solidarity with its G7 counterparts, Japan has placed restrictions on arms exports and banned(paywall) Russian banks from issuingsecurities in the country.

item.title: India asks Coke and Pepsi to put fruit juice in soda.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The 5% juicethatPrime Minister Narendra Modi wants the companies to mix into their soda won't improve anyone'shealth, but the plan could help drive income toIndia's farmersand reduce the millions of dollars worth of spoiled fruit that's thrown out because ofa lack of cold storage.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: India has had a tumultuous relationship with soft drink companies. Coca-Cola pulled out of India in 1977after a change in regulations would have required it to reveal its much-vaunted "secret formula" to work with an Indian company. It returned in 1993 after the law was changed. Soda was banned in several Indian statesnearly a decade ago after the Center for Science and Environment published researchshowing thatpesticide levels in a sample of 57 drinkswere 24 times the country's recommended safe levels.

item.title: London will become a city that never sleepson the weekend.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Staying out until the wee hours of the night will be a lot easier in London come September 2015.Transport for London says it'llbe launching 24-hour weekend underground service in a year's time. The city's mayor,Boris Johnson, says the movewill add 2,000 jobs and $590 million to the local economy.

item.title: How Japan's maternity-leave policy hollows out its workforce
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/266841/economic-case-for-paternity-leave/

item.title: GM's salaries broke the rules.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: When the US Treasury bailed out General Motors, it stipulated that GM executives should have their salaries capped at $500,000. According to a recent analysis of the government's bailout program, TARP, 16 executives' salariesviolated the decree, runningup to $1.7 million a yearand the Treasury itself signed off on these inflated salaries.

item.title: The bubble pops for Chinese iPhone smugglers.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Apples new smartphone hasnt been released yet in the mainland, which sent the gray market price surging to almost $1,500 over the weekend. But a glut of supply from Hong Kong has since driven prices down to about $980, hurting smugglers who had stockpiled the devices; the same model costs HK$5,588 ($720) in Hong Kong's Apple store.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: A new version of Apple's iOS software was meant to fix a series of bugs from the iPhone 6 launch, but ended up creating more problems. Before Apple pulled the update, it caused some iPhones to lose cellular phone service and access to the devices' fingerprint scanners.

item.title: Indias Mars mission wascheaper than "Gravity."
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: It cost just $74 millionto send theMangalyaan spacecraft to Marsthanks in part to these womenversus $100 million to make a movie aboutSandra Bullock as an astronaut adrift in Earth orbit.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
This scene was pretty awesome, though:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C4pcg7bXgmU

item.title: Harvard names a new $36-billion man.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The university named Stephen Blyth, head of public markets at the school's investment company, as the newhead ofthe world's largest endowment. The fund, which plans to increaseits exposure to private equity and real estate in 2015, posted areturn of 15.4% in fiscal 2014the kind of outsized gains that have led some to call for the end of Harvard's non-profit status.

item.title: Obama hits the Islamic State where it hurts.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: US warplanes launched airstrikes targeting small IS oil refineries in Syria, an attempt to cut off some of the $2 million in daily oil sales that the extremist group usesto fund its operations. Despite the bombings, IS conquerednew territory in a Kurdish area in northern Syria, near the Turkish border.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The Caliphate Soldiers of Algeria killed French tourist Herve Gourdel, who was kidnapped on Sunday in retaliation for France's involvement in air strikes on Syria. French president Franois Hollande, who confirmed Gourdel's death, said the "operations against the Islamic State will continue."

item.title: H&M says it's too hot to shop.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: An unusually warm September caused shoppers to put off spending on autumn clothing, the Swedish retailer said, as sales grew only 7% compared with an average 16% in the six months before. Third-quarter pre-tax profits were up almost 20% on the year to 7 billion crowns ($972 million): shares slid 3.1%.

item.title: Ikea prepares the ground in India.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The Swedish retail giant signed dealswith two Indian states ahead of plans to open stores in Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore, and Hyderabad, although no timeline was offered. In 2012 the Indian government lifted a long-standing ban on foreign companies setting up wholly-owned subsidiaries.

item.title: Mario Draghi predicts a euro zone bump.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The bloc will see "modest growth" in the second half of the year, the president of the European Central Bank told a Lithuanian business daily(in Lithuanian). Sanctions against Russia (and Moscow's counter-sanctions) have had a limited impact, he said, but it isupto national governments to "use any leeway to make fiscal policies more growth-friendly."

item.title: China discovered nearly $10 billion in fraudulent trade.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Export and import documents have been "faked, forged, and illegally re-used,"the nation's foreign exchange inspection department said. The investigation covered 24 cities and provinces nationwide, including Qingdao, where a metal trading fraud has exposed banks to huge potential losses.

item.title: Why is Google declining "right to be forgotten" requests?
item.dc:creator: lmiraniqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/270954/what-google-is-telling-people-who-want-to-be-forgotten/

item.title: British police arrest nine men on terrorism charges.
item.dc:creator: isenqz
item.content:encoded: The men picked up in a series of raidsof homes, businesses, and community facilities includeAnjem Choudary, ahigh-profile radical Muslim preacher who has appeared on CNN. Choudary, 47, and the others aged 22 to 51 are accused of being members of a proscribed organization, supporting a proscribed organization, andencouraging terrorism.

item.title: US jobless claims unexpectedly rise.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The two-week running average of the number of people seeking unemployment benefits has risen by 12,000 to 293,000, the Labor Department said. Looking at the four-week average, however, benefit seekers are still declining in numbers. The more troubling news is that just 142,000 jobs were added last month, down from a 12-month running average of 212,000.

item.title: China splurges on Spanish goods.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Spanish prime minister Mariano Rajoy is in Beijing holding meetings with Chinese premier Li Keqiang. The two countries announced an agreement on $4 billion worth of business deals, ranging from fashion to telecommunications.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Chinese investments in foreign countries hit $90.2 billion last year, up 17% from a year prior. Li alsoasked the Rajoyto help reduce the time it takes Chinese peopleto obtain visas to Spain."We hope to have more pragmatic cooperation with Spain, and look forward to expanding the number of people traveling between the two countries," he said.

item.title: A new software bug is said to be worse than Heartbleed.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: "Bash" is a word you maybe hearing a lot in the coming days. Itrefers to the command line terminal that makes Linux and Unix systems run. A quarter-century-old security flawin the line, also known as the "Shellshock" bug,may make your phone, your (Apple) computer, and the servers thatonlineservices usevulnerable tothis newly discovered avenue of attack.

item.title: Sierra Leone quarantines another million people.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: With the death toll from Ebola approaching 3,000,Sierra Leone has placedthree additional districts in the country's north and south under quarantineto contain the virus. More than a third of the country's 6.1 million people are now under medical lockdown, and the number of Ebola casesis only expected to increase.

item.title: Barbra Streisand is in it for long haul.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: People,Streisand's first album, topped the chartsin 1964. Since then, the artist has had at least one No. 1 album in each and every decadesix, ifyou're countingwhich is a first for any singer. Just to offer some perspective: Partners, her latest album, hit the top of Billboard's chartafter selling only196,000 copies. Kids nowadays stream.

item.title: The US attorney general is stepping down.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Eric Holder, 63, has tendered hisresignation. He'll remain in his post until president Obama elects a successor that must then be confirmedby the US Senate.News of Holder's resignation perhaps shouldn't come as a shock, given thathe told The New Yorkerback in February that he'll be leaving office "sometime this year."

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Holder came to hisdecision during a conversation with president Obama duringLabor Day weekend, according to NPR, which cites two sources "familiar with the decision."

For further reading:

  • The Wall Street Journal has a handy timeline of Holder's actions in office.
  • The LA Times begins the speculation on Holder's replacement, and the difficulty Obama may have in confirming his nominee.
  • The Guardian asks how much Holder can "get done on race" before he steps down.

item.title: The EU is set to greenlight Facebook's WhatsApp purchase.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Since announcingits agreement to buy WhatsApp for $19 billion back in February, Facebook has been sitting on its hands, waiting for government officials to approve the deal. The US gave Zuck the thumbs-up in April, and now Reuters is reporting that the EU will soon announce their "unconditional clearance" of the takeover.

item.title: The bubble pops for Chinese iPhone smugglers.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/271170/the-price-of-a-gray-market-iphone-6-in-china-is-plummeting/

item.title: Rival Palestinian factions reconcile.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Fatah and Hamas willbury the hatchet in the name of progress for Gaza. The two reached a "comprehensive agreement" during negotiations in Egypt, stipulating that Fatah leader Mahmoud Abbasand thePalestinian Authority will take control of the strip, including civil administration duties.The factions will merge their security forces to manthe territory's border crossings.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The estimated repair bill following Israel's 50-day attack onthe territory is $7.8 billion. The conflict killed more than 2,100 Palestinians, mostly civilians, as well as67 Israeli soldiers and six civilians in Israel. The unity government'sinclusion of Hamas, classified by the US, Israel, and other countries as a terrorist group, could deterdonors attending a conference in Egypt next month seekingto raise reconstruction funds for Gaza. A Fatah representative said the Palestinian Authority will seek membership in UNorganizations, including the international criminal court, "to enable our people to hold Israel accountable for the war crimes it has committed."

item.title: Captured Islamic State fighters say subway attacks are in the works.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Iraqi prime minister Haidar al-Abadi told a group of reporters coveringthe United Nations General Assembly that security forcesin Baghdad have captured American and French ISIL fighters who claim the militant group is planning attackson public transport systems in New York and Paris.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
The AP reports:

Asked if the attacks were imminent, he said, "I'm not sure." Asked if the attacks had been thwarted, he said, "No, it has not been disrupted yet... this is a network."

"Today, while I'm here I'm receiving accurate reports from Baghdad that there were arrests of a few elements and there were networks from inside Iraq to have attacks ... on metros of Paris and U.S.," al-Abadi said, speaking in English. "They are not Iraqis. Some of them are French, some of them are Americans. But they are in Iraq."

item.title: Vice adds $11 billion to Spain's GDP.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Drug trafficking, prostitution, smuggling, and illegal gambling made up 0.9% of Spain's economy9 billion euros ($11.4 billion)last year, according to the country's National Statistics Institute. For the sake of comparison, crime in Italyis said to contribute $230 billion to the country'sGDP. Of course,none of this economic activity is being taxed.

item.title: Commercial drones get a lift.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: US regulators cleared several Hollywoodmovie studios to use the flying robots,the first time that corporations can legally use them in the lower 48 states (they were previously authorized for monitoring oil pipelines in Alaska). The Federal Aviation Administration's rulingis an encouraging sign forcompanies like Amazon and Google, which are also pursuing their own drone programs.

item.title: Islamic State executioner "Jihadi John" is identified.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The FBI has not released the name of the Islamic State member responsible for beheading three hostages in Syria, but saidit discovered the man's identity after working with otherintelligence agencies. "John" is likely UK-born, and has already threatened to kill a fourth hostage.

item.title: Where in the world is Kim Jong-un?
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The totalitarianleader of North Korea failed to appear at a parliamentary meeting on Thursday, continuing an unusualthree-week absence from state media, which acknowledged he was suffering from "discomfort" as he "keeps lighting the path for the people, like the flicker of a flame." One expert on North Korea's leadership thinks Kim might be suffering from gout.

item.title: Cows actually really hate cowbells.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The 5.5 lb (2.5 kg) bells are as loud as a jackhammer, and the animals eat less grass when theyre wearing them.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
But the bells do sound lovely, whether it's in the Swiss Alps...
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KYGgWqiv8AU
...or the recording studio.
http://vimeo.com/91715361

item.title: Narendra Modi arrives in the US under the shadow of a human rights lawsuit.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: India'snew prime minister is set tobegin a five-day swing through New York and Washington, DC, including a huge gala at Madison Square Garden. But just before Modi's arrival, a US federal court issued a summons in a lawsuit connected with 2002riots in his home state ofGujarat, where he was chief minister; the suitclaims he committed crimes against humanity and sanctioned extra-judicial killings and torture, among other allegations.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Tune into Quartz India for a livestream of Indian prime minister Narendra Modis 9/28 speech at Madison Square Garden in New York City, starting at 11 am EST and 8:30 pm IST. Well take your comments on our Facebook page.

item.title: Narendra Modi has a court summons waiting for him in New York.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The Indian prime minister is set tobegin a five-day swing through New York and Washington, DC, including a huge gala at Madison Square Garden. But just before hisarrival a US federal court issued a summons in a lawsuit connected with 2002riots in his home state ofGujarat, whichclaims he committed crimes against humanity and sanctioned extrajudicial killings and torture.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Tune into Quartz India for a livestream of Modis Sept. 28 speech at Madison Square Garden in New York City, starting at 11 am EST /8:30 pm IST. Well take your comments on our Facebook page.

item.title: The US is preparing a new nuclear proposal for Iran.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Diplomatic sources told the Associated Press that US negotiators may allow Iran to keep nearly half of itsuranium enrichment program intact, in exchange for other constraints on building a nuclear weapon. The two longtime adversariesrecently found themselves facing a common enemy in the extremist group the Islamic State.

item.title: Intel went to China for a piece of the smartphone business.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The US computer chipmaker agreed topay $1.5 billion for a 20% stake in two mobile chip manufacturersbacked by a Chinese government-affiliated private equity firm. The deal could helpIntel's long-frustrated attempt to gain a foothold in the global smartphone industry, and boost China's own semiconductor industry.

item.title: The Bond King leaves his castle.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Bill Gross is leaving the investment firm he founded in 1971, Pacific Investment Management Company (Pimco), to join competitor Janus Capital Group. Pimco has been under SEC investigation for months about falsifying the performance of several funds in a bid to lure investors. Shares in Janus rose 43% on the news.Dan Ivascyn will replace Grossat Pimco.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Gross's departure followed conflict with other Pimco executives that led some to threaten to resign if he didn't leave, according to anonymous sources cited by the Wall Street Journal. ""I look forward to returning my full focus to the fixed income markets and investing, giving up many of the complexities that go with managing a large, complicated organization," Grosssaid in a statement.

item.title: Flights in and out of Chicago halted.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: A fire at an air traffic control center in Aurora, Illinois has grounded nearly 1,800 flights at Chicago's O'Hare and Midway airports. Police say an employee who was discovered in the basement of the control tower suffering from self-inflicted woundsis to blame.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Nearly 1,800 flights have now been canceled.

item.title: "Airplane mode" no longer needed in Europe.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The European Aviation Safety Agency has declared that passengers can leave their mobile electronics powered onfor the duration of flights, including take-off and landing. It's estimated that Europe's airlines will need as much as eight months to implement the new rules.

item.title: Smartphone encryption ruffles the FBI's feathers.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: FBI director James Comey is livid that the latest version of Apple's mobile operating system uses a form of encryption that makes it nearly impossible for law enforcement to retrieve sensitive data. Google's Android OS soon will add similar functionality. Comey says he's contacted Apple and Google and is awaiting a response.

item.title: Australia has a resettlement plan for asylum seekers.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The country'simmigration minister signed a deal to pay Cambodia $35 million over four years to take in an untold number of refugees denied asylum in Australia. Human rights advocates are concerned.

item.title: No more Hungarian gas for Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: After Russia stopped supplying Ukraine with natural gas back in June over a pricing dispute, Hungary, Poland, and Slovakia stepped in to fill demand. Today, however, Hungary changed its mind. Meanwhile, the European Union isbrokering talks in Berlinto address Ukraine's gas needs for the coming winter.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Further talks between Russia and Ukraine are expected to take place next week. During today's negotiations, Guenther Oettinger, the the European Commission's commissioner for energy, said Ukraine is open to paying Russia $2 billion by the end of October and then a further $1.1 billion by the end of the year.

item.title: French cigarettes to lose their sex appeal.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: With 73,000 people dying every year in France from smoking-related illnesses, the government has announced plans to introduce plain packaging for cigarettes, in an attempt to make "children born today the first 'non-smoking' generation in 20 years." Australia tried asimilar movein 2012; the impact onexisting smokers is questionable.

item.title: The UK will join the battle against ISIL.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: After seven hours of fierce debate, the UK parliament voted524 votes to 43 votesto engage Islamic State forces in Iraq. Bombings could begin as early as Sunday. Earlier today, Belgium and Denmark alsoagreedto join the coalition. The former will deploy sixF-16 fighter jets. The latter will send seven.

item.title: Activist investor wants to see Yahoo buy AOL.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Starboard Value has purchased a stake in Yahoosize undisclosedwhich it intends to use to try to force the company to acquire AOL. Starboard says there are potentially $1 billion in synergiesthe two can share between theirbusinesses. Yahoo's stock is upover 4%on the news; AOL is up almost 3%.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: AOL CEO Tim Armstrong, when asked about the potential of a Yahoo acquisition in 2012, said the idea was "probably not in the cards," but now that Alibaba has gone public, would he change his mind? Speaking about Alibaba, it could technically buy Yahoo for essentially nothing, thought why would it is something worth pondering. Business Insider has the complete letterStarboard sent to Yahoo CEOMarissa Mayer and its board of directors. Mayer says Yahoo will "review Starboard's letter carefully and look forward to discussing it with them."

item.title: Canada and Europe detail their new friendship.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: A comprehensive trade agreementpromises to boost trade between the two partnersby 20%if the treaty gets finalized.Germany is fretting, however, because of a clause that allows corporations to sue nations. It's unclear whether Germany has the legal authority to shoot down the deal.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Canada accounted for 1.7% of total external EU trade in 2013, making it Europe's 12th largest trading partner.

item.title: Foreign ownership of Russian media companies is capped at 20%.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The legislation passed by Russian parliamentgoes into effect in 2016, with compliance phased in through February 2017. (The current ownership maximum is 50%.) This could spell the end for Forbes' Russian edition; its editor told the Guardian that the publication's German publisher wouldn't want to sell to a Russian owner.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Russia's largest independent broadcasting company, CTC Media, is 38% owned by the Swedish Modern Times Group.

item.title: Goldman Sachs bans its bankers from betting on individual stocks.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Employees used to require approval to make such gambles, but now the whole idea of buying and selling individual stocks is out, along with investments in activist or event-driven hedge funds, according to Bloomberg. It's a favor, really, as targeted portfolios rarely beat the market.

item.title: The gap between Facebook and Google and everyone else is gradually widening.
item.dc:creator: hlandyqz

item.title: Catalonia gets closer to its own referendum.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: The president of the separatist-minded region of Spain has signed a decree calling for a voteon independence, possibly on Nov. 9. The national government in Madrid calls any attempt at a Scottish-style referendum illegal, and islikely to take the dispute over the votewhich Catalonians call a "consultation"to Spain's Constitutional Court.

item.title: The Narendra Modi show continues.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: After speaking at the UN and wowing the crowds at Madison Square Garden, the Indian prime minister is set tomeet 11 CEOs fromcompanies including Google, PepsiCo, and Goldman Sachs. He then sits down fordinner with US president Barack Obama, although Modi will be continuing his 9-day religious fast(paywall).

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Hereis his UN speech in Hindi, which Modi prefers to speak and has encouraged Indian diplomats to use: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u9pRzOZCxEc

item.title: No more cheese for Dear Leader.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: Kim Jong-un is apparently suffering from goutbrought on by a fondness for cheese, smoking, and whisky. North Korea has admitted itsleadersuffers from an "uncomfortable physical condition but said no more. A source told South Korea's news agency that Kim also has "hyperuricemia, hyperlipidemia, obesity, diabetes and high blood pressure."

item.title: Pro-democracy protests paralyze Hong Kong.
item.dc:creator: kevinjdelaney
item.content:encoded: Following several days of tenseclashes with police, organizers launched a civildisobedience campaignaimed at blocking Hong Kong's financial center. The protestors are demanding free elections forHong Kong's next leader, while Beijingplans to limit the candidates to Chinese government loyalists.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The Occupy Central movement marks an escalation of Hong Kong's simmering discontent with Chinese rule. You can follow the South China Morning Post's updating reporton the protests here. Here's a video from Friday of Occupy Central co-organizer Benny Tai discussing whether Hong Kong will ever have genuine democracy. "If you have no demand for democracy, I think no one will give you democracy," Tai said. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CWKsz6WzU6w&feature=youtu.be Instagram has been blocked in mainland China, presumably a government effort to limit access to photos from the Hong Kong protests.

item.title: SoftBank sweet talks Dreamworks Animation.
item.dc:creator: kevinjdelaney
item.content:encoded: The Japanese telecom company is in talks the studio that madeShrek and Madagascaracquire for $3.4 billion, according to the Hollywood Reporter. After regulatory concerns sidelined Softbank's attempts to buy more mobile carriers like T-Mobile, the company is now focusing on acquiring content companies(paywall)specifically video game and movie makersto entice mobile subscribers.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The Hollywood Reporter says DreamWorks Animation CEO Jeffrey Katzenberg wouldcommit to staying with the company for five years. Former top Google executive Nikesh Arora, who is just joining SoftBank to set up a new internet and media unit, is playing a role in the discussions, according to the Hollywood Reporter. (Representatives of the companies have declined to comment.) For a look back at one of DreamWorks Animation's key franchises, here's the 2001 trailer for Shrek. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jYejzdBwvY4

item.title: Facebook Messenger is actually a monster hit
item.dc:creator: jasonqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/271596/facebook-messenger-is-actually-a-monster-hit/

item.title: At least 30 feared dead in Japanese volcano eruption.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: Rescuers are searching for survivors at Mount Ontake, following a violent volcanic eruption yesterday at the popular hiking spot.Japan, no stranger to violent seismic activity,hasn't had anyfatalities from eruptions since 1991.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Dramatic photos and video from survivors showhow quickly the mountain was enveloped in smoke and ash: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7Ea3uED1Zgc

item.title: Air France pilots end their two-week strike.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: The work stoppageled to widespread flight cancellations and cost the French flag carrier20 million ($25 million) per day. The pilots' union isn't happy with new contract talks (paywall), but says that ending its strike will allow negotiations to take place "in a calmer climate."

item.title: Europe retains the Ryder Cup.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: The continent's team reached the 14.5 pointsneeded to win when Welshman Jamie Donaldson, a rookie at 38 years old, beat Keegan Bradley. The US team hasnot won an away contestsince 1993 andEurope hasnow won eight of the past 10 contests.

item.title: France's far right party makes electoral gains.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: The Front National will enter the upper chamber of the French parliament for the first time. Though the Senate doesn't have much power, the vote on Sundaysaw the chamber swingto the right in yet anotherblow to socialist president Francois Hollande following the return of one-time nemesis, Nicolas Sarkozy.

item.title: Apple could face a big fine in Brussels.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: The Financial Times reports (paywall) that the European Unionwill rule thata special tax deal with Ireland amounts to illegal state aid, saddling Apple with a large fine to recoup lost revenues. The European Commission opened up an investigation into Apple's dealings with Irish tax authoritiesin June, along with Starbucks and Fiat.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Apple CFO Luca Maestri told the Financial Times:We know that we didnt do anything that was against the law and we are very confident that through the investigation it will be shown that there was no selective treatment in our favor at any point in time."

item.title: Were arriving at the endgame for BlackBerry.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/272530/blackberry-endgame/

item.title: The CIA has its own secretive Starbucks.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The Langley, VA outletknown only as "Store Number 1" on receiptsforswears loyalty cards and writing customers' names on their cups due to secrecy concerns. But I have no idea what they do, said one background-checked barista. I just know they need coffee, a lot of it.

item.title: Alibaba extendsitsshoppingspree.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The newly-flush Chinese internet giant will spend$459 million on 15% of Beijing Shiji Information, an technologycompany that caters to hotels. Alibaba hopes to build its own travel business and recruit hotel customers to its e-commerce platform.

item.title: Italian tax authorities are investigating Prada's married co-CEOs.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The Hong Kong-listed fashion house said in a statement thatMiuccia Pradaand her husbandPatrizio Bertelli are the targets of "an ongoing examination ...regarding the accuracy of certain past tax filings." Italian tax officials, who last year won a tax fraud case against designersDomenico Dolce and Stefano Gabbana, are reportedly looking atPrada Holdings "alleged tax evasion over the 10 years the holding company was in Luxembourg," according to the Financial Times(paywall).

item.title: UBS claims its focus on wealth management is paying off.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The Swiss bank said it only took two months to pile upprofits of731 million Swiss francs ($769 million), which is already more than analysts expected for the entire third quarter,after it scaledbackon investment banking to focus on fee-based wealth management services. But as one analyst noted to Bloomberg, This is better than expected but then expectations arent very high any more."

item.title: US hits new targets in Syria, civilian deaths claimed.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The US-led coalition bombed the entrance to a major Syrian gas plant controlled by the Islamic State, after previously targeting only small oil refineries. TheUS-led forcesalso destroyed a grain siloin the north of the country, possibly by accident, and killed a number ofcivilians,according to the UK-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights.

item.title: China's censors are working to keep its citizens in the dark.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Despite the attempt at an information blackout, it's obvious thatmainlandinternet users are interested in what is happening in Hong Kong. Before censors tightened their reins on Weibo, "Hong Kong" was a trendingtopic. On FreeWeibo, a website that publishes deleted Weibo posts, "Hong Kong" and "Occupy Central" were the twotop searchestoday. https://twitter.com/JoeXu/status/516372867798548480 "They are our brothers and sisters. They're Chinese," said a 28-year-old pharmaceutical researcherin Chengdu who would only give his surname, Li. "How the government treatsthem is how they will treat us."
http://qz.com/272690/chinese-censors-are-trying-to-erase-hong-kongs-pro-democracy-movement/

Hong Kong and Instagram getting blocked all top trending on weibo before taken down pic.twitter.com/TYNKp4hTmZ

— Joe Xu (@JoeXu) September 28, 2014

item.title: A bloodless transfer of power in Afghanistan.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Ashraf Ghani, a former finance minister and World Bank technocrat, has been sworn in as president. He will share power with his bitter rival, Abdullah Abdullah, who takes the new position of chief executive office. Their first order of business: Give US troops permission to stay in the country past 2014.

item.title: How to turn a tractor into a tank.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Kurdish fighters may not have the most advanced military equipment, but their resourcefulnessplus a couple of buckets of painthas resulted in the creation of battle-hardened vehicles that look like they were ripped from the 1979 film "Mad Max." Luckily for people in and around the Syrian city of Kobane, these battle-bots are being supported by US-led airstrikes.

item.title: Microsoft beats Sony and Nintendo to the punch in China.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Xbox One became the first video-game console to enter the market after China ended a 14-year ban. The first machines were sold in Shanghai, for 4,299 yuan ($699).

item.title: Unlike the Scots, Catalans may not even get an independence vote.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Spanish Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy wants Catalonia's plan to vote for independence on Nov 9 declared illegal. According to the country's 1978 constitution, important matters must be agreed upon by all Spanish citizens, not just the 16%7.5 million peoplewho make up Catalonia. As an independent region, Catalonia's economy would be larger than Portugal's.

item.title: Look for self-driving BMWs speeding along the Great Wall.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The German auto-maker is bringing its prototype autonomous vehicles to Beijing and Shanghai for testing in collaboration with Baidu. The partnership between BMW and China's largest search engine was inked just a few weeks ago; there's no word on when the intelligent driving machines will go on sale.

item.title: Solar could be bigger than fossil fuels by 2050if we really try.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: According to a report fromthe International Energy Agency, electricity generated from photovoltaic systems and solar thermal collectors could generate 16% and 11% of the world's energy needs by 2050, respectively, together surpassing fossil-fuel sources. But that will only come aboutifthe right policy programs and incentivesare put in place.

item.title: Dilma Rousseff pulls ahead.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Brazil's president has clawedback a nine-pointlead over surprise challengerMarina Silvaaccording to anew poll from the MDA firm. Somerecent polls have given the lead toSilva,who took up thebaton only weeks agoafter a plane crash killed her running mate. The first round of voting is on Oct. 5.

item.title: The SoftBank-DreamWorks deal might not happen.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: According to The Wall Street Journal(paywall), talks between the Japanese wireless firmand the Hollywoodmovie studio have cooled, sending the latters stock down as much 8% in after-hours trading. Rumors of the deal only began swirling on Saturday.

item.title: Argentina gets slapped down again.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: The USjudge who ruled against the country in its dispute with foreign bondholders declared it in contempt of court(paywall) for trying to circumvent his ruling. He hasnt set a punishmentyet, though itll probably be small compared with the debts Argentinaowes.

item.title: Apple can finally sell the iPhone 6 in China.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Regulators approved the new smartphones for sale after mysteriously withholding a crucial license for several weeks. But if the price of gray-market iPhones is anything to go by, demand is not exactly sky-high.

item.title: Hong Kong's streets are eerily quiet.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Pro-democracy protests have turned the center of the city into a car-free zone, after a night without any significant confrontations between demonstrators and police. The size of the crowdis smallerthis morning, but is expected to swell again in the evening, ahead oftomorrows National Day holiday celebrating the founding of China. You canfollow the action from the "Umbrella Revolution" here.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Protestors are stockpiling supplies as they prepare for an extended stay. They have demanded that the city's chief executive, Leung Chun-ying step down by October 1, and warned that if he didn't they would remain on the streets for several more days. Here's a scene from last night: https://twitter.com/AFP/status/516646317129744384

Demonstrators hold up cellphones in a display of solidarity during a protest in Hong Kong #Photo by Xaume Olleros pic.twitter.com/EmFASrwkRM

— Agence France-Presse (@AFP) September 29, 2014

item.title: Turkish tanks do battle with the Islamic State.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Shells fired from bythe extremistgroup in Syria landed inside Turkey,killing two soldiers and wounding five others, prompting Turkish tanks to return fire. President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has acknowledged that Turkey "can't stay out" of the US-led campaign against IS.

item.title: Netflix is making an original moviebut it wont come cheap
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The videostreaming companywill work with The Weinstein Company to produce a sequel to "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon," thefirst of several films that will premier simultaneously on Netflix and in Imax theaters. But shelling out for a Hollywood-scale production will be a heavy lift financially, since it will only provide a few hours of entertainment compared to an episodic series like "House of Cards."

item.title: The world has just half the animals it had 40 years ago.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: A London Zoological Society study revised its previous estimate that animal populations fell 30% in 40 years, stating that theydeclined by an average 52% instead.The main threats to numbers are habitat loss and degradation, said the WWF, an animal protection group that collaborated on the report.

item.title: Brazils markets fear four more years of Dilma Rousseff
item.dc:creator: jasonqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/273145/brazils-markets-are-spooked-by-the-thought-of-four-more-years-of-dilma-rousseff/

item.title: The EU details its case against Apple's Irish tax deals.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: Aletter to Irish officials (pdf) about the country'sallegedly illegal aid to the electronics giantreveals the minutes of meetings between Appleand Irish tax officials, which the commission cites as proof that Apple and Ireland worked to "reverse engineer" financial results in order to lower the firm's tax bill. The probe could saddle Apple with a multi-billion-euro fine.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The commission also published the letter it sent to Luxembourg (pdf, in French), in a similar case on the tax treatment of automaker Fiat's financial services arm. The EU is also investigating the Netherlands' tax deal with Starbucks, although details of that case have not yet been revealed.

item.title: Thailands answer to a grisly double murder is ID wristbands for tourists.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The grisly killings of two English tourists on the Thai island of Koh Tao remain unsolved after nearly three weeks, so the country's tourism minister is proposing the wristbandsand eventually "some sort of electronic tracking device"to improve safety. But its unclear how such an elaborate system would ever be implemented, or how it would have saved the lives of Hannah Witheridge, 23, and David Miller, 24, who were murdered on a beach in Koh Tao.

item.title: Euro zone inflation is at a five-year low.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Consumer prices rose by only 0.3% in September, as expected, a fraction of the ECBs targetof about 2%. Separately, German unemploymentunexpectedly ticked higher in September, and the UKs second quarter GDP growth was revised upward to 0.9%.

item.title: Out with the new Windows, in with the old.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Microsoft will unveila new version of its operating systemtoday, codenamed Threshold. It will most likely roll back many of the changes of the previous version, whichthe world largely rejected, and aim to bemore enterprise-friendly.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Some Windows 8 users were kind enough to complain thatthe update wassimply ahead of its time for its touchscreen capabilities and tablet-like interface:plenty more were happier to point outthe similarities between it and some sights that are best forgotten.

item.title: The EU details its tax case against Apple in Ireland.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Aletter to Irish officials (pdf) about the countrysallegedly illegal aid to the electronics giantreveals the minutes of meetings between Appleand Irish tax officials, which the commission cites as proof that Apple and Ireland worked to reverse engineer financial results in order to lower the firms tax bill. The probe could saddle Apple with a multi-billion-euro fine.

item.title: ExxonMobil strengthens Putins hand against the West.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The oil giant asked andreceiveda delay to sanctions to allow it to safely wind down a drilling project in the Russian Arctic. But in that time it discovered a massive oil and gas field, which givesRussian president Vladimir Putin extra incentive to maintainhis defiant stanceover the Ukraine.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Last week Putin wrote to Ukrainian president Petro Poroshenko threatening to reduce Ukraine's access to Russian markets if it goes ahead with a long-planned trade agreementwith the EU. With a billion new barrels of oilcoming to him, these are precisely the kind of moves Putin could now make while trying to wait out Western sanctions.

item.title: EBay and PayPal to part ways.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: After years ofjustifying staying together, eBay announcedthat it will split from payments provider PayPal next year. Ebay CEO John Donahoe will step down once the auction and payments businessesbecome separate publicly-traded companies.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: "When you look forward, eBay will be less than 15% of Paypal's business three years from now and we can achieve many of the benefits of the synergies through arms-length commercial relationships," Donahoe told CNBC.

item.title: EU sanctions on Russia will stay put.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Despite the progress made since Russia and Ukraine signed a ceasefire agreement on Sept. 5, anEU spokeswoman said that more needs to be done before sanctions can be lifted. Yesterday was the bloodiest day of fighting since the peace deal was reachedseven Ukrainian troops were killed nearDonetsk airport.

item.title: Netflix is making a movieits first.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: "House of Cards" and "Orange is the new Black" have won numerous awards, but Netflix has greater ambitions. The streaming service, in partnership with theWeinstein Company, will release a sequel to the 2000 film "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon". In Aug. 2015, Netflix's 50 million users will get to choose whether they want to see it at home or on the silver screen.

item.title: Catalonia scraps independence vote marketing blitz.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: When the Catalonian government scheduled aNov. 9 referendum on its sovereignty, the Spanish government asked the constitutional court to intervene. Sure enough, itdid, prompting Catalonia to stop publicizingthereferendum(paywall) for fear of defying the court's ruling. Private individuals, however, are still free to beat the independencedrum.

item.title: Kenya magically becomes a middle-income country.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: After Kenya's statistics agency rebased GDP figures and tweaked anExcel spreadsheet, theeconomy "grew" by 25% to an annual GDP of $55.2 billion last year versus a previously reported$44.1 billion. TheWorld Bank now considers the African nation to be a "middle-income" economy instead of a "low-income" one. Even withper capita GDPnow$1,246, however, poverty levels remain at45.9%.

item.title: The UK finally joins the battle against the Islamic State.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The Royal Air Force said its jets destroyedan armored truck and a "heavy weapon position" in Iraq. Kurdish forcessaidthe attacks helped them win control ofan area near the Iraq-Syria border.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Not surprisingly, the Islamic Stateis capitalizingon its home turf advantage. When ISIL fighters receiveword of an imminent airstrike, theyteardown their camps and simply relocate. They also issue orders to curtailtheusage of military-grade vehiclesand mobile phones, to be less conspicuous.

item.title: Sweden's sewage has an explosive secret.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The pipes that run under the homes of Stockholm's 700,000 residents are being retrofitted with sensors that can detect the chemicals bomb makers use to manufacturetheir explosives.Members of the UK's Ministry of Defence and the US Department of Homeland Securityhave taken an interest inthe project, which is known as "Emphasis".

item.title: Microsoft demos Windows 10mysteriously skips Windows 9.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Starting tomorrow, Microsoft will offer an earlyversion of theoperating system that it plans on delivering in mid-2015. Windows 10 strips away many of the Windows 8 features that drove users to buy tabletsinstead of upgrading their current PCs.

item.title: Ebola reaches the US...
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: An unnamedman wasdiagnosed with the Ebola virusin Dallas, Texas, aftercoming to the US from Liberia. The head of the US Centers for Disease Control said hehas no doubt we will stop this in its tracks," and indeed it is almost impossible for the disease to spread in the United Statesbutshares of drug firmsspiked anyway.

item.title: Nigeria gets its Ebola outbreak under control.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: All known Ebola patients in the country are now beingtreated and no new cases have been reported for a month. Senegal has also not had any new cases for a month, and its only patient has recovered from the virus.

item.title: w
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

item.title: Reddit taps celebrities and Silicon Valley for funding.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The social media site raised $50 million from rapper Snoop Dogg and actor Jared Leto along with venture capitalistsMarc Andreessen and Peter Thiel, valuing it at a reported $500 million. Investors will also give 10% of their shares to Reddit users, who monitor the site and perform crucial maintenance tasks.

item.title: Who is paying for America's $1.2 billion election cycle?
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/273071/the-1-2-billion-and-counting-of-2014-us-political-spending-in-charts/

item.title: Caffeinated underwear ispulled from USshelves.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The bras, girdles, and leggings were supposed to aid weight loss, but turned out to be decaf. Misled consumers will receive about $1.5 million in refunds.

item.title: Hong Kong protests enter a fourth night.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Protesters booed the Chinese flagand jeered champagne-sipping city leadersat a ceremony for Chinas National Daya holiday that resulted in bigger crowds but no confrontations with police. Hong Kong and Beijing officials appear to be waiting the protests out,rather than cracking down or bending to demonstrators demands.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The Wall Street Journal(paywall) reports that Hong Kong's government is now open to meeting with protesters, but only if there are no preconditions to such a meeting. The protest'sorganizers said they are not going to back down from their demand that Hong Kong Chief Executive Leung Chun-ying resigns. The protestors have gotten a lot of positivepress for their politeness, but there was some confrontation when Falun Gong activistsdetested by the Beijing governmentwanted to march through anarea occupied by democracy protestors. The pro-democracy campeventually turned away the Falun Gong group to avoid association.

item.title: A networking app from the Hong Kong protests is also a hit in India.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Firechatlets smartphone users communicate without an internet connection, or share connectivity where it's scarce. Hong Kong pre-democracy protesters are using it to pre-empt a government internet crackdown, but in India it is helping to make the most of the country's rickety communications infrastructure.

item.title: Adidas kicks off a shareholder charm offensive.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: As hedge funds prepare to push for management changes, the world's second-largest sportswear maker will return1.5 billion ($1.9 billion) to unhappy investorsover the next three yearsthrough share buybacks, dividends, and other means.Adidas has issued three profit warnings already this year.

item.title: Ukraines ceasefire is barely holding.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Separatists have repeatedlyshelled Ukraine army positions and tried to storm the Donetsk airport, according to the Kyivgovernment. The US ambassador says Russian forces and equipment are still in Ukraine, and the border is unsecured.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Shelling even hit a Donetsk school, killing a parent, a teacher, and two other adultsno children were killed according to preliminary reports. The IMF cut Russia's GDP forecast by halfto 0.5%citing "geopolitical uncertainties," which is a politeway of saying the situation in Ukraine.

item.title: France will hit its twice-delayed deficit target, it swears.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The slowEuropean recovery hascaused France to delayyet againits goal of reducing the public deficit to below 3%.It had aimedto reach EU-mandated debt levels by 2013, but now says it'll only be able to do that in 2017. Itwill have to cut 50 billion euros fromprojected public spending between now and then.

item.title: India and the US will blast off into space together.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: NASA and India'sSpace Research Organisation (ISRO) signed a pair of agreements yesterday that will see the two nations working together to launch an Earth-monitoring spacecraft by 2020 and to form a joint mission planning team that will be responsible for researching Mars. India could certainly teach NASAa thing or two about budget space travel.

item.title: Germany wants to put blinders on Google's all-knowing eye.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: If you use multiple Google services, Google aggregates the data you leave strewnacross its platforms toform a profilepegging yoursex, age, relationshipstatus, and even finances. Hamburg's data protection authorities have told Google they want it to modify its privacy policy so that this profilingisunder users' control.

item.title: Bank CEOs can finally make ends meet again.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Bank CEO compensation levels haverecovered and reached the heights ofpre-crisis levels, according to a new report from the International MonetaryFund (IMF). The heads of European institutions even saw their salaries increase compared to 2008. None of this should be toosurprisingwhere there's a will, there's a way.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The IMF recommends tying executive paymore closely to risk, to dampen therisk-taking that contributed to the global financial crisis.

item.title: Women snackers are driving the $374-billion global snack industry.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/273864/whos-snacking-where-on-what-eating-habits-by-gender-and-region/

item.title: That convenient Wi-Fi on planes could blank out cockpit screens.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The USFederal Aviation Administration is has orderedairlines to replace Honeywell-made cockpit displays that don't seem to get along with Wi-Fi signals and cellular devices.Thescreens, which can blank out with interference, are in in1,326 planesBoeing 737 and 777 modelsand must be replaced over the next five years at a cost of $13.8 million.

item.title: Pepsi sweetened with stevia is launching as an Amazon exclusive.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Pepsi True will look and taste like regular Pepsi, but it'll be sweetened with a combination of sugar and the herbal sweetener stevia instead of high-fructose corn syrup. True will eventually be ongrocery store shelves, but not the big chains. The new concoction will be 40 calories lighter thanthe original, though the health-conscious should probably stillstick to water.

item.title: Despite coalition bombings, ISIL forces are set to capture Kobani.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: ISIL fighters are just akilometer away from the entrance of theSyrian town on the border with Turkey, which is being defended by Kurdish forces. This comes in spite ofthe UK successfully destroying multiple targets this week and the US-led bombing of three oil refineries that were funding ISIL to the tune of $3 million per day.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Turkey'sparliament is due tovote on whether toaugment the firepower currently being supplied by the US and its allies.

item.title: Art-fancying will soon be a seven-day-a-week activity in France.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Starting next year, the Louvre, the Palace of Versailles, and the Muse d'Orsay will be open every day, instead of justsix days a week. Combined, the three attract 19.7 million visitors a yearlarger than the entire population of the Netherlands. The movewill boost the local economy, but will it help France pay its bills?

item.title: You're not the only one who has dropped your phone in the toilet.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/274368/theres-a-good-chance-youre-reading-this-on-a-damaged-mobile-device/

item.title: Viagra could damage some men's vision.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Sildenafil, the active ingredient in Viagra, can cause temporary vision problems for anyone, but for the one in 50 men who carry a mutated genelinked to retinal degeneration, the drug may do more harm. Mice with the gene who took slidenafil experienced vision damagefor two weeksand their eyes showedearly signs of cell death.

item.title: Fumbles force the US Secret Service director to resign.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: First there wasthefence-jumper incident.Then the revelation that anarmed security contractoran ex-convictrode an elevator withpresident Barack Obama. Director Julia Pierson stepped downafter a grilling on Capitol Hill yesterday from members of both parties, who questioned her agency's competence. She'll be replaced by a retired Secret Service man, Joseph Clancy.

item.title: The Texas Ebola patient is identified as a mid-40s man from Monrovia.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Government officials in Liberia have revealed the identityof the man being treated in Dallas for the first US case of the Ebola virus. His name is Thomas Eric Duncanand he lives in thecountry's capital, where he worked for a company that helps FedEx get its packages through custom controls.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Duncan, who arrived in the US on Sept. 20, went to hospital with symptoms on Sept. 26 but was sent home, despite telling them he had recently arrived from Liberia, where the disease is spreading rapidly. He returned two days later and is now in intensive care at Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital in Dallas. Health officials are monitoring atleast12 to 18 peoplehave been had contact with Duncan in the US,including three members of the ambulance crew that transported him to the hospital and five children who returned to school after being exposed to Duncan. Before leaving Liberia, Duncanhelped transport a pregnant neighbor with the disease to hospital,riding with her in a car and helping to carry her in, the New York Times reports (paywall). She later died.

item.title: The six companies that make 50% of the worlds beer.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/274568/the-family-trees-of-the-five-companies-that-make-50-of-the-worlds-beer/

item.title: The odds of scoring a US diversity visa are not in your favor.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/273868/if-you-have-a-high-school-diploma-and-come-from-these-countries-you-can-enlist-in-a-lottery-for-a-us-green-card/

item.title: Hyundai workers return to the factory floor.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Staff voted by a slim 51.5% margin to end to a strike that was expandedafter Hyundai paid$10 billion for a trophy plot of land in Seoul's Gangnam district. The company's workers, whowill each receive paymentsof8.9 million won ($8,400), have gone on strike for all but four of their union's 27-year history.

item.title: Hong Kong's protests could get messy
item.dc:creator: htimmonsqz
item.content:encoded: Now in their fifth day, the pro-democracy protests that have shut down much of central Hong Kong may shift from the festive atmosphere of the past few days to a political showdown. Student activists set today as a deadline for the city's chief executive to step down and vow to storm government buildings if he does not.

item.title: Hong Kong's protests could get messy
item.dc:creator: htimmonsqz
item.content:encoded: Now in their fifth day, the pro-democracy protests that have shut down central Hong Kong may transition from the festive atmosphere of recent days to political showdown. Student activists have set the end of today as the deadline for the city's chief executive to retire, and vow to storm government buildings if he does not.

item.title: The Hong Kong cops are preparing their riot gear.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Pro-democracy demonstrators whohave shut down central Hong Kong for five days are calling for CY Leung, thecitys chief executive, to step down. He has refused, but he's saidChief Secretary Carrie Lam will hold negotiations with the protestors and discuss potential constitutional reform. Beijing is pledging its support forLeungandpolice are warning ofserious consequences if protesters don't stand down.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Protest leaders on Twitter are warning that the police are mobilizing with tear gas, batons, and other crowd control gear. https://twitter.com/tomgrundy/status/517608543730425858 https://twitter.com/krislc/status/517605380147253248 https://twitter.com/george_chen/status/517609324206882816 The South China Morning Post reports on its live blog:
Crowds getting worked up in Tamar, outside CY Leung's office behind the PLA barracks, after they spot police officers bringing in dozens of boxes labelled "batons" and others marked "flammable" and "corrosive". Suspecting they are weapons or riot gear, protesters shout "shameless" and "explain". Police supplies are trickling in through a narrow path between anti-protest metal fences and the stone wall of the barracks. Officers are bringing them into the government offices one by one. As angry protesters surge forward, police struggle to maintain the supply line.
Here's the latest statement from Hong Kong's government: https://twitter.com/varsitycuhk/status/517613475627925505/photo/1

Student leader Agnes Chow says police are amassing, asks protesters to tell friends to come #Occupycentral pic.twitter.com/hLjnGRYg6y

— Tom Grundy (@tomgrundy) October 2, 2014

NOW at Police Headquarters #UmbrellaRevolution pic.twitter.com/trn8husmc0

— Kris Cheng (@krislc) October 2, 2014

Asked if Hong Kong Police will fire tear gas at protesters again, HK police spox: "won't rule out the possibility", if they ignore warnings.

— George Chen (@george_chen) October 2, 2014

item.title: Zara throws in with Alibaba.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: One of the worlds largest fashion retailersagreed to sell its apparelvia Tmall, an Alibaba platform that takes a commission on sales. Despite Zara being one of the most popular brands in China, its Zara.cn site failed to make an impact.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Although Zara will need to concedebetween 0.5%-5% of its sales revenue to Alibaba, a huge rise in visibilitymaynot be the only benefit the retailer has in mind: it may also forceTmall to finally push imitators, such as Zara Kara, off the platform.

item.title: Netflix gets Adam Sandler.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
