item.content:encoded: The actor's Happy Madison production company willproduce fourfeature films that willpremiere exclusively onthe streaming service. Netflix has had a successful run making top-of-the-line TV dramas like "Orange is the New Black," but now it seems to be making a foray into action movie sequels and lowbrow comedies; most of Sandler's latest films have tanked at the box office and been savaged by critics.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Sandler issued the following statement:
When these fine people came to me with an offer to make four movies for them, I immediately said yes for one reason and one reason only... Netflix rhymes with Wet Chicks. Let the streaming begin!!!!
Netflix may be calculating that whatever the comedic or financial shortcomings of his recent oeuvre, Sandler remains a global box office draw with billions in lifetime box office sales. The company said that audience data shows that Netflix users watch his films again, and again, and again. And check out the love he gets on his Instagram: http://instagram.com/p/toudlYqQH5

item.title: Is China finally choosing reform over growth?
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The central government said it would begin capping local governments' borrowing levels to encourage accountability (though it didn't specify the amount of the quota) and to prevent officials from taking on more debt through off-balance sheet financing vehicles.The move could mean a short-term drop in infrastructure spending and is unlikely to help China reach its annualGDP growth target of 7.5%.

item.title: Rocket Internet's IPO misfires.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The German technology incubator'sshares fell 12% on their first day of trading in Frankfurt. Rocketsometimes accused of cloning other online business ideaspriced the1.6 billion sale at the top end of its expected range, giving the company an initial value of 6.7 billion ($8.5 billion).

item.title: Beer's family tree.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/274568/the-family-trees-of-the-five-companies-that-make-50-of-the-worlds-beer/

item.title: The European Central Bank tries to save the day (again).
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The ECB left its rock-bottom interest rates unchanged, as expected, but market watchers were anyway more interested inpresident Mario Draghi's press conference, where he revealed details ofa bond-buying plan. TheECB has hinted that it couldboost its balance sheet by up to1 trillion ($1.26 trillion)in hopes ofjumpstarting the euro zones moribund economy.

item.title: Strife is battering the Ukrainian economy.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The World Bank has revised itsestimates for the country's economic prospects. Instead of shrinking 5% this year and then growing 2.5% in 2015, it now says the economy will shrink by 8% this year and a further 1% next year. The revisionwas due to the fighting between government forces and Russia-backed separatists in eastern Ukrainewhich continues despite a ceasefire agreement.

item.title: The Angry Birds have come to roost.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: In a note published by Rovio Entertainment CEO Mikael Hed, he admits that the company behind the addictive online and mobile game Angry Birds has been "building our team on assumptions of faster growth than have materialized." Thus,130 employeesin Finland16% of its workforceare being let go. Hed will step down in January and hand the slingshot to Pekka Rantala.

item.title: Elon Musk tweets about an elusive "D".
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The CEOof Tesla and SpaceX tweeted an imageof a car in a dimly lit garage with a large "D" painted on the garage door. Under the text: "Oct. 9mark your calendars."which couldalludetoan upgrade or new vehicle.Tesla is currently selling the Model S, will soon sell the Model X, and plans an affordable Model 3 for 2017.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/517486950589014016

About time to unveil the D and something else pic.twitter.com/qp23yi59i6

— Elon Musk (@elonmusk) October 2, 2014

item.title: US jobless claims just keep on falling.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: For the third week in a row, the number of people seeking US unemployment benefits has fallen, approaching their lowest level in years. The latest figure from the labor department has claims falling by 8,000 to 287,000 during the final week of September. Investors were expecting an increase to 298,000 due to other economic indicators suggesting lagging growth.

item.title: Ukraine rebels take another stab at Donetsk airport.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Despite a Sept. 5 ceasefire that increasingly looks irrelevant, rebel forces in eastern Ukraine say they have captured 95% ofthe government-heldairport in Donetsk. AnAPreporter saidUkraine may have already lost control of the facility, which would helpresupply the rebel fighters.

item.title: The diseases that kill children around the world
item.dc:creator: qzroya

item.title: Warren Buffett is now a car salesman.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The second richest person in Americaaccording to Forbeshas purchasedthe Van Tuyl Group, an independent chainof 78 car dealerships with locations in 10 US states. Details of the transition weren't disclosed. Buffet will rename the group Berkshire Hathaway Automotive, though the $8 billion business will still be operated byLarry Van Tuyl.

item.title: Apple sweetens its employee perks.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: In an effort to compete withFacebook and Google hiringand hold onto its98,000 employees, the iPhone and iPad makeris upping the HR ante. That meanslonger parental leave, reimbursement for college classes, a more expansive donation-matching program, and pampering at an in-house zen palacehealth spa.

item.title: The most popular university major in the US leads to the least fulfilling work
item.dc:creator: qzroya

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/275139/the-most-popular-university-major-in-the-us-leads-to-the-least-fulfilling-work/

item.title: You too can live like New York mayor Bill de Blasio.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The former Brooklynite has been living in Gracie Mansion since July, so it's about time he put up histhree-story townhouse inPark Slope up on the market. Living there will cost you only $4,975 a month, but you'll have to ditch allpets and smoking habits.

item.title: Bob Iger will be sitting pretty at Disney for a while.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The Disney CEO is settling into two more years on the job, having extended his stay once already. His new departure date isJune 2018.The market's still not sure what to make of the decision.

item.title: Turkey approves the use of force against ISIL.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The country's military is cleared to fight in both Iraq and Syria against the extremist group, and alliednations will be ableto conduct campaigns from Turkish soil. The Syrian town of Kobaniwhich sits on Turkeys borderis on the vergeof being captured by ISIL, spurringan exodusof refugees.

item.title: Wall Street hates nice people.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: GoPros shares fell by nearly 9% after investors discovered the companys founders donated $500 million worth of company shares to charity.

item.title: Hong Kong's government workers just got the day off.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: They can't get to work because pro-democracy demonstrators are barricading government buildings. Quartz's Heather Timmons is on the scene.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
https://twitter.com/HeathaT/status/517843214338752512
https://twitter.com/HeathaT/status/517833137087193088
https://twitter.com/HeathaT/status/517820464412889088

HK govt rep outside HQ just announced that all public servants have the day off (b/c people can't get in) #OccupyCentral won this round

— Heather Timmons (@HeathaT) October 3, 2014

HK govt employees who can't get to work now milling around outside #OccupyCentral pic.twitter.com/tJXDEXhQpq

— Heather Timmons (@HeathaT) October 3, 2014

"Imagine" banner at #OccupyCentral pic.twitter.com/MBSjPv9qMg

— Heather Timmons (@HeathaT) October 2, 2014

item.title: Another Hong Kong showdown.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Minutes before the deadline that protestors gave chief executiveCY Leung to resign, Leung refused to relinquish powerbut offered demonstrators a chance to begin talks with his deputy, chief secretaryCarrie Lam. No date was given forthe meeting, whichHong Kong's CEO said would only apply to only one of the student groups involved: it seems Leung has played a Machiavellian maneuver to try to urge protestors to go home, lest they lose this opportunity.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Some scuffles broke out among protestors who argued over whether or not to remove barricades, but most government buildings remain closed asactivists await a confirmed date(live feed) to speak with Lam.

item.title: JPMorgan's data breach turns out to be absolutely enormous.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Acyberattack exposed the personal information of 76 million households and 7 million businesses; the bank previously said only 1million were affected. The hacker attack, now amongthe largest ever, gained access to names, addresses, phone numbers, and emails, putting customers at risk forfurther fraud attempts

item.title: As Hong Kong's protestors clash, negotiations are delayed.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Around the city, chaotic scuffleseruptedbetween pro-democracy protesters, people opposed to protests, and police, in what appeared to be an organized attack on three different protest areas. Scheduled talks have been postponed because the protest leaders say the government isn't protecting them.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Protesters unhappy with chief executive CY Leung'srefusal to step down last nighthad barricaded the government's offices, forcing the city todeclare another day off. Several foreign reporters were asked to leave, and at least one was stuck by a man opposed to the protest. Were going to protest until the government takes responsibility, until the chief executive resigns, and until we really have universal suffrage, said a protester named Lucas, 24, who was stationed outside, wearing a raincoat and a mask. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BB8ZGN2dwJ4 After several small but tense scuffles, it became clear that the protesters wouldnt budge. A government representative came out with a megaphone and announced that all public servants have the day off. Then the workers that had already entered the building were let out single-file: https://twitter.com/HeathaT/status/517845918180065280 The blockade clearly angered some of the workers. Why do you have the right to protest and I dont have the right to go to work? one grey-haired woman, who said she was a cleaner, screamed at the protesters.
{{unknown}}

Workers file out of Hong Kong govt HQ past protesters pic.twitter.com/S7eczXCCl8

— Heather Timmons (@HeathaT) October 3, 2014

item.title: Anti-occupiers are tearing down tents and starting fights in Hong Kong.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: People opposed to the pro-democracy protests that have paralyzedHong Kong for nearly a week have taken matters into their own handsstarting a series of chaotic scuffles withprotestersanddismantling the pro-democracy demonstrators'makeshift shelters.

item.title: China is driving a global clean-energy rebound.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/275577/china-is-driving-a-global-renewable-energy-rebound-but-it-might-not-last/

item.title: The US sees sturdy job growth.
item.dc:creator: isenqz
item.content:encoded: The US economy added 248,000 jobs in September, and the unemployment rate fell to 5.9%, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics. Here are two simple charts breaking down howthe country's employment and job creation look.

item.title: Long lost Sherlock Holmes silent film discovered in French vault.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The catchphrase "elementary" wasn't the creation of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, it came from US actor William Gillette. Movies starring Gillette were thought to have been lost forever, but staff at the Cinmathque Franaise hasfound a 1916 silent film showing what's said to be a quintessentialportrayal of Holmes.

item.title: Sweden will recognize the Palestinian state.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The Nordic country has become the first major European nation toannounce plansto do so. The United Nations recognized Palestine back in 2012as an observer, but the rest of the world has been slow to react for numerous reasons. Now, more than 130 countries recognize Palestinearound 70% of the UN.

item.title: The US is now screening 50 people for Ebola.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The US Center for Disease Control'sdirector Tom Frieden is "confident that we can contain any spread of Ebola," but says it isn'tgoing to be easy. US officials originally said some 100 people arebeing evaluated for potential exposure to the virus, but that number has now been halved to just 50of those, 10 are at "high risk" for developing the disease.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: On the other side of the pond, Germany began treating its second Ebola patient, an unnamed male Ugandan doctor who was seeing Ebola patients in Sierra Leone.

item.title: Europe finally approves Facebook's WhatsApp acquisition.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: With much fanfarein February of this year, Mark Zuckerberg announced that he wanted to buy the popular chat application WhatsApp for $19 billion. US regulators granted his wish just two months later, and with that the wait for the European green light began. It's now over.

item.title: The Islamic State is attacked by a suicide bomber.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: A female Kurdish fighter reportedly carried out the attackoutside of Kobani, theembattled Syrian town near the Turkey border that is close to being overrun by the extremist IS, which itself often uses suicide bombers. About160,000 residents of the area have fled across the border to Turkey.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The UK is also beefing up itsforces, with prime minister David Cameron announcing that two additional Royal Air Force (RAF) jets will soon join the six already deployed in Cyprus. Four missions have been executed thus far, with eight targets successfully destroyed in five locations. A video showing British citizenAlan Henning being beheaded was released by ISIL, to which David Cameron responded: "We will do all we can to hunt down these murderers and bring them to justice." Canada is said to be the latest member to join ISIL strikesat request of the USthough it's just a rumor at this point. Parliament hasn't voted on the matter yet.

item.title: New iPads are allegedly less than two weeks away.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Re/code's John Paczkowski is reporting that Apple will hold an event on Oct. 16 to unveil"updates to its iPad line" along with new iMac desktop computers and a new version of its Mac OS X operating system. Apple has not confirmed the report. Earlier this week, Bloomberg said a new gold-colored iPadis in the works.

item.title: The "mancession" is over.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/275676/all-the-key-charts-from-todays-robust-us-jobs-report/

item.title: A new Bond novel turns the British spy into boy racer.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The Ian Fleming estate has granted a59-year-old novelist,Anthony Horowitz, the rights to dream upa new chapter inthe life of one of popular fiction's most famous action heroesJames Bond. Currently known as "Project One," the book will placethe debonair Brit in the world of motorsport in the 1950s. Look for it on shelves in September of 2015.

item.title: Russian doctors should crack a smile once in a while.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The last person you want to look bored or grumpyisyour doctor. Butthatappears to be a common complaint in Russia, which iswhyVeronika Skvortsova, Russia's minister of health, has decreedthe following: "The smile ofa medical professional is theformula forsuccess incuring thepatient."

item.title: Yahoo is spending that Alibaba money on chat apps.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Two separate reports on Friday suggest that Yahoo is investing some of the money itmade off the Alibaba IPO into messaging apps. The first, from TechCrunch, has Yahoo allegedly spending "single-digit millions" onMessageMe. The second, from the Wall Street Journal, says Yahoo has purchased a stake of an unknown size in Snapchat, at a $10-billion valuation.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
After Snapchat turned down a $3-billion cash acquisition offer from Facebook last yearand with the company doing just fine on its ownsome observers are saying they'll believe that a Yahoo deal is in the works only when the ink is dry.

https://twitter.com/danprimack/status/518110711655190528

FWIW: With Snapchat in particular, no investment is really done until it's done.

— danprimack (@danprimack) October 3, 2014

item.title: The last guy as good as Obama at cutting unemployment? Reagan.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/275878/obama-is-just-as-good-as-reagan-at-cutting-unemployment/

item.title: Brazil is one step closer to its next president.
item.dc:creator: zachseward
item.content:encoded: IncumbentDilma Rousseff won the most votesin Sundays first-round election, andpro-business candidateAcio Neves surged aheadMarina Silva to finish second. Arunoff between Rousseff and Neves will take place on October 26.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: https://twitter.com/ShastaCNN/status/518402260439945216 And no selfies eithertaking photos in a voting booth is illegal in Brazil.

No hanging chads here. In #Brazil elections electronic voting machines mean results within hours of polls closing pic.twitter.com/Q6hHleTvnz

— Shasta Darlington (@ShastaCNN) October 4, 2014

item.title: Hong Kong faces an ultimatum.
item.dc:creator: zachseward
item.content:encoded: The city's chief executive gave protestors until the morning of Monday, Oct. 6, to clear the streets,or he will "take all necessary actions to restore social order." This evening,tens of thousands of people have gathered at the protest's epicenter for another rally. Follow the hashtag #OccupyCentral.

item.title: "Baby Doc" is dead.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: The formerdictator of Haiti, Jean-Claude Duvalier, has died of a heart attack at the age of 63. He was only 19 when, in 1971, he inheritedthe title of "president for life" from his father. The younger Duvalier's cruel reign was finally ended byan uprising in 1986.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: In a series of tweets, the country's current president,Michel Martelly, was surprisingly cordial: "Despite our squabbles and our differences, we salute the departure of a true son of Haiti," he wrote in French. "Love and reconciliation must always overcome our quarrels. May your soul rest in peace."

item.title: Time is an illusion down under.
item.dc:creator: zachseward
item.content:encoded: The beginning of daylight saving time in somebut not allparts of the country means there arefive Australian time zonesfor summer, instead of the usual three. Sydney is now"half an hour ahead of Adelaide, one hour ahead of Brisbane, one and a half hours ahead of Darwin, and three hours ahead of Perth." Got it?

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: [caption id="attachment_276223" align="alignleft" width="640"] [/caption]

item.title: HP is splitting in two.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: The company plans to separateits PCand printer business from its hardware and services operations next year.The splitincreasingly common in a tech industry being reshaped by new competitive threatscould unleash another round of deal-making, including the combination of the HP hardware business with data storage giant EMC.

item.title: Hong Kong protests limp into their second week.
item.dc:creator: htimmonsqz
item.content:encoded: The Hong Kong government let a dwindling number ofprotestersremain in placeon Monday morning, after a small path was cleared to allow governmentworkers to return to work. Hong Kong government officials and student protest leaders met for the first time on Sunday night, but the talks have not yielded any concrete results.

item.title: Samsung bets on smartphonesjust not its own.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The South Korean tech giant, facing sharp declines in profits from its smartphone division, is investing15.6 trillion won ($15 billion) in a new semiconductor factory to build chips for mobile devices. Samsung's own devices aregetting squeezedby Apple and low-margin Chinese competitorsbut much of the industry uses Samsung's chips.

item.title: Snapchat and Square close in on new funding.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Yahoo is preparing to invest around $20 million(paywall) into Snapchat, according to the Wall Street Journal, in a deal that would value the messaging app at $10 billion.And Square, an electronic payments start-upthatis facing new competition from Apple and a standalone PayPal, secured $150 million in new venture capital fundingthat values the company at $6 billion.

item.title: The US is mulling greater airport screening for Ebola.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: TheCenters for Disease Control is studying whether enhanced screening would justify the disruption of air travel. Meanwhile, Thomas Duncan, the first person to be diagnosed with Ebola in the US, is "fighting for his life" due to a shortage of the few experimental drugs for the disease.

item.title: Joe Biden sticks both feet in his mouth.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The US vice president called the crown prince of Abu Dhabi to take back remarks that the United Arab Emirates had funded Al Qaeda fighters in Syria. On Saturday, Biden apologized to Recep Tayyip Erdogan for claiming Turkey's president had admitted to allowing potential ISIL recruits to cross into Syria.

item.title: The World Bank sees China slowing.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Estimates for the country's growth were lowered to 7.4% for this year, 7.2% for 2015, and 7.1% for 2016. The previous estimates were 7.6% for 2014 and 7.5% for both 2015 and 2016. Cement production is proving to be a reliable tracker for China's economic growthcertainly better than the housing market.

item.title: A Norwegian couple win the Nobel for medicine.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: May-Britt and Edvard Moser, who won for their work on the the brain's "inner GPS," become only the fifth married couple ever to win Nobels. They will share the $1.1 million prize with British-American John OKeefe.

item.title: FCC takes a pause to think about Comcast-Time Warner Cable mega-merger.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The $45 billion marriage was meant to be open for public comment and debate until Oct. 8, but that portion of the review has now been pushed back to Oct. 29; the agency expects its review of the deal to be done by Jan. 2016. If it goes through, some fear thecombined entity would possessavast regional hegemony.

item.title: Facebook's WhatsApp acquisition is now complete.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Originally announced in February, it was to be a $19 billion transaction. Due to Facebook's recent stock performanceinvestors are always keen on increasedad revenuethe deal, finally cleared by European Union regulators, is now worth $21.8 billion.

item.title: The first child born from a transplanted womb is named Vincent.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The mother is an unnamed 36-year-old Swedish woman, one of nine who receive a womb transplant win January. She had been unable to conceive because of a condition known as Mllerian agenesis. The womb donor is the baby's godmother.

item.title: Politicians aren't fans of the Ukrainian trash bucket challenge.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Apparently inspired by the ALS Ice Bucket Challenge Ukrainian activists are literally throwing politicians into dumpstersoften making them sit in filth for as long as 30 minutesin order to protest against corruption. As with any internet sensation, there's a hashtag you can follow.

item.title: John Galliano, fashion's controversial showman, is making a comeback.
item.dc:creator: javinsqz

item.title: Ebola infected someone outside of Africa for the first time.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: A female nurse in Madridtested positive for the disease, afterworking in a hospital there that was treating an Ebola victim. All the previous victims, includingThomas Eric Duncan,have contracted the disease in Africa.

item.title: Here's the real reason digital currency advocates should be worried about bitcoin.
item.dc:creator: hlandyqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/276841/falling-prices-arent-the-real-reason-to-worry-about-bitcoin/

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg was forced to install WhatsApp to buy Oculus.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Brendan Iribe, CEO of the virtual reality headset company Oculus, doesn't have Facebooknor Facebook Messengeron his phone. And since Iribe isbased in Irvine, Calif., and not Silicon Valley, Bloomberg says Zuckerberg, after offering $19 billion for WhatsApp,finally resorted to installing the app on his phone to communicate with Iribe about the deal.

item.title: Samsung's profits are dropping like a stone.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The South Korean tech giant said its third-quarter operating profits would fall by 60%even worse than most analysts expecteddue to intense competition in the smartphone market, which is eating away at the company's market share and forcing heavy discounting andmarketing expenditures. Samsungexpects quarterly operating profits of4.1 trillion won ($3.8 billion)less than half of what analysts expected as of January.

item.title: Glencore tried to merge withRio Tinto.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The Anglo-Swiss firmapproached Rio Tinto this summer with a merger proposal that would have created the world's largest mining company,butwas turned down in August. Glencore is nowgaugingAluminium Corporation of China's interest in a deal; the state-owned companycontrols 9.8% of Rio Tinto.

item.title: Prince should have used a fact-checker.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Doves, though they have tear ducts and canproduce "mournful-sounding calls,"cannot cry.

item.title: Vladimir Putin got a Hercules-themed art show for his birthday.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The paintings show the Russian presidentbattling a seven-headed sanctions hydra, grappling witha terrorist, andmore.

item.title: Hong Kong protesters agree to negotiations.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The pro-democracy Federation of Students andgovernment representatives said "substantive"talks would go ahead this week. The student group warned thatprotests would continue in threekey areas of the city unless progress was made, though their numbers have been dwindling in recent days.

item.title: Three scientists win a Nobel for making the world a little brighter.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Isamu Akasaki, Hiroshi Amano, and Shuji Nakamura won the Nobel Prize for physics for their discovery of how to produce blue light from semi-conductors, which allowed for the creation of white-light LEDs.Nakamura was awarded just $200 for his invention at the timeuntil he sued.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Nobel prizewinner Nakamura sued his former employer after getting just $200 for his invention. He's now a US citizen http://t.co/YiDe71mH15

— Hiroko Tabuchi (@HirokoTabuchi) October 7, 2014

item.title: Brussels is goingafter Amazon.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: The European Commission islaunching a formal investigation into the tax relationship between the online retailer and Luxembourg. Brusselsalleges Luxembourg improperlyoffered Amazon preferential tax rates for a decade. The EU is also investigating Apple in Irelandwhere it pays 2% in tax.

item.title: Recession fears are haunting Germany.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: After thebiggest monthly drop in industrial output in over five years,some economists are admitting the possibility of a recessionfor the euro zone's biggest economy, though some are still dismissing it(paywall). That would be bad news for the euro zone's overall recovery.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
How did Europe's powerhouse get into this parlous state? The FT's Stefan Wagstyl has a good overview (paywall):
The slowdown in Germany is not just about Ukraine. The concerns of German executives also take in emerging markets weakness in countries such as Brazil, plus the growing competitive threats from China and an industrially-resurgent US.At home they worry about high energy costs, skilled labour shortages, crumbling infrastructure and bureaucratic hurdles.Business also dislikes Chancellor Angela Merkels recent economic policy, especially the mandatory minimum wage and a costly increase in early retirements.

item.title: The EU is sniffing around Amazon's taxes.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: The European Commission is investigating suspicionsthat the easytax termsthe e-retailer has enjoyed for11 years in Luxembourg could break EU antitrust rules. Apple is facing a similar type of investigation for its agreements with the Irish government, and even Starbucks is being held accountable for its Dutch deals.

item.title: Somalia gets its first ATM.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Cash dispensers are taken for granted almost everywhere in the world, yet Somalia hadnever seen oneuntil today. Visa, MasterCard, and American Express are accepted, though you can only withdraw US dollars, seeing as how the local shillingis pretty much worthless(paywall).

item.title: US job openings hit a 13-year high in August.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: According to a report published by the US labor department on Tuesday, there were 4.84 million openjobstofill in the US in August, up from 4.61 million the previousmonth. The good news iseconomists were onlyexpecting 4.7 millionjob openings.The bad news:Hiring in August droppedto 4.6 million from4.9 million in July.

item.title: The US and Turkey are squabbling while Kobani hangs in the balance.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: As ISIL forces continued to push into the Kurdish Syrian town of Kobani, US officials are frustrated that Turkey's military isn't playing a bigger role. Turkish president Recep Tayyip Erdogan acknowledgedthat the town was about to fall, but said Turkey would notget more deeply involved unless the US agreed to give more aid to Syrian rebels.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Turkey's president says more than 200,000 refugees have fled the fighting and that ground forcesan unknown number of troops and tanksare standing by should the battle spill over into its territory. But as Benny Avni writes in Newsweek, thereare reasons to doubtTurkey's motivesfor joining the battle against the Islamic State.

[T]he Kurds, who live in the areas ISIS contests, suspect that beyond fighting ISISwho are, like the Turks, Sunni IslamistsErdogan's hidden aim is to stem the growing importance of Kurdish fighters and politicians in the coalition...Close scrutiny of last week's legislation shows that Turkey's reason for joining the war may be as much to suppress Kurdish separatists as to destroy ISIS.

item.title: Wal-Mart scraps health benefits for part-timers.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Starting in Jan. 2015, the last remaining Wal-Mart employees getting health insurance while working less than 30 hours a weekwhich totalsabout 30,000 peoplewill lose their coverage. The company says it expects healthcare-related costs to swell to $500 million this fiscal year, from a previous estimate of $330 million.

item.title: Yum Brands takes a food safety hit.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The owner of KFC, Pizza Hut, and Taco Bell said earnings per share would only grow10% this year, compared to a growth projection ofat least 20% previously. Sales in China, where it is the largest foreign restaurant chain operator, fell 14% in itsthird quarter after a food safety scandal hit one of its suppliers.

item.title: Samsung's smartphone business is disintegrating
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/276918/samsungs-phone-business-seems-to-be-falling-apart/

item.title: Face-touching is likely to blame for Spanish Ebola.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Spanish health officials say it's possible that the nurse infected with Ebola accidentally touched her face with an infected rubber glove. Meanwhile, the nurses husband is trying to save their dog from being euthanizedby the Spanish government to prevent contagion, sparkingan outpouringof support on social media.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
The World Bankpublished a report on Wednesday that says Ebola could cost West Africa's economy $33 billion in damages.
It is far from certain that the epidemic will be fully contained by December.Over the medium term... both epidemiological and economic contagion in the broader subregion of West Africa is likely.

item.title: The bidding war for Allergan gets complicated.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The manufacturer of Botox has turned down repeated takeover offers fromValeant Pharmaceuticals and hedge fund manager Bill Ackman, but might be willing to consider a bid of at least$200 per share from Activis, sources told Reuters. Valeant and Ackman are considering raisingtheir offer for Allergan by $4.5 billion(paywall), to$191 per share.

item.title: Amazon goes before the US Supreme Court for its worker stop-and-frisks.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Its workers areforced to stand in line for up to25 minutes tobe searched for stolen goods, and are suing the company for not paying them for theirtime. The Obama administrationwhich has plenty of federal employees who go through similar checks(paywall)has sided with Amazon.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Amazon has a surprising ally in its legal battle against its hourly workers: The Obama administration, which filed an amicus brief defendingAmazon'spolicies. That is most likely because the federal government requires many of its employees to go throughsecurity screenings(paywall), and does not want to pay them for the time it takes.

item.title: Which Ivy League students are defaulting on their loans?
item.dc:creator: apasickqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/276801/here-are-the-us-colleges-whose-students-have-the-toughest-time-paying-back-loans/

item.title: Breaking up ain't hard to do.
item.dc:creator: lmiraniqz
item.content:encoded: Symantecisconsidering splittingitself into two companiesone that sells security software and one that sells computer storage, according Bloomberg. Symantec follows in the footsteps of recent splitter-uppersHP and Ebay/Paypal.

item.title: Hong Kong's chief executive was accused of corruption.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: CY Leungreceived a secret 4 million ($6.4 million) payout from an Australian engineering company while serving asHong Kong's top government official, according to the Sydney Morning Herald. Leung, who is already facing calls to resign from pro-democracy protesters, claims the payments were not made in exchange for any future services.

item.title: China's economy is bigger than America'skind of.
item.dc:creator: isenqz
item.content:encoded: As widely predicted: The International Monetary Fund estimates thatthe size of the US economy was $17.4 trillion in 2014just short of Chinas economy, at $17.6trillion. Based onpurchasing powerwhich is debatable as a worthwhilemetricChina's economy wasless than half the size of the US economy in 2005; by 2019, the IMF expects it to be 20% bigger.

item.title: IKEA is now selling insurance with a side of meatballs.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Last week, the Swedish furnitureand more recently home electronicscompany started offering child and pregnancy insurance (paywall) in its native Sweden underthe "Omifall" brand. The goal is to eventually be able to offer insurance to the59 million IKEA shoppers that also carry a loyalty membership card.

item.title: UPS wants you to pick up your own packages.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: UPS is hopping on the bandwagon already usedby delivery giants likeAmazon andGoogle: it'soffering lockers customers canvisit at their convenience to collect packages. For now,UPS'slockerswill only be available inChicago and New York.

item.title: Chemistry's Nobel Prize went to better microscope inventors.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Shining artificial light on the world's smallestparticlesand using the best optics available to see themhas one problem: the wavelength of light is bigger than the particles, which dulls the view. Two Americans and one German solved that by inventing a microscope that uses molecules which are naturally fluorescent.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
http://youtu.be/UCJ6oQSdxN0
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L4bel_-cddY

item.title: 21 Kurds have died protesting Turkey's inaction against ISIL.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Kurdish minorities in cities across Turkey are furious that their government is refusing to participate in the fightingcurrently taking place in the Syrian town of Kobani, just across the Turkish border. Turkey's president has troops and tanks ready, buthe has refused to use them. Fresh US-led airstrikes are helping the Kurds fight ISIL,but notenough to prevent the town's capture.

item.title: US airports now screening for Ebola.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Despite the World Health Organizationdiscouragingairport screeningsrelated to Ebola, the US has decided to do just that. People arriving onto US soil from Liberia, Sierra Leone, and Guinea will have their temperature checked. You can be carrying Ebola and be asymptomatic, but don't tell that to your friendlyTSA officer.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The TSA says the new measures will be put in place as early as this weekend.

item.title: Mexican workers might want to consider some needed R&R.
item.dc:creator: qzroya

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/277965/the-worlds-second-richest-man-thinks-we-should-all-be-working-less/

item.title: Chinese government finds 150,000 ghosts on its payroll.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Amid a governmentclampdownon corruption and frivolous spending, the official People's Daily reports thatthe Chinese government has removed tens of thousands of peoplefrom state payrolls whowere still being paid after leaving their posts. China saysprofligate spendingon fancy cars and expensive dinners,discouraged by presidentXi Jinping, has dropped by nearly $9 billionin the past year.

item.title: Apple is unveiling more toys next week.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The company that brought you the iPhone and the iPod has scheduled its second product unveilingthis fall for Oct. 16. It's widely expected that a new iPad will be presentedpossibly in a golden huealong with new Mac computers.

item.title: Stockmarkets jump forjoy.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Asian and European stocks rallied and the Dow Jones Industrial Indexhadits best day of 2014after theUS Federal Reserve signaled it wouldkeep rates low a while longer.The IMF, on the other hand,didn't like thatidea.

item.title: Australia-Timezones-Daylight
item.dc:creator: zachseward

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: a:5:{s:5:"width";i:650;s:6:"height";i:550;s:4:"file";s:105:"/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/558/39587363/files/2014/10/australia-timezones-daylight2.png";s:5:"sizes";a:0:{}s:10:"image_meta";a:11:{s:8:"aperture";i:0;s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:0:"";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";i:0;s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";i:0;s:3:"iso";i:0;s:13:"shutter_speed";i:0;s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:11:"orientation";i:0;}}
/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/558/39587363/files/2014/10/australia-timezones-daylight2.png

item.title: Ebola may become a worldwide pandemic.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Tom Frieden, the director of the USCenters for Disease Control and Prevention, compared the disease's spread to AIDS on Wednesday. The US willbegin screening people at major airports as early as this weekend, testing the temperature of people arriving fromLiberia, Sierra Leone, and Guineathoughsome Ebola carriers are asymptomatic.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The UK will also screenpeople traveling via Gatwick, Heathrow, and on Eurostar from countries with widespread infection. Thomas Duncan, a Liberian manwho was diagnosedwith the virus after flying to the US,has died in Dallasdespite being treated withan experimental drug, bringing theEbola death tollto 3,879. The World Health Organization's death tolldoes not include Excalibur, a 12-year-old dog belonging to the Spanish nurse who contracted Ebola in Madrid. He was euthanized by Spanish authoritieson Wednesdayas a precaution to prevent any further transmission of the disease, despite a worldwide campaign to save him. Around 200 employees tasked with cleaning airplane cabins atNew York's La Guardia Airport are on strike because they fear they might catch the Ebola virus.

item.title: Gap's CEO is stepping down.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Glenn Murphy was tasked with improving the company's image and supply chain back in 2007, but his impact hasbeen aboutas exciting as thedesign of Gap clothes(paywall). He's handing the overallsto Art Peck, Gap'shead of digital. Investors don't seem that pleased;the stock is down eight points.

item.title: You aren't Americas favorite store when your finances look like this.
item.dc:creator: qzroya

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/278260/the-perilous-position-of-what-once-was-americas-favorite-store/

item.title: Google's newest autonomous vehicle is a camel.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Google Maps Street Views now include 360 shots of the Liwa Oasisin the Arabian desert, thanks toa dromedary named Raffia.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4pVCToDTbT4

item.title: PC sales may have bottomed out.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Lower prices on laptops and a market saturated with tablets and smartphones have eased the rate at which PC demand is falling globally, and have even led to sales growth in the US, according to market research firmsGartner and IDC. Gartner said third-quarter shipments to the US grew 4.2% (paywall) versus the previous year, and IDC said they rose4.3%.

item.title: Brazilianpoliticsmake strange bedfellows.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The Brazilian Socialist Party, which failed to secure a place in the runoff elections later this month,threw its weight behind pro-business challenger Aecio Nevesin his attempt to unseat incumbent presidentDilma Rousseff.

item.title: Another controversial police shooting in Missouri.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Protestersgathered in St. Louis, about 30 miles from the town of Ferguson, after a white off-duty white police officer shot and killed a young black man on Wednesday night. Apolice spokesperson claimed the officer was returning fire after being shot at by the 18-year-old; relatives of Vonderrit Myersinsisted he was unarmed.

item.title: More bad news for the German economy.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: Exports plungedby5.8% in August from the month beforethe biggest drop since 2009; earlier this week factory orders and industrial production also fell sharply. The figures will putpressure on chancellor Angela Merkel to focus more on promoting economic growth instead of emphasizing fiscal austerity.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: [caption id="attachment_278601" align="alignnone" width="640"] [/caption]

item.title: Lego ditches its less-than-awesome Shell deal.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The world's biggest toy company said it will not renew an agreement to sell toysin Shell gas stationsafter coming under pressure from a Greenpeace viral marketing campaignbut not beforecriticizingGreenpeace for creating "misunderstandings" about the way the company operates.

item.title: Talks between Hong Kong student protesters and the government are nixed.
item.dc:creator: isenqz
item.content:encoded: Chief Secretary Carrie Lam saidit was impossible to have a constructive meeting with leaders ofthe waning protest. Hours earlier, student leaders had tried to reinvigorate theoccupation and announced a new wave of civil disobedience. Theannouncement that tomorrow's sit-down is cancelledmay end upintensifyingthe unrest.

item.title: Carl Icahn is gently suggesting that Tim Cook buy back even more Apple stock.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: In the activist investor's open letter to the CEO of the company that makes the iPhone, he says Apple's current share priceis half where it should be. In April, Apple authorized $90 billion of share buybacks(paywall), up from $60 billion a year ago. Icahnwho owns$5.3 billion in Apple stockwants that number to go higher. Fast.

item.title: US jobless claims hit an eight-year low.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The number of Americans filing for unemployment benefits isdown for the week ending Oct. 4 by1,000, to 287,000. This is the fourth week in a row that number has been under 300,000something not seen since 2006.Data released last week by the US Labor Department has the unemployment rate pegged at 5.9%.

item.title: Ben Bernanke likes to role-play.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: During testimony given by the former US Federal Reserve chairmanon Thursday about the 2008 AIG bailout, it was revealed that heused the name "Edward Quince" when emailing colleagues atthe height of the financial crisis. No reason was give as to why this was done, nor what significanceif anythat particular name had.

item.title: France continues to dominate the world, at least by this measure.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/278683/with-modianos-nobel-prize-the-french-continue-to-dominate-the-literary-world/

item.title: One plan to save the world: Pee in the shower.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Students Debs Torr and Chris Dobson want to convince the15,000 students at the University of East Anglia to urinate in the shower in the morning instead of using and flushing the toilet. Doing so would conserve enough water to "fill an Olympic-sized swimming pool 26 times over," says Dobson.

item.title: You'll soon be able to window-shop at Amazon.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The Wall Street Journalreports thatthe e-commerce giant's first brick-and-mortar storewill open in time for holiday season this year on34th Streetin Manhattan, across from the Empire State Building. Itwill resemble a warehouse, reportedly,with a small inventory for same-day delivery in New York, product returns, and pickups.

item.title: Tesla's "D" is a semi-autonomous all-wheel-drive car.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Master showman Elon Musk unveiled afaster version of the Tesla Model Ssedan, powered by two separate electric motors. The company also introduced "a suite of driver aid features" that uses sensors to read and adjust to speed limit signs, and can change lanes with the flick of a turn signal.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The carefully managed hype build-up for the Tesla "D" models was spoiled slightly when USA Today blew the press embargo on the news. The paper quickly pulled its story offline, but it was preserved by the all-seeing eye of Google's web cache.

item.title: China is looking for aSiberian tiger that defected from Russia.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: "Kuzia"crossedacrossthe border from Russia in search of food, several months after president Vladimir Putinreleased him into the wild. Chinese officials said they would try to protect the animal and possibly even release cattle for it to feed onthough as Reuters noted, "China's insatiable demand for tiger products" for use in traditional medicine has driven the animalsto the brink of extinction.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Here's Putin releasing Kuzia and two other tigers into the wild in May:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GkSpJGp1DbA

item.title: Microsofts chief executive puts his foot in his mouth.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Speaking at a conference on women in technology, Satya Nadella said underpaid women shouldnt ask for raises and instead depend on good karma. He later apologized for his remark, calling it completely wrong"not to mention the fact that the Indian-born CEO seems to have adopted a distinctly Americanized concept of "karma."

item.title: Barack Obama is trying to close Gitmo again.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The US president is preparing to override a congressional ban on bringing prisoners to the United States from the detention facilityin Guantanamo Bay, Cuba,according to the Wall Street Journal(paywall). Obama tried and failed to close the facility during his first term.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Last week US federal judge Gladys Kesslerordered three hours of footage showing a Guantanamo Bay inmate being force-fed to be released to the public. The inmatewas on a hunger strike for better conditions at the prison, and histestimonywas the first to be heard by a federal judge.

item.title: The Noble Peace Prize just got timely.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The$1.1 million joint award toMalala Yousafzaithe young Pakistani activistwho was shot by the Taliban for attempting to attend schooland Indian child rights advocate Kailash Satyarthi comes as India and Pakistan are engaged yet again in deadly violence over the disputed territory of Kashmir. Twenty-three civilians have been killed in shelling by both sides, the highest number in more than a decade.

item.title: Kim Jong-un was a no-show.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: The North Korean ruler skipped theanniversary of the countrys ruling party, fueling speculation about his health. A source told Reutersthat Kim was in firm control of his government but hurt his leg taking part in a military drill.

item.title: Roughly 100 evil geniuses exist.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: That's what the head of Europol's Cybercrime unit says. All those computer hacks we hearand don't hearabout are being perpetrated by a "rather limited group of good programmers," mainly in Russia. And the "internet of things" that everyone's talking about these days"widens the attack surface a bit."

item.title: Microsoft's CEO tries removing foot from mouth.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Aftersaying that women shouldn't ask for raisesthey should just rely on "karma"rewarding them in the endSatya Nadella apologized, both on Twitter and via email, saying he was "completely wrong"to make the statement. The initial remarks came at aconference on women in the workplace.

item.title: OPEC oil production hits a new highdespite the glut.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Oil prices haven'tbeen this lowless than $90 a barrelsince 2010, yet that doesn't seem to be stopping OPEC countries from pumping it outof the ground. Production reached 30.47 million barrels a day in Septemberhigher than in the summer of 2013with a slowdown not expecteduntil late next month.

item.title: Jamie Dimon reappears after his battle with cancer.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The last time JP Morgan Chase's chiefwas heard from in public, itwas on a conference call back in July, shortly after he was diagnosed with throat cancer. TheWall Street Journalnow reports thatDimon finished his treatments last month, and will be giving a talk at the Institute of International Finance(paywall) on Friday.

item.title: Russia inserts itself between Moldova and the European Union.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: One of Europe's poorest countries, Moldova wants to enter into a trade deal with the euro zone, but during a summit in Belarus, Russian president Vladimir Putin argued thatsuch an agreement shouldn't be made without his approval. Russia pulled the same move with Ukraine last month, delaying its European pact until 2016.

item.title: Spain now has an Ebola crisis committee.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Last week, a nursing assistant in Spainbecame the first person to catch the Ebola virus outside of Africa. Since then, 14 people she'd been in contact with have been quarantined. Now Spain's prime minister has established a panel of scientific advisors to deal with the "complex and difficult"situation.

item.title: The Ebola death toll crosses 4,000.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: There's a $600 million hole in the UN's budget to battle the virus, and unfortunately, not every country is as adept as Nigeria in dealing with the disease on such constraints. As alarming as the 4,033 deaths so far is the almost 8,400 confirmed cases. Africa's poor infrastructureis only hampering containment and treatment efforts.

item.title: Is the chip industry headed for a downturn?
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: Semiconductorstocks fell on Friday(paywall)part of a generallybloody week in the marketsafter Microchip Technology issued an earnings warning. Though it's no giant, the Arizona-based chipmaker is seen as an industry bellwether. Still, the problems may not be generalized; all eyes will be on Intel earnings on Tuesday, which are expected to be healthy.

item.title: Russian sanctions go galactic.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: Some of the food sent to astronauts on theInternational Space Station has been hitby Russia's retaliatory sanctions against Europe. Contrabandcandy and dried fruit from family members can be sent via foreign supply vehicles but is banned from traveling on the Russian Soyuz, the only manned spacecraft that goes to the station.

item.title: Let's play "Global Financial Crisis."
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: The US and UK will on Monday hold the first transatlantic "war game" simulating ameltdown(paywall)ata large American or British bank, reports the FT. Senior officials and representatives from big banks will gather to plot outwho would have to talk to whom.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://youtu.be/KXzNo0vR_dU?t=1m22s

item.title: There is definitely a second NSA leaker.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: Citizenfour, a new documentary aboutEdward Snowden, the former National Security Agency contractor who spilled a vast trove of US secrets,confirmswhat Americanofficialshave thought for months:Another source, more senior than Snowden wasand possibly inspired by him,has been providingmaterial to the journalists Snowden worked with.

item.title: There's another queue at Heathrowfor Ebola screenings.
item.dc:creator: gguilfordqz
item.content:encoded: The UKs health secretary announced that Ebola screenings are set to begin in one of the world'sbusiest airports, despite the health ministry initially dismissing them as "a pointless endeavor," and health secretary Jeremy Hunt warned thatpeople shouldnt be surprised if a handful of Ebola cases are found. Five US airports will also start screening this weekif you refuse, you could face a three-week quarantine.

item.title: 400,000 evacuated in Eastern India as cyclone hits.
item.dc:creator: gguilfordqz
item.content:encoded: Parts of the states of Odisha and Andhra Pradesh were cleared of people asCyclone Hudhud tore throughthe area, and at least eight people have been killed. In general, fewer people are dying (paywall) from such eventsas Indian officials are better prepared with each passingyear.

item.title: A St. Louis protest ends in arrests.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Police in riot gear arrested at least 17 peoplewho had gathered for a spontaneous sit-in at a convenience store to protest the killing of a black teenager last week by a white police officer. Rallies also took place in nearby Ferguson to criticize police accountability afterthe killing of another black teenager there in August.

item.title: Turkey opens its military bases.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: American forces will be able to use Turkish military sitesto train moderate Syrian opposition forcesand engage in activities in Iraq and Syria, after facing weeks of criticism for not doing more to combat Islamic State fighters, some of whom are on the brink of capturing a Syrian town on the Turkish border.

item.title: The reading level of US presidential speeches is falling.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Either presidents are trying to appeal to a broader voter base, or theyre getting dumber.

item.title: Software can detect your emotional state as you type.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: That means were another step closer toachievingemotional AI.

item.title: Pandora Medias growing pains are starting to hurt.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/279574/pandora-medias-growing-pains-are-starting-to-hurt/

item.title: A French economist wins the Nobel for "taming powerful firms."
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: Jean Tirole, a 61-year-old economist from the Toulouse School of Economics, has won the Nobel Prize in economics. His work on "how to understand and regulate industries with a few powerful firms"is topical, given worries about how internet giants like Amazon and Google might abuse their market power to stifle competition and innovation.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences published a summary of Tirole's work for the general public (pdf) as well as experts in the field (pdf). The Guardian has a good summary of the economics prize, which was first awarded in 1969.

item.title: Bill Ackmans fund lists with a whimper.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: The activist investor known for bigbets on Herbalife, Allergan, and other companiessaw shares of his fund, Pershing Square, fall by as much as 10.8%on their first day of trading in Amsterdam. The outspoken hedge fund manager said proceeds from the IPOaround $3 billionwill help him take aim atotherfirms.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: "The stock is down, which is good," Ackman told reporters. "If it went up we'd have sold it too low."

item.title: Au revoir to the UK's stake in Eurostar.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: The British government is putting its 40% holding in the high-speed rail service linkingLondon and the continent, up for sale. No matter who buys the stakewhich is valued at around 300 million ($482 million)the service will still be run by the majority owner, state-run French railway SNCF.

item.title: The Russian ruble won't stop falling.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: The currency is setting yet more record lows against the dollar today, despite the central bank spending $6 billionof its reserves to stem the slide in recent days.Central bank chiefElvira Nabiullina revealed the figure during a speech to lawmakers, amidsigns that locals are starting to hoard dollars, euros, and other firmer currencies.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: [caption id="attachment_280215" align="alignnone" width="640"] [/caption]

item.title: Gaza's reconstruction efforts get a $5.4 billion boost.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: More than 50 countries have pooled together the resources that the Palestinian Authority needs to rebuild Gaza after its 50-day bombing by Israel earlier this summer. Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas had only asked for $4 billion.

item.title: North Korea wants the US to collect its dead soldiers.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Over 8,000 American soldiers went missing during the 1950s Korean War. Excavation to find their remains was halted in 2005, when the US pulled out, citing a lack of security. Now Pyongyang is asking the US to return and collect the remains of an estimated 5,300 troops.

item.title: Somalia now has a bank that can move money internationally.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The SWIFT banking system that financial intuitions use to wire funds to one another has a new member todaythe International Bank of Somalia is the first bank in the country to offer access to international markets. Just last week, Somalia also got its first ATM.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: In further good news on the Somali front, the country now has a postal service andfor the first time in its historyzip codes.

item.title: Oil prices continue to slide on strong supply and weak demand
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: Global oil prices have now fallen below $90 a barrel and could fall further, but oil analysts are split as to how long the decline will last.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/278945/oil-prices-have-plunged-through-another-psychological-barrier/

item.title: ...pushing gasoline prices below $3 a gallon in some US states.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: American drivers are paying on average $3.26 a gallon ($0.86 per liter), with some states charging less than $3. That's down 46 cents from its peak in May, and down 13 cents year over year. The last time gas was this cheap in America was Nov. last year.

item.title: 113-year old forced to fib about her age to join Facebook.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The social network won't let you input a birth year before 1905, so Anna Stoehr had to tell a white lie in order to open an account. But young people are much more likely to lie about their age to get on Facebook.

item.title: The Pentagon has a plan to deal with climate change.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: US defense secretary Chuck Hagel detailed the 20-page report (pdf) at a conference in Peru, saying: "Climate change is a global problem. Its impacts do not respect national borders. No nation can deal with it alone." Solutions were light, but areas that need to be monitoredsuch as bases in Virginia at risk of floodingwere highlighted.

item.title: Robot snakes are comingthanks, Carnegie Mellon.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Researchers analyzing the movement patterns of sidewinder rattlesnakes have created a robotic serpent that can "climb on inclinations of up to 20 degrees." Next challenge: auditioning for 'Snakes on a Plane II.'

item.title: Kim Jong-un is back.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The North Korean leader reappeared on state-owned media after a six-week absence, touring a new residential housing complexwhilewalking with a cane (and witha still impressivehead of hair). As the Associated Press' Foster Klug noted, the media circus around his absence showseven when Kim was nowhere, he was everywhere.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
https://twitter.com/cctvnews/status/521817682400645121/photo/1
https://twitter.com/nknewsorg/status/521915727952232448

More shots emerge: Kim Jong Un swimming via @KCNAWatch pic.twitter.com/Zk92SkMCe0

— NK NEWS (@nknewsorg) October 14, 2014

item.title: The US rethinks Ebola.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The infection of a nurse in Dallas who treated an Ebola patient is forcing health authorities to weigh new safety protocols,including possiblyrelocating patients to one of the four US hospitals that has a secure biocontainment unit.

item.title: Iliad lost interest in T-Mobile US.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: The low-cost French telecom company became the third suitor to drop plans to acquire the US mobile carrier.Deutsche Telekom, which owns 66% of T-Mobile US, may prefer to sell its stake after US regulations are loosened, sources told Reuters.

item.title: Hong Kong police clear protest barricades, again.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Hundreds of officers removed barriers and tents froma major road in the city's central business district. OnMonday, the removal of barricades presaged violent attacks on the demonstrators by masked men. Quartz's Heather Timmons is reporting from the scene.

item.title: Italy is enlisting its army to grow marijuana.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: It's legal for medicinal use, and the government hopes themilitary can bring costs down.

item.title: More grim news for the euro zone.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: A welter of woeful data was released today, with industrial production across the regiondropping sharply, Italy and Spain stuckin deflation, and a key index of economic sentiment in Germany dropping near a two-year low. Finance ministers have been meeting in Luxembourg(pdf) to debate how tokickstart growth in the moribund monetary union.

item.title: 'Tis the season to spend less.
item.dc:creator: kabirchibberqz
item.content:encoded: Sales of luxury goods worldwidewillrise by 2% this year,the slowest pace since 2009, according to Bain. The consultants blamed slowing spending in China, pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong, and sanctions on Russia. The newscameas Burberry became the latest high-end firm to revealsome softening in growth from Chinese consumers."

item.title: Catalonia calls off its independence vote, sort of.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: The restive Spanish region will not hold a referendum on secession next month, its leader said. The controversial vote, which the national government says is illegal, will instead bea "big survey" that won't use the region's official electoral roll. Spain's prime minister called the watered-down plan"excellent news."

item.title: Citigroup is shutting branches in 11 countries, including Japan.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The bank is continuing its pivot away from consumer banking and back to business clients, it announced as it delivered third-quarter results, which beat revenue estimates. JP Morgan,whoseresults accidentally came out early on a third-partywebsite, beat estimates too.

item.title: Our thirst for oil is waning.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The International Energy Agency says world oil consumption this year will only increase by 650,000 barrels a dayhalf what itwaspredicting in Juneand the lowest in five years. With the price of oil hitting fresh lows today, Europe on the brink ofrecession, andChina's domestic economy slowing down, next month's OPEC meeting will be closely watched.

item.title: Out with Ireland's "double Irish," in with the "knowledge box."
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: An infamous corporate tax rule used by the likes of Apple, Google, and Facebook will bephased out by2020. But Ireland is already preparing a newwayfor global firms avoid taxes on intellectual property with ascheme called the "knowledge box."

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg donates $25 million to the fight against Ebola.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The money will go to the US Centers for Disease Control, where it will be used to fight the disease at its source: Guinea, Liberia, and Sierra Leone. Last month, Bill Gates pledged $50 million to the cause, but the United Nations says it still needs $600 million.

item.title: Questions are being raised about the Waldorf changing hands.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The $1.95 billion purchase of New York's Waldorf Astoria hotel by a Chinese insurance company is ruffling some feathers in Washington. US officials fear that the property, which frequently hosts diplomats and heads of state, might see the installation of spy equipment included in the plans for a major renovation.

item.title: Manifest Destiny is still a popular American pastime
item.dc:creator: stefanqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/280635/mark-zuckerberg-is-the-latest-tech-giant-to-buy-part-of-an-island/

item.title: South Korea may have to junk its entire national ID system.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: It's been compromisedto such an incredible degree80% of the population, includingthe president, have had their details stolen viacredit-card companiesthat the country of 50 million people is considering giving every adulta fresh new ID number. A decision is expected this year.

item.title: When Finns are in trouble, they call in the Swedes.
item.dc:creator: jasonqz
item.content:encoded: Finland is faltering, as its paper industry and Nokia-centric tech sectorsteadily lose ground to rivals. Following a credit rating downgrade, Finnish prime minister Alexander Stubb swallowed his regional pride and commissioned former Swedish finance minister Anders Borg to produce a report with advice for getting back on track.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: "Sweden has managed to set a good example as regards responsible public finances and the economy's growth rate," Stubb said.

item.title: A British-accented parrot lost for years returned to his California owner.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: He now speaks Spanish and calls out for a man named Larry.

item.title: Ugly scenes in Hong Kong.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Forty five people were arrested for illegal assembly, barricades were torn down, and pepper spray was used against protestors who refused to move froma busy road in the early hours of Wednesday morning.One handcuffed opposition party member was allegedly beaten by police for four minutes.

item.title: Converse cracks down on copycats.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The shoe maker responsible for the Chuck Taylor sneaker, a high-top basketball shoe introduced in the US in 1917, is taking action against companiesin Canada, Australia, Italy, Japan, and China for allegedly selling imitations of its classic design. The sneakerlost popularity as a sports shoe in the 1970s, but later found life as the shoe of rockers, hipsters, and punks.

item.title: New Ebola cases may reach 10,000 per week by December.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The disease is still acceleratingin Sierra Leone, Guinea, and Liberia, and the World Health Organization warned that the current infection rate of 1,000 per week could increase tenfold by December 1. Separately, Doctors Without Borders said 16 of its staff have been infected with the virus, and nine have died.

item.title: Renewed PC demand gives Intel a lift.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The chipmakers fourth-quarter revenue forecast of $14.7 billion was better than analysts were expecting, as PC sales demand grew. But Intels mobile and communications division is still struggling: it reported third-quarter revenue of just $1 million and an operating loss of $1.04 billion.

item.title: A flag-carrying drone causes havoc at a soccer game.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Serbia was hosting Albania in a Euro 2016 qualifying match when a drone flew in with a "Greater Albania" banner, provoking a brawl involving players, team officials, and spectators. The match was canceled.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: This videoshowsthe whole rather frightening scene unfolding.

item.title: AbbVie reconsiders its proposed Shire takeover.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The US drugmaker said it needs to weigh the "fundamental financial benefits" of a 32 billion ($51 billion) takeover of its UK rival, in light of new rules aimed at preventing American companies from headquartering abroad in order to avoid taxes. Shire's share price fell 27% on the announcement.

item.title: Airbus receives its largest-ever order.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: Low-cost Indian carrier IndiGo placed an order for 250 short- to medium-haul A320sthe biggest orderby number of planes in Airbuss history. The total value of the deal, which would be worth$25.7 billion at list price, was not disclosed.

item.title: US retail sales fall, but Americans sure do love their gadgets.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Economists were expecting a 0.1% fall in retail sales in September, but the number came in at 0.3% instead. This followed a 0.6 percent August gain. Sales of "core" itemsthings that aren't cars, food, clothesfell 0.2%. Sales did jump, however, in the electronics department: 3.5%. That new iPhone may actually be helping the economy.

item.title: Bank of America posts unsurprisingly terrible numbers.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The bankagreed to fork over$16.6 billion to settle its case with the US Department of Justice and six US states in August (related to toxic mortgage securities), so it isn't shocking that third-quarter profits came in at just $168 million, down from $2.5 billionayear ago. Revenues were down 1%, to $21.4 billion.

item.title: Investors are making a mad dash for the worlds safest bonds right now.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/281361/global-markets-are-genuinely-freaking-out-right-now/

item.title: A second health worker in Texas has Ebola.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: The Dallas hospital that treated the Ebola patientThomas Duncan before he died said an employee tested positive after reporting a high fever. Nurses at the hospital say they received flimsy protective gear and were not properly trained to handle the highly contagious virus.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The CDC says the health care worker in question was on a flight on MondayFrontier Airlines' Flight 1143 from Cleveland to Dallas-Fort Worthand that anyone who was onboard should contact it immediately: 1-800-CDC-INFO. The disease is still acceleratingin Sierra Leone, Guinea, and Liberia, and the World Health Organization warned that the current infection rate of 1,000 per week could increase tenfold by December 1. Separately, Doctors Without Borders said 16 of its staff have been infected with the virus, and nine have died.

item.title: Asia catches Wall Street's whiff of fear.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Amomentarypanic in financial marketssent stocks plunging and US Treasury yields down below 2%, thoughthe Dow recovered about two-thirds (paywall)of what itlost. It seemsfears of a global slowdown are finally hitting homeJapanese stocks were down more than 2% in morning trading, part of a broader Asian sell-off.

item.title: Bono achieves self-awareness
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: The U2 frontman admitted to having "a touch of megalomania" after forcing the band'snew album oniTunes users.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Bono attributed the misguided decision to release the album that way to a "drop of megalomania, touch of generosity, dash of self-promotion, and deep fear that these songs that we poured our life into over the last few years mightn't be heard."

item.title: Malaysia detains 14 people that it says were trying to join ISIL.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Three of them were allegedly leaders of a celltrying to recruitMalaysians to fight inSyria,including one whomanaged a Facebook page to attract followers. Since April, 36 people have been arrested for trying to join the Islamic State, and another 30 people are known to have succeeded, according to Malaysian authorities.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: In related news, ISIL is said to be planning an attack on the Ein Al-Assad military airbase in Iraq. And the Pentagon has officially declared a name for the US-led campaign against ISIL in Syria and Iraq: "Inherent Resolve."

item.title: A nuclear fusion reactor that could fit in the back of a truck.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Lockheed Martinsays that within a decade, it should be able to make a 100-megawatt reactor that measures just 10feet by 7 feet10 times smaller than what's possible with today's technology. A working prototype isn't expected for another five years, however, so don't clear out your truck bed just yet.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://youtu.be/UlYClniDFkM

item.title: HBO is breaking the cable bundle.
item.dc:creator: zachseward
item.content:encoded: The premium network will start selling access to its internet service, HBO Go, without requiring a subscription to pay TV. Corporate parent Time Warner announced the move at a presentation for investors, hours before rival Netflix was set to report quarterly earnings.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: https://twitter.com/twxcorp/status/522399084511244288

In 2015 @HBO will launch standalone HBO service in the US, will work with current partners & explore models with new partners

— Time Warner (@twxcorp) October 15, 2014

item.title: The US budget deficit hits a six-year low.
item.dc:creator: stefanqz
item.content:encoded: Standing at just $483.4 billion, according to the latest figures from the US Treasury Department, this is the smallest deficit as a share of the economy since president Barack Obama took office in 2007. The deficit peaked in 2009 at $1.4 trillion.The Congressional Budget Office said earlier this year that the deficit is likely tostart growing again in 2016.

item.title: Workers' attitudes to women bosses have changed since the 1950s, but not a whole lot.
item.dc:creator: isenqz

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: http://qz.com/281349/americans-prefer-male-bosses-even-though-women-are-better-for-business/

item.title: Russia sanctions get more bite.
item.dc:creator: glichfieldqz
item.content:encoded: The UK has decided to block a Russian-owned investment fund's 5 billion ($6.4 billion) purchase of a German energy firm with gas fields in the North Sea, the FT reports. (paywall). That's even though LetterOne's owner, Mikhail Fridman, is not one of the oligarchs who is facing sanctios for his ties to the Kremlin.

item.title: Hong Kong protests get a second wind.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: A video allegedly showing policebeating a pro-democracy politician brought more protestors to the streets, where theyattempted to occupy a key road and block a police station. Hong Kong police responded with more pepper spray.

item.title: The richest 1% owns half the world's wealth.
item.dc:creator: rmacauleyqz
item.content:encoded: And if you havea $798,000 in cash and assets, consider yourself one of them.

item.title: Netflix and HBO step into the ring.
item.dc:creator: apasickqz
item.content:encoded: Time Warner will offer an online-onlysubscription to HBOin the US, in an attempt to reach the 80 million homes that have broadband but not cable.
